story:
I have no qualifications, no formal skills, as a survivor of domestic violence, I am now proud to be driving change, but 25 years ago I thought I had no options to change my life. Not true! I have changed my life! You can change your life!

One rule needed 

 

My name is Madi! MADI stands for Make A Difference Idea!

My goal in life is to Make a Difference though Ideas! Everyone's Ideas!

Seven Billion Ideas into Action' plus your idea!

My mission is to change just one person's life every day by empowering them so they understand their value to society. The first part of my life was learning, domestic violence, no qualifications, failing in business, making mistakes. The second part was hard work, building companies, learning by doing and learning from making even more mistakes! Each step of the way I became stronger and that is when I started to understand that I had a privilege and a responsibility to share my story with others and support them in turning their ideas into action. Getting the message out was the hardest part, engaging others in Change – so I put myself in the spotlight, centre stage and have been sharing my story ever since.

 

 

Are you ready to take the journey?

My personal journey has taken me through the University of Life. I established my first company from my kitchen at home, which grew to two factories and 35 staff. I received the honours of Asian Woman of Achievement and the UK’s Best Boss.

Today, I am an Entrepreneur, international speaker, including two TEDx Talks and a policy influencer! I established and run the Madi Group, a group of private profit making companies, social enterprises and not for profit organisations. The philosophy of my group is to create innovative ideas tailored to local action which can achieve global impacts beneficial to economically, socially, culturally and environmentally sustainable societies. I am a “Social Capitalist"!

I use the hashtag #MadiEffect. What is "Madi Effect"? Some call me a “human magnet”, others said, “A tsunami of energy”, “I carry her bead with me everywhere”, “I have heard her speeches three times and I can’t wait till she speaks here again”.

 

 

Shariqa Habib described me as “a wake-up call that every individual should receive once in their lives". Who is Shariqa Habib? …The Co-author!  25 years ago you would have said Madi Sharma? Who? I am great at spotting the potential in people and giving great talent an opportunity – it is why I have a great team behind me. Shariqa is a young Madi, inspiring, passionate, Global Change Maker and spent three months on a one to one with me to produce the interview that is now Madi No Excuses! Watch this space – she will be bigger than me!

When you support me, we can support others together. When you support me, together we can make a Commitment to drive change - change in your life and change in the lives of others. This project is not about words, it's about actions, our actions! 

The book 'Madi No Excuses! 'is a manual to give you the right guidelines to make it happen. The exercises will challenge you!  It is an easy read, pick up and put down assessment of where you are in your life and where you want to go. It is 300+ pages of No Excuses, my personal story, other people stories, case studies, exercises, questions, challenges and quotes to make the reader focus on their Absolute Commitment underlined with a ‘No blame culture’ and definitely a ‘No Excuses’ ethos.’

Through this book I will tell you how I transformed my life from ‘Victim to Change-Maker’. And I will be the first to tell you if I could do it, so can you. But how exactly? Very simply; a Blank Piece of Paper, a Commitment Bead and the ‘7 Fs’, which I applied and apply every day to achieve my ‘Absolute Commitment’.

Now I need to publish the book. The total financial input I need to print, publish and distribute the first edition of this book (3000+ copies) is £33,333.

For each donation of at least £11.00 the donor will be rewarded with at least a signed copy of the book. A first edition copy! This is the same price the book will cost when it will go on sale in bookshops following the initial success of the crowdfund campaign. Additionally enclosed inside each book is a unique Commitment Bead, to ensure your goals are achieved.  Each bead is hand crafted in Murano glass and no two beads anywhere in the world are the same. These are unique just like you!

Once you have decided what your 'Absolute Commitment' will be in life, you then put the Bead inside your wallet. Every time you see the Bead you will remember your commitment to make Change. That is how the Change happens and ultimately, that is how I am going to turn Seven Billion Ideas into Action… This starts only when it's possible to publish the book.

Why is publishing the book so important? Actually, I have already given out 27,000 Commitment Beads and that equates to 27,000 Ideas to Action. I even gave one to His Holiness the Dalai Lama. Now, I need to reach more people much quicker, as my time on Earth is running out. I would like to set up a Foundation to help those facing challenges in the world. So, I hope you understand, this is by no means a small project…  "From a little acorn, huge oak trees grow".

I want 'Madi No Excuses!' to reach as many people as possible, as I know it has the power to change lives! I and my team have the testimonials to share with you. 

Madi No Excuses! is not a book which fits into a box, it is not a business book, it is not a self-help book and it is not another inspirational story... It is a book for YOU. I even give you the choice of to have a cream or a black cover ... The contents are the same! 

My team and I are using Indiegogo as a launch pad as we are passionate about innovation. We love engaging with the crowd and are firm believers in promoting a new way of thinking, which contributes to the sharing economy. Indiegogo represents what we stand for as a brand. We want to develop an entire line of products, in addition to this book in order to empower people to change and live the life they want to live, where they are valued, respected and appreciated. Therefore, the Madi No Excuses! Workbook is the first in the line of Madi No Excuses! products. You can write notes in the margins of the book Madi No Excuses!, or as I do you can keep a day-book with you every day to keep your ideas, inspirations, connections or “notes to self in”... Whatever you do, keep it by your bed at night because the best ideas come then! The workbook is blank – just the 7 Fs at the front to keep you on track, and as it is branded, it constantly reminds you to stay focused and help you complete your Blank Piece of Paper... No Excuses!  

My team and I believe that Indiegogo and its community are people similar to us and we share the same values. We are like minded individuals, who wish to reach out and hold out their hand to others, to empower those who want to turn ideas into action.

The impact will be a global society where human capital, ideas and innovation from all of us, irrespective of educational attainment or social background, will be valued, appreciated and respected.

    ​Budget breakdown 

Failure is not an option, so we know we will achieve our goal. There are No Excuses! as to why we will not achieve our goal of £33,333, but our objective is to involve as many people as possible to spread the word about the Change we are trying to make because only this way can we have a fairer and more inclusive world for all who share this planet. Your role in contributing is not just as a financial donor, but as a partner in the project and its success.

Join the Change with us on Facebook and Twitter! Post pictures of yourself making the Change and of your dreams becoming a reality! My team have set out to create a Madinaut community that expands across the world!  Please use the hashtags #MadiEffect #NoExcuses!

Gandhi said, “You must be the Change YOU want to see”

Madi says, “You must be the Change YOU want to see – NO EXCUSES!”

Will you be the Change with us?

NO EXCUSES!

story:
Summary

"Bloody Holiday" is a photography project about the refugee crisis. We are asking for your support to pre-finance a photography exhibition and a photobook to raise funds and awareness for OXFAM "Stand Together" campaign for the refugees. The profits from the sale of the photos and books will go to providing water for displaced families in Syria and in the refugee camps of Lebanon and Jordan : 

  • I'm Francois Marmion, I have done a photo-reportage last year about the refugees arriving in the Greek Islands from Syria, Irak and other countries and war zones, 
  • I met and interviewed many refugees and shared their personal stories. I have travelled a lot around the world but, from a human standpoint, this was the toughest experience in my life, 
  • I also investigated the role of social media in the crisis, particularly with regards to on-line smuggling. Refugees themselves encouraged me to talk about this situation,
  • The refugees were landing in the middle of highly touristy islands but never really met the tourists. This is why I chose to describe the situation of the refugees with the words of tourism and on-line bookings... A powerful way to understand what their daily life was and to think about our own standards in life and our perception of the refugees, 
  • With Leonore Saintville and Olivier Bertin at Balthaz'Art, we dedided to organize an exhibition on this topic in order to raise awareness and funds for OXFAM and their campaign for the refugees, "Stand together" (the money will go to providing clean water for the refugees),
  • However, this is very costly to publish a book and to produce the framed pictures and we do not have the budget for that, 
  • This is where we need your help to pre-finance the production of the art pieces and the printing of the book,
  • The profits from the sale of the book and the pictures will go to OXFAM for the refugees.
     

What We Need

We need at least £6,500 to be able to organise the exhibition and to publish the book. This might sound a lot but this is the buget to cover:

  • image printing, framing and mounting (the major cost involved here),
  • posters and postcards printing,
  • book publishing (the second higher cost)
  • and venue costs. 

Once we have produced all these materials, we will be able to sell them with all the profits going to Oxfam's campaign for the refugees "Stand together".
 

What You Get - Perks

We have a wide range of perks for all budgets, from a simple set of postcards to large picture prints and private visit. One of the key items that you can buy is the book of the reportage, Bloody Holiday. 

We truly need your help to pre-finance the exhibition and the publishing of the book. Without your support, we won't be able to help Oxfam and the refugees will miss your contribution, particularly children in need for clean water, shelter and school.

A precision about delivery of the perks: when you buy the perks you can receive them by post, then you have to give your adress and pay shipping fees. If you want to collect your perks on the opening night of the exhibition, please put Aaland Island as shipping location and then your normal address - we use this little trick since Indiegogo does not do optional shipping.

Here are the various perks that you can get:

  • Signed photographies:

Pictures come in three sizes: 20x30cm, 40x60cm and 56x84cm.

To order your picture:

  1. Chose the perk according to the size you want (see column on the right)
  2. Pay for the perk
  3. Then, you can have any of the pictures in the photo gallery below the video that has a sale number # (look at the title underneath the pictures) 
  4. Write me an e-mail at frmarmion@gmail.com mentioning your name, the size and the sale number of the picture that you have chosen, so that we can print the exact picture that you want

For the Christmas Special signed photographies (format 20x30 cm), the two pictures that you can get are the two on the right below. The picture with the wall, name "Laundry Service" shows a wall where the refugee dry up their wet jeans in the sun after crossing from Turkey to Greece. But it isn't any wall. It is the wall of the Caste of the Knights of St-John in Kos, a castle built at the time of the crusades, showing us that history strikes back and back again in these eastern mediterranean places. The other picture "No one is illegal" is a graffiti in the streets of Kos, at a time where there was a deep divide in the Greek population about what to do about the refugees.

  • Fine art pictures by Francois Marmion:

We are conscious that you might not want to buy of picture of the refugee crisis for your home or for a gift. Therefore, we sell fine art pictures from Francois Marmion to finance the exhibition about the refugees. The market value of these 40x60cm pictures is usually around £300-350. They are heavily discouted here to help with the project.

To order your picture:

  1. Chose the perk Fine Art picture 40x60cm (see column on the right)
  2. Pay for the perk
  3. Then, please go to http://www.francoismarmion.com/fr/portfolio-123...
  4. Chose an image in that gallery 
  5. Write me an e-mail at frmarmion@gmail.com mentioning your name and  the picture that you have chosen, so that we can print the exact picture that you want
     
  • A set of five postcards (with messages from refugees on the back) for £20:
     


 

  • an A3 poster of the photo exhibition "Bloody Holiday" - A3 for £25:

 

  • The photobook "Bloody Holiday", 100 pages with photographies and illustrations, that you can get for £35. The book was shortlisted at the Kassel photo book dummy festival in June 2016 in Germany. This book is graphically design as a parody of a tourist brochure to make us think about what is it to live the life of a refugee.

 


 

  • More complete than the photobook alone, the whole "Bloody Holiday" package (below) is the original way the author wanted to present his work, the concept being a parody of the packages provided by tour operators. It does includes the book, a set of 5 postcards messages from refugees, a map of Kos with the index of all the pictures in the book and 3 "excursions" flyers explaining the money made by the smugglers, all this for £55. 

 

  • Private visit with the author


    We will plan with you for a private 1h30mn visit for a group of 5 persons - within the opening hours of the gallery - with personal comments and discussion with the photographer, followed by a drink at the gallery.  
    In addition to the visit, ou will get 1 whole Bloody Holiday package including: the photobook "Bloody Holiday" signed by the author, a set of 5 refugee postcards, a set of 3 flyers explaining the money made by the smugglers, and a map with an index of all the pictures, given to you during the private visit.
     
  • For the price of a life

    If you really want to support OXFAM strongly this is the one! 
    £1,100 is a very symbolic amount.
    This is on average what adult refugees had to pay during the summer of 2015 to cross the sea from Turkey to Greece on an inflatable boat. Not even including the life jacket... 

    For this amount you get: the private visit + 5 photobooks Bloody Holidays signed by the author + a signed photography 40x60cm framed.

Please note that:

  • If we don't reach the entire goal, donators will get their perks (books, photos, postcards). For the books though, we will need at least ten backers to be able to print them, if not, backers will be reimbursed. If we don't raise enough money, we might not be able to organise the exhibition and we will miss our goal to help Oxfam. This is why we need your help !!!! However, the profits on the perks, whatever they will be, will go to Oxfam. 
     

A direct impact thanks to your donation

 

OXFAM is helping 4 to 5 million people every year.

Our contribution to the OXFAM's Stand together campaign for the refugees will go to OXFAM's projects in Syria and in the neighbouring countries such a Lebanon and Jordan, where millions of Syrians have found shelter.

Oxfam has had an office inside Syria since July 2013, responding alongside other agencies to the urgent need for clean water. An estimated 35% of water treatment plants in Syria have been damaged during the conflict and there are concerns over water contamination.

Since 2013 Oxfam has helped ensure 2.8 million people have access to clean, safe water, by:

  • Making sure the local water systems run,
  • Installing water tanks in schools and teaching the children good hygiene,
  • Improving sewage systems.


Oxfam supplied water tank

65 tons of water and sanitation equipment sent to Syria 

Oxfam is working primarily to make sure people have enough clean water, and are able to keep themselves clean and healthy:

  • in Damascus - OXFAM has brought two water treatment plants back on-line using multiple truck-sized generators, capable of continuously pumping more than 700,000 extra litres of water per hour - enough to deliver safe water to around 500,000 people in Damascus city and the surrounding province
     
  • in Aleppo - the Suleiman Al-Halabi water pumping station is the main water source for Aleppo city, and Oxfam is committed to keeping the generator, which they previously installed, operational. Water pumped from here reaches beneficiaries across conflict lines. Oxfam  has had a second huge generator manufactured and, depending on security and access, plan to install it to increase the capacity of water delivered to the Aleppo population of perhaps 1.5 million people.
     
  • in Hama, the equipping of the Lwebde pumping station has been completed, facilitating the supply of clean water to 133,000 conflict affected people. The security situation continues to make operations very challenging.
I am particularly happy that the money would go to water for Syrians because one of the refugees I met in Kos and with whom I am still in touch is a Syrian water treatment engineer. He was made prisoner by the so-called Islamic State because he worked for the government and he manage to get away. He is now in Germany but I am sure he would appreciate to know that thanks to my pictures, we might get some improvement for the water systems and the Syrian people. 
 

Oxfam is also active with the Syrian refugees in the neighbouring countries:

  • in Jordan - Oxfam work in Za'atari refugee camp, where about 80,000 Syrian refugees are housed, and in Jordanian communities where Syrian refugees are hosted. Oxfam  helps provide water to Za'atari's 12 districts, constructs toilets, and manages waste and the cleaning and maintenance of wash blocks. They also help teach good hygiene in the camp. They have constructed more than 300 septic tanks for better waste management, installed 75 private toilets for vulnerable families and built a water tank at the Syrian border to give 45,000 people there access to water
     

     

  • in Lebanon - Oxfam has reached more than 250,000 vulnerable people in Lebanon. They have provided 3,200 hygiene kits, along with lessons on good hygiene, and toilet cleaning kits, built or repaired over 1,100 toilets, ensuring that each is shared by no more than 20 people and delivered 10 million litres of water through water trucking - meaning people can get clean water for drinking, cooking and washing.

We count on you. Your contribution will make a difference for a kid, a mother, a family in distress!

Risks & Challenges

Our main risk is clearly not to have enough money to fund the exhibition and/or the publishing of the book:

  • if we don't meet our target but we feel that we can still do an exhibition, we will adapt the format of the exhibition to the final funds that we raise. If the funds are not enough to produce an exhbition, we will at least provide the perks to our backers and give the profits to Oxfam.
     

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money, we count on you to:

  • get the word out and make some noise about our campaign: like and forward our posts and links (use the Indiegogo share tools), tell your friends about the project, come to the exhibition in January 2017 in London
  • you can also volunteer for Oxfam at http://www.oxfam.org.uk/get-involved
  • or directly help a refugee in your neighboorhood

The other picture "No one is illegal" is a graffiti in the streets of Kos, at a time where there was a deep divide in the Greek population about what to do about the refugees.

Fine art pictures by Francois Marmion:
We are conscious that you might not want to buy of picture of the refugee crisis for your home or for a gift. Therefore, we sell fine art pictures from Francois Marmion to finance the exhibition about the refugees. The market value of these 40x60cm pictures is usually around £300-350. They are heavily discouted here to help with the project.
To order your picture:

Chose the perk Fine Art picture 40x60cm (see column on the right)
Pay for the perk
Then, please go to http://www.francoismarmion.com/fr/portfolio-123...

Chose an image in that gallery 
Write me an e-mail at frmarmion@gmail.com mentioning your name and  the picture that you have chosen, so that we can print the exact picture that you want 

A set of five postcards (with messages from refugees on the back) for £20: 

 
an A3 poster of the photo exhibition "Bloody Holiday" - A3 for £25:

 
The photobook "Bloody Holiday", 100 pages with photographies and illustrations, that you can get for £35. The book was shortlisted at the Kassel photo book dummy festival in June 2016 in Germany. This book is graphically design as a parody of a tourist brochure to make us think about what is it to live the life of a refugee.

 
 
More complete than the photobook alone, the whole "Bloody Holiday" package (below) is the original way the author wanted to present his work, the concept being a parody of the packages provided by tour operators. It does includes the book, a set of 5 postcards messages from refugees, a map of Kos with the index of all the pictures in the book and 3 "excursions" flyers explaining the money made by the smugglers, all this for £55. 

 


Private visit with the authorWe will plan with you for a private 1h30mn visit for a group of 5 persons - within the opening hours of the gallery - with personal comments and discussion with the photographer, followed by a drink at the gallery.  In addition to the visit, ou will get 1 whole Bloody Holiday package including: the photobook "Bloody Holiday" signed by the author, a set of 5 refugee postcards, a set of 3 flyers explaining the money made by the smugglers, and a map with an index of all the pictures, given to you during the private visit. 

For the price of a lifeIf you really want to support OXFAM strongly this is the one! £1,100 is a very symbolic amount.This is on average what adult refugees had to pay during the summer of 2015 to cross the sea from Turkey to Greece on an inflatable boat. Not even including the life jacket... For this amount you get: the private visit + 5 photobooks Bloody Holidays signed by the author + a signed photography 40x60cm framed.

Please note that:
If we don't reach the entire goal, donators will get their perks (books, photos, postcards). For the books though, we will need at least ten backers to be able to print them, if not, backers will be reimbursed. If we don't raise enough money, we might not be able to organise the exhibition and we will miss our goal to help Oxfam. This is why we need your help !!!! However, the profits on the perks, whatever they will be, will go to Oxfam.  

A direct impact thanks to your donation
 

OXFAM is helping 4 to 5 million people every year.
Our contribution to the OXFAM's Stand together campaign for the refugees will go to OXFAM's projects in Syria and in the neighbouring countries such a Lebanon and Jordan, where millions of Syrians have found shelter.
Oxfam has had an office inside Syria since July 2013, responding alongside other agencies to the urgent need for clean water. An estimated 35% of water treatment plants in Syria have been damaged during the conflict and there are concerns over water contamination.
Since 2013 Oxfam has helped ensure 2.8 million people have access to clean, safe water, by:

Making sure the local water systems run,
Installing water tanks in schools and teaching the children good hygiene,
Improving sewage systems.

Oxfam supplied water tank

65 tons of water and sanitation equipment sent to Syria 
Oxfam is working primarily to make sure people have enough clean water, and are able to keep themselves clean and healthy:

in Damascus - OXFAM has brought two water treatment plants back on-line using multiple truck-sized generators, capable of continuously pumping more than 700,000 extra litres of water per hour - enough to deliver safe water to around 500,000 people in Damascus city and the surrounding province 
in Aleppo - the Suleiman Al-Halabi water pumping station is the main water source for Aleppo city, and Oxfam is committed to keeping the generator, which they previously installed, operational. Water pumped from here reaches beneficiaries across conflict lines. Oxfam  has had a second huge generator manufactured and, depending on security and access, plan to install it to increase the capacity of water delivered to the Aleppo population of perhaps 1.5 million people. 
in Hama, the equipping of the Lwebde pumping station has been completed, facilitating the supply of clean water to 133,000 conflict affected people. The security situation continues to make operations very challenging.

I am particularly happy that the money would go to water for Syrians because one of the refugees I met in Kos and with whom I am still in touch is a Syrian water treatment engineer. He was made prisoner by the so-called Islamic State because he worked for the government and he manage to get away. He is now in Germany but I am sure he would appreciate to know that thanks to my pictures, we might get some improvement for the water systems and the Syrian people.  
Oxfam is also active with the Syrian refugees in the neighbouring countries:


in Jordan - Oxfam work in Za'atari refugee camp, where about 80,000 Syrian refugees are housed, and in Jordanian communities where Syrian refugees are hosted. Oxfam  helps provide water to Za'atari's 12 districts, constructs toilets, and manages waste and the cleaning and maintenance of wash blocks. They also help teach good hygiene in the camp. They have constructed more than 300 septic tanks for better waste management, installed 75 private toilets for vulnerable families and built a water tank at the Syrian border to give 45,000 people there access to water 

 

in Lebanon - Oxfam has reached more than 250,000 vulnerable people in Lebanon. They have provided 3,200 hygiene kits, along with lessons on good hygiene, and toilet cleaning kits, built or repaired over 1,100 toilets, ensuring that each is shared by no more than 20 people and delivered 10 million litres of water through water trucking - meaning people can get clean water for drinking, cooking and washing.

We count on you. Your contribution will make a difference for a kid, a mother, a family in distress!

Risks & Challenges
Our main risk is clearly not to have enough money to fund the exhibition and/or the publishing of the book:
if we don't meet our target but we feel that we can still do an exhibition, we will adapt the format of the exhibition to the final funds that we raise. If the funds are not enough to produce an exhbition, we will at least provide the perks to our backers and give the profits to Oxfam. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute with money, we count on you to:

get the word out and make some noise about our campaign: like and forward our posts and links (use the Indiegogo share tools), tell your friends about the project, come to the exhibition in January 2017 in London
you can also volunteer for Oxfam at http://www.oxfam.org.uk/get-involved

or directly help a refugee in your neighboorhood

story:
Short Summary

After five years ago my entire photographic archive was stolen, I decided to carry out some ideas, including a book about the popular festivals in Ecuador but with a different look, decided I should stay away from social fact but should give you an overview of the author and this is the product of that idea. It's name is "de espalda a la fiesta"

I worked for five years, the project is implemented in 95% of its production, the aid request of you is to complete the design and printing.

At the same time I am working a project in the most picturesque neighborhood of Quito city, it's name is La Tola, this project is in the 40% execution, so your help will also serve to complete the project of La Tola.


What We Need & What You Get

 For five years I traveled around Ecuador producing new works, creating new images, recovering almost thirty years of labor.

With the money collected I can finish ongoing projects, but I can start the new project on the province of Manabi in Ecuador, then southerly direction continue the road to Peru and Bolivia, always looking with a look of author.

The first piece, which is already finished, is Ecuador. I’m planning on making the next one on Peru, and a third one that will be composed in Bolivia. An idea I have been nurturing for several years.

Ecuador’s volume is finished, designed and ready for print. I had to stop producing though, because I ran out of money. That is the main reason why I have not been able to finish it, and the reason why to keep up with this project, I need some financial assistance.

Project expenditure will be distributed as follows:

1,000 to complete the photographic production "de espalda a la fiesta", is advanced by 95%

20,000 to cover costs of design and printing "de espalda a la fiesta," 1,000 books.

4,000 to complete the photographic production of "La Tola" project on the picturesque district of the city of Quito. Is advanced in 50%.

10,000 to begin photo production of "Manaba" a project about culture "montubia" of farmers in the province of Manabi province with the manifestation d stronger culture of the Ecuadorian coast.

My custom work two to three projects simultaneously.

The Impact

Ecuador’s volume legally exists; it already has an ISBN registration and it is designed as a whole unit. It comes in a large format, 23 x 23 cm of 120 pages.

Today, for the development of the project I need funding to cover printing and publishing costs, plus a small amount to start production of the new volume, Peru.

The progress made thus far, has been funded by my own means, but at this point I need some help. That is why I am asking for your assistance, so I can complete the project that I have started and developed with so much effort.

story:
You are invited to support the printing and initial promotional costs of The Great Mother Bible, a book that Gaia/Earth Mother specifically asked me in November 2013, to write with her (and the Great Divine Mother).

What is The Great Mother Bible About?

The Great Mother Bible is a series of conversations between Mother and myself, similar to Neal Donald Walsch’s Conversations with God series. This profound and unique Bible offers Earth Mother's story on how Western society went off course several thousand years ago in denying the Sacred Feminine, and offers spiritual wisdom to help usher in the New World being born presently.

In the course of writing this book the Great Divine Mother came through to communicate with me initially, which was quite humbling. She introduced herself and then passed it over to Earth Mother, explaining that she would be speaking through Earth Mother part of the time. I could discern the difference between the two of them.

Mother speaks about the Quantum Divine Love that surrounds us all the time, and how we exist in a multi-verse of energy and consciousnesses. Our cultural conditioning has led us astray from the balance and harmony we’re supposed to be experiencing here on Earth. She discusses the role of aliens on our culture and dominant religions. She also laments how few people seek to connect with her and is rather opinionated about many of our actions here on her in these ‘interesting’ times.

Mother encourages us to shed the fear-based illusions of our society and open our hearts up to the Christ Consciousness and deep compassion. More than anything though, she repeatedly talks about how much love she has for us. She wants us to remember who she is as Earth Mother. She is hard-wired to heal and we need to help her. There is so much more beyond that. This is truly a book to complement the “Great Father” Bible that we all grew up with. Some excerpts can be found here along with the full “Table of Contents”.

About Mare

It has taken me several years to feel comfortable being open about the spiritual listening and writing I do. I have been gifted with the capability to communicate directly with Earth Mother, the ancient consciousness who is our planetary caretaker. I have recently been called “The Voice of Earth Mother” by a rather gifted Native elder.

In addition, I’m a multi-award-winning author and nature mystic with an environmental background. My spiritual studies include more than 18 years with Native American teachers along with authoring two books prior to this one: If I gave you God’s phone number.... Searching for Spirituality in America and Messages from Mother.... Earth Mother.

About Earth Mother

Yes, Earth Mother does exist. She is very ancient, more ancient than our planet. As a powerful spiritual being, she was assigned to Earth to coordinate evolution co-creatively with Creation and all the other spiritual beings here on this planet. Her work far extends that also. Just because our Western culture has denied her existence for thousands of years does not mean she does not exist. Medicine people all over the world have been communicating with her for thousands of years.


Surrendering to Mother

In June, 2012, just days after being diagnosed with lymphoma, I was asked to participate in a small and powerful ceremony for Earth Mother with a gifted Algonquin medicine man. She specifically requested that we do this ceremony together and told him that it would help her with her healing.

Shortly after the ceremony for Earth Mother in early June, 2012, I started to communicate very clearly with her and agreed to surrender to her. This was how Messages from Mother.... Earth Mother was written in only five weeks during the summer of 2012. Several gifted Native elders have confirmed I am closely connected with Earth Mother.

Then in November 2013, Mother woke me up at 5 AM and told me that I was not to move out to Washington State. Instead she wanted me to stay in the house I was renting (and about to go into foreclosure) and write The Great Mother Bible. This book has been her idea from the inception.

Early Praise for The Great Mother Bible

“Mare Cromwell has been given a gift. The gift of wisdom, words, and the ability to hear the Great Mother. For spiritual seekers everywhere, I predict The Great Mother Bible will become a fixture in your library.” 

             — Nancy Mills, Founder - TheSpiritedWoman.com

“This book will inspire some readers but will infuriate others. Mare Cromwell’s profound relationship with the Great Mother offers a dialogue that is witty, wise and comical. Mare writes about "unseen forces" but her luminous accounts bring a lucidity and reality to their insights that are uplifting, intriguing, and wondrous.”

              — Stanley Krippner, Ph.D., co-author Personal Mythology

“These are powerful and wise messages from Earth Mother, shared by her beloved daughter Mare Cromwell, to encourage humanity to awaken their hearts and find peace in these struggling times. The world will find these sacred writings most brilliant.”

               — Bavado (Rainbow Thunder Heart), Eastern Shoshone Nation, President - Earth Wisdom Foundation


Campaign Budget

Production Expenses

  • Professional Editing (paid)          1450
  • Commissioned Painting- Cover (paid)        800
  • Graphic Designers - Cover & Interior (paid)    3800
  • Printing 1000 copies (seeking funding)    3425

Promotion Expenses

Book Expo of America Autographing Slot           1970

  • BEA Fee - $795
  • Travel, meals, lodging - $425
  • 150 books (w/shipping) - $750

  Total Indiegogo Budget  $5395

If more than $5395 is raised, then additional funds can go toward the following:

Stretch Budget

Additional Promotion Expenses

  • Early Promo Expenses  (Gratis Books - reviewers, Radio shows)         450
  • International Book Fair Representation      450
  • Promo Materials for Book Table (Book cards, banner, etc)       225
  • Table Fees - various events          550
  • Website Development          750
  • Professional Photographer          275
  • National Book Competition Fees      1250
  • International New Age Trade Show West    1750

  Add'l Promotion Total      $5700


My Campaign Goals

For the past three and a half years, I have been living primarily off my savings which has shrunk by more than two-thirds, to focus on writing for Mother and heal from lymphoma.

Publishing a book independently isn't cheap. It cost me $6500 in 2012 to produce Messages from Mother.... Earth Mother. This does not include any of the extensive promotional expenses. After giving retailers, wholesalers and distributors their cut (and paying for printing costs), I earn about $4.47 per paperback sold. That means I have to sell a lot of books just to break even. Your pledge will reduce the financial risk I'm taking to publish The Great Mother Bible.

As of late February, 2015. I have completed the manuscript, published the ebook (Kindle and other formats available), and the hard copy book is in the final design stages. To date, I’ve put more than $6200 into book production expenses (which includes editors, graphic designers, and hiring a gifted artist to do the painting on the front cover, per Mother’s instructions).

I’m about to expend an additional $3425 for printing 1000 books, and seek your support in this.

Then there are the book promotion expenses, which are not insignificant. Mother wants me to take the book as an official Autographing Author to the premier publishing event in the nation - the Book Expo of America, in New York City in late May. The autographing slot fee is $795, and that does not include traveling, lodging, meals or the cost of the books themselves, as I’ll be giving away 150 copies (approx $750). She also wants me to take the book to the International New Age Trade Show in Denver, June 2015.

This book has the potential to influence readers’ spiritual lives in the same way as Neale Donald Walsch’s Conversations with God series, yet in a way that embraces the Divine Feminine and helps us heal our relationship with our planet.

Also, this book is a launching platform for the “Great Mother Wisdom Gathering” that was first held in fall of 2014 and will continue annually.

In addition, Earth Mother has given me the vision of creating a Great Mother Center for Love and Healing. This seed funding will help manifest this greater vision to create a healing center built on sustainability principles and the great healing love of the Mother in all her myriad archetypes.


If your budget is tight, you can still support The Great Mother Bible

Please help spread the word! Share this campaign with friends. If you write book reviews, I'd also be happy to send an electronic copy or hard copy of the book to you. All press is good press. If you bought either of my first books and liked it, give it a good review on Amazon or GoodReads. If you know any women’s circles or progressive spiritual centers, you can give them my name to help set up a talk or Skype appearance. You can encourage your libraries to carry this book. Most libraries have a policy of ordering a book if more than one library member requests a book. There's lots of ways to help support a writer that aren't monetary (although, money is really helpful). 

Whatever funds are raised will help bring Mother's messages to a broader audience. And her messages are so needed during these interesting times. If I don't raise all the funds requested, the book will still be printed, but with a smaller print run probably. And I will explore other creative sponsorship opportunities to support my expenses with the Book Expo of America and the International New Age Trade Show.

Thank you so much for your support. Mother thanks you. She loves all of us so, so much. It’s beyond words. And she yearns for us to reconnect with her. It is not too late to help bring our planet back into balance and harmony. This book offers significant wisdom to manifest this. We can all join in to co-create a most beautiful future ahead.

Hugs, bigLove to all of you,

Mare

ps. More information on the donated perks is below.


$45 Watercolor Notecards from Julie Gabrielli, and Book

Donate $45 and you’ll receive a printed three-pack set of cards of limited edition watercolor cards from the gifted artist, workshop leader, and green architect, Julie Gabrielli of www.juliegabrielli.com. Plus you’ll also receive an autographed copy of “The Great Mother Bible”. International supporters – please add $15 for shipping in the “additional contribution” section. 


$65 Handblown Fluted Glass from Marcia Wiley & Ebook

Contribute $65 and receive a handblown Fluted Wine Glass (6.5 oz) from the very gifted Seattle glass artist, Marcia Wiley. Wileyware glasses are a gorgeous blend
of the elegant and the practical. Each hand-blown drinking glass is a hand-held kaleidoscope and a total joy from which to drink. These stemless wine glasses are collectors items. www.wileyware.com. International supporters – please add $25 for shipping in the “additional contribution” section. 

You will also receive you’ll receive the ebook version of The Great Mother Bible and a personal email “Thank You” from me.



$125 Holistic Vet Consult with Christina Chambreau & Book

Contribute $125 and receive 30 minutes of free coaching with the internationally known holistic vet Christina Chambreau (http://christinachambreau.com/), to get you further on the path to health for any of your pets. ($75 value). Plus you’ll receive an autographed copy of The Great Mother Bible and a bumper sticker that says “What Would Earth Mother Do?TM”. International supporters – please add $15 for shipping in the “additional contribution” section.


$150 Distant Energy Healing with Sherry Tuegel & Book

Donate $150 and receive a 45 minute distant healing session (valued at $120) with the very gifted teacher and energy worker, Sherry Tuegel. Sherry is a charismatic speaker, teacher, and energy worker based in Baltimore. She offers sessions and classes that remove limiting beliefs, ignite hearts and embody the raw sweetness of the present moment.  Sherry's sessions combine the power of All Love, Reiki, Matrix Energetics, PSYCH-K and Tantra to support your intention to transform into the love and light that you are. www.body-beloved.com

Plus you’ll receive an autographed copy of The Great Mother Bible and a bumper sticker that says “What Would Earth Mother Do?TM. International supporters – please add $15 for shipping in the “additional contribution” section.

Also, this book is a launching platform for the “Great
Mother Wisdom Gathering” that was first held in fall of 2014 and will continue
annually.
In addition, Earth Mother has given me the vision of
creating a Great Mother Center for Love and Healing. This seed funding will
help manifest this greater vision to create a healing center built on
sustainability principles and the great healing love of the Mother in all her
myriad archetypes.
If your budget is tight, you
can still support The Great Mother BiblePlease help spread
the word! Share this campaign with friends. If you write book reviews, I'd also
be happy to send an electronic copy or hard copy of the book to you.
All press is good press. If you bought either of my first books and liked it,
give it a good review on Amazon or GoodReads. If you know any women’s circles
or progressive spiritual centers, you can give them my name to help set up a talk or
Skype appearance. You can encourage your libraries to carry this book.
Most libraries have a policy of ordering a book if more than one library member
requests a book. There's lots of ways
to help support a writer that aren't monetary (although, money is really
helpful). 
Whatever funds are raised will help bring Mother's messages to a broader audience. And her messages are so needed during these interesting times. If I don't raise all the funds requested, the book will still be printed, but with a smaller print run probably. And I will explore other creative sponsorship opportunities to support my expenses with the Book Expo of America and the International New Age Trade Show.Thank you so much for your support. Mother thanks you. She
loves all of us so, so much. It’s beyond words. And she yearns for us to
reconnect with her. It is not too late to help bring our planet back into
balance and harmony. This book offers significant wisdom to manifest this. We
can all join in to co-create a most beautiful future ahead. Hugs, bigLove to all of you,
Mareps. More information on the donated perks is below.
$45 
Watercolor Notecards from Julie Gabrielli, and Book

Donate $45 and you’ll receive a printed three-pack set of cards of limited edition watercolor cards from the gifted artist, workshop leader, and green
architect, Julie Gabrielli of www.juliegabrielli.com.  Plus you’ll also
receive an autographed copy of “The Great
Mother Bible”. International
supporters – please add $15 for shipping in the “additional contribution”
section.  
$65 Handblown Fluted Glass from Marcia Wiley & Ebook
Contribute $65 and
receive a handblown Fluted Wine Glass (6.5 oz) from the very gifted Seattle
glass artist, Marcia Wiley. Wileyware glasses are a gorgeous blend
of the elegant and the practical. Each hand-blown drinking glass is a hand-held
kaleidoscope and a total joy from which to drink. These stemless wine glasses are collectors items. www.wileyware.com. International
supporters – please add $25 for shipping in the “additional contribution”
section.  
You will also receive you’ll receive the ebook version of The Great Mother Bible and a personal
email “Thank You” from me.

$125 Holistic
Vet Consult with Christina Chambreau & Book
Contribute $125 and receive 30 minutes of free coaching with
the internationally known holistic vet Christina Chambreau
(http://christinachambreau.com/), to get you further on the path to health for
any of your pets. ($75 value). Plus you’ll receive an autographed copy of The Great Mother Bible and a
bumper sticker that says “What Would Earth Mother Do?TM”.
International supporters – please add $15 for shipping in the “additional
contribution” section. 

$150 Distant Energy Healing with Sherry Tuegel & Book
Donate $150 and receive a 45 minute distant healing session (valued at $120) with the very gifted
teacher and energy worker, Sherry Tuegel. Sherry is a charismatic speaker, teacher, and energy worker
based in Baltimore. She offers sessions and classes that remove limiting
beliefs, ignite hearts and embody the raw sweetness of the present
moment.  Sherry's sessions combine the power of All Love, Reiki, Matrix
Energetics, PSYCH-K and Tantra to support your intention to transform into the
love and light that you are. www.body-beloved.com 
Plus you’ll receive an autographed copy of The Great Mother Bible and a bumper sticker that says “What
Would Earth Mother Do?TM. International supporters – please add $15
for shipping in the “additional contribution” section.

story:
Hello!

I am Julianna Faludi. 

I have several short stories published, and this is my first novel. I have channeled in my experiences of city life, the art & design scene, brands and the world of academics.

​This book is standing in the crossroads of the past and the future. The characters are driven by the vision of how to shape a livable & healthy, sustainable future.

Augusta (23) is an art history student working for a multinational insurance company. She launches her blog shoes&architecture, and becomes a micro-influencer to build up her own 3D-printed shoe brand. She paves her way to success but faces walls–sexism, gelousy, abuse and heartbreak get in her way. United with her friend they decide to be in charge of their lives. They launch their brand and grow their blog, to become successful startuppers in London. Augusta lives with her brother, a musician and dropout who becomes a copywriter. Their relationship is full of tension and love, and they grow in different directions. The book has several layers:

  • experience of ruin pubs, the cities of parties, art,  music&dance: Budapest and Berlin
  • movement in space and time to get better opportunities for living out the dream
  • a startup of 3D printed shoes, that goes from the fablab to the corporate business
  • touching moments of affection, disillusion, sisterhood, gender bias, failure&success
  • music, dance, culture and design interwoven
  • the book ends–where the new "walls" begin–created by the lockdown due to the pandemic.

The book is ready, it needs proofreading & a great cover to be ready to go!

Fund this project to get the book a cool cover & tight text for an ebook+print version.  

We Need Your Help to Make it Possible.

More information: https://www.juliannafaludi.com/wall-to-wall.html

Engaged? Spread the Word & share this call! 

or Find a Perk to get the book.

story:
Project Summary

Greetings,  

My name is Dayna Jean Wolter and on behalf of Friends Of Brian Murphy LLC, I thank you for considering our crowdfunding campaign to publish “Thy Life of Brian-A Collection of Poems & Sonnets” by Brian Murphy.

Our Minnesota Renaissance Festival circles lost one of the BEST of us when Brian returned to stardust August 9, 2020.  In the Fall of 2020, several of his Beloveds came together to brainstorm how we could fulfill one of Brian’s dreams…. to be a published poet, playwright, and author.

Excerpt of "Thy Life of Brian–A Collection of Poems & Sonnets" by Brian Murphy:

If, as 'tis said, our lives are made of dust,

I'll conjure wind and gale and hurricane;

Yet even these, I do not much distrust,

Have not the force to drive away my pain.

If, as 'tis told all flesh is as the grass,

I'll make a blasted desert of this tract

With searing fires that Hell will not surpass,

And yet my grief will well outlive the act.

Had I loved but her beauty, t'were enough

To rob my days of joy, my nights of sleep,

To turn my heart to sinew, cold and tough,

Warmed only by these hot salt tears I weep;

But I dared love her spirit - O! Vain quest!

I love her soul, and that's worth all the rest.

-Brian Murphy

Brian was an accomplished actor, playwright, poet, musician, visual artist, educator, and mentor for most of his life. He performed at the Minnesota Renaissance Festival in Shakopee, MN for over 30+ years, creating memorable and highly impactful characters such as Da of Irish Cottage, Master William Shakespeare, and Mr. Sticks, the Fae Riddler.

Over the years, Brian brought his magic to 100’s of thousands of patrons, and mentored 100’s of peers to be the best creatives they could be. To say Brian was “generous of Spirit” with those he loved and cared for would be an egregious understatement, as he shared so much of his creative gifts, wisdom, and encouragement whole-heartedly, and with deep conviction.

This poetry book and a children’s book called “Willaby Wannabe Wizard” (which we hope to launch a 2nd campaign for the children’s book should the 1st be successful) are part of the legacy we hope to make a reality in 2021 for Brian’s family and all those who loved him.

 

The Task At Hand. What We Need & What You Get

To fund this book of Poems & Sonnets we need to crowdfund $15,000.

As Renaissance Festivals all over the country are dark due to the pandemic, many artisans and performers livelihood have been halted, or brought to the bone. Fully funding this literary project will allow for our managing team to be able to hire and offer living wages to many folks in our Renaissance community who have skill sets as copy editors, illustrators, visual artists, and technology creatives while they weather this pandemic and economic disaster storm.

Limited Edition Artwork Perk!! (only 35 available):

  • Brian Murphy as William Shakespeare Portrait 16 x20 Print

The wonderful artist and musician Mark Raigna (https://markraigna.com/fine-art) has been commissioned to create a unique Limited Edition 16 x 20 portrait of Brian as Master William Shakespeare, whom he portrayed at the Minnesota Renaissance Festival for many wondrous years.

This perk is limited to 35 prints at $300 each, and includes S&H in the continental USA.

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign makes you a part of something far bigger than owning a glorious book of poems. You indeed become a part of a larger Community of people who live life unapologetically, and as fearlessly, as they can.

Brian’s life asks us all…what is YOUR legacy? If you have held back and not done what your heart burns for…what are you waiting for? Time is never our friend. Go…do The Thing.. It is exactly what the World needs….now….more than ever to heal, and be a better place for all of us.

In the spirit of Brian’s incredible love of his community, mentoring, and desire for folks to reach their full creative potentials, should our crowdfunding exceed our fiscal goal, any extra funds will be shared between three local creative schools here in the Twin Cities.

These funds will be made into scholarships in Brian’s name for:

Irish music classes at Celtic Junction (https://celticjunction.org/)   

Improvisational theater classes at HUGE Theater (https://www.hugetheater.com/)  

Writing and poetry classes at The Loft Literary Center (https://loft.org/)

 

Risks & Challenges

Self-publishing has become a lot less challenging than in years past, but it is not without its risks. We are working with an established and respected publisher to bring this project to bear.

Luckily, the managing team has publishing and production experience in many facets of the creative world, and we are confident that these literary projects will be able to be completed with the funds being raised.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support the project but can't financially back it, there are other ways you can help us reach our goal. These include:

  • Share the project on social media
  • Send the project to specific people you think would be interested in it
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Go out and do YOUR Thing…the World needs your special kind of magic…seriously…go do it…please.

Thank you again for your help in making this project a reality. Humanity is at a crossroads . We need more creative magic and medicine. Let’s do more good than harm, and help lift each other up.

Brian is looking out for and cheering for us all.

Blessings and be safe,

~ Dayna Jean Wolter & members of Friends Of Brian Murphy LLC

story:
hella [hel-uh]
adjective
Bay Area slang to describe something or someone as a lot of, really, very

pinay [pin-ahy]
noun
a woman of Filipino descent or origin; a Filipina


Frustrated by the lack of representation in mainstream and traditional Filipino media, Hella Pinay was created in 2016 as a platform for us to tell our own diverse, complex stories; a space to cover emerging creative culture while also exploring the many intersections and nuances of identity in the Filipino/a/x diaspora. Since then, we've published hella articles on hellapinay.com, created original editorial content, thrown parties in NYC/Manila/the Bay, connected with a super-engaged global community, and built a team of contributors from Oakland to Pampanga to Toronto.

In the Tagalog language, being unapologetic is often referred to as being “bastos" - meaning vulgar or shameless - which in turn, is generally used as a put-down. We always try to reclaim that narrative by giving the Filipinx community, particularly women and gender non-conforming folks, a space to shine unapologetically.
 

Hella Pinay Print Issue #01

Hella Pinay has been operating as a digital publication since 2016, but we’ve always intended to do a print magazine because...we love print! And we really feel that these beautiful stories and images deserve to be immortalized in that medium.

In 2020, we went on hiatus for almost a year - and when we relaunched in early 2021 with renewed passion, intention, and an expanded team, it just felt like the right moment to make our print publication a reality. In a time when our ideas and lived experiences around connectivity are dramatically changing, we wanted to create something tangible to transport and bring together in a way that only print can.

Hella Pinay Issue #01 is loosely centered around the theme of ‘Resilience’ - like living through this intense time of social change, plague, very public anti-Asian (and anti-QTBIPOC, for that matter) rhetoric, violence and murder - yet still celebrating being able to create and find joy and healing and community. It contains over 100 full-color pages of interviews, fashion editorials, art and photography + two gorgeous covers:

Cover #1: A fashion editorial featuring Chicago-based singer/songwriter/DJ King Marie.

Cover #2: A fashion editorial + interview with photographer Guerrilla Davis and model Pearl Teese on their experiences as Afro-Filipinos navigating and overcoming racism, gender and sex based hate in our families and communities, and providing a important but overlooked perspective on how Blasians experience #stopasianhate.  Part of collective We Are The Ones We’ve Been Waiting For’s ongoing series of shoots for Arm The Girls, a mutual aid initiative building power and safety with Black and Brown queer and trans femmes.

Also featuring: 

  • The High Priestess: Fashion editorial featuring singer-songwriter Kristina Alcordo, with styling/set design by Cat Calica.
  • For The Future PH: Interview with co-founder Issa Barte on creating Youth-led change by providing avenues of action through stories in service of the people and planet.
  • Diosa Blooms: Filipinx sister-owned flower shop in the heart of the Mission, SF. Filipino snacks-inspired floral editorial, with collage by Agnes Ito.
  • Alexandra Jacob: Interview with the NY-based ballet dancer incorporating bondage elements into a centuries-old art form.
  • Maylee Todd: Editorial featuring the Toronto-based multimedia artist and musician + an interview on her forthcoming ambient synth alt-pop album “MALOO” on Stones Throw Records.
  • Moreno Morena: Editorial collaboration with Juro Ongkiko of Philippines-based Moreno Morena, “an ongoing project in appreciation of dark skin.”

  • The Living Library PH: Feature on artist ((( O ))) and Palawan-based educational zero-waste store The Living Library, which aims to bring people back to the gifts and magic of plants and encourage sustainable living.
  • Ouida: Editorial featuring SF-based singer/songwriter/visual storyteller Ouida + an interview on her forthcoming EP


To celebrate the print magazine release, we’ll be throwing a hybrid virtual/IRL festival - our first since the lockdown started in March 2020! And for anyone who’s attended any of our events, you already know what kind of energy we bring <3

We’re also going to be dropping some brand new merch created in collaboration with designer Vi Viray - ensure that you get one of our limited edition hoodies by pre-ordering in Tier 6 perks!
 



Who We Are

Hella Pinay is a queer-led independent media/events company building bridges across creative subcultures in the Philippines and Filipino/a/x diaspora. We aim to cultivate healing spaces of joy, self-expression and consent that center women and nonbinary folks as artists and creators.

  • Founder & Editor-in-Chief: Stephanie Gancayco
  • Managing Editor: Pia Cortez
  • Music & Marketing Manager: Bella Arios
  • Fundraising & Grants Coordinator: Breanne Batara
  • Merch/Print Design: Vi Viray

    In addition to our core team, the squad also includes 7 contributing writers/content creators, two resident DJs, a graphic designer, and an astrologer.


Why Do We Need Funding?

For the past four years, we've been doing it for the community and for the love - and while that will always be at the heart of Hella Pinay's work, it's also been a major roadblock to putting out the kind of original content we want to, and that we believe our audience and community deserves.

Since day 1, we've been a completely independent organization, paid out of our founder’s own very smol pocket [hi, it me] and fueled by passion for this community and its immense creativity, resilience and history. By backing Hella Pinay, you’re funding the belief that our creativity has value and that we can make it in media and entertainment. Support AAPI women and GNC folks. Support Filipinx creative culture. Help us reclaim the narrative and create the reflections we want to see of ourselves in the world.

The money we raise will allow us to compensate our talented team for their valuable labor and create more sustainability around this work - as well as help turn this into a biannual print publication.

All funds raised through this campaign will go towards:

  • Publishing and distributing our first print issue. The more money we can raise, the more copies we can print and the more stockists we can stock.
  • Paying our team and contributors. There is so much talent in our community, and yet so often we are asked to work for free. We don’t want to perpetuate that cycle.
  • Helping us throw our first hybrid IRL/virtual festival. It's gonna be so tite fr!


The Impact

We believe it's super important to disrupt the traditional media landscape and create the reflections of ourselves that we want to see in the world. To see people who look like us represented in an empowering, beautiful way positively impacts not just ourselves, but also has intergenerational and cross-cultural effects.

Asian culture is not a monolith; within the over 7,000 islands that came to be grouped together and called the Philippines under Spanish colonization, we have over 180 living languages alone. Too often our identities are erased within the already marginalized “Asian American” demographic - despite Filipinos being the second largest Asian immigrant group to the US. While solidarity amongst Asian Americans (and with ALL QTBIPOC groups) is critically important, we feel like it’s important for us to also make our own voices heard, to embrace and share our own cultures, and to be proud of who we uniquely are.

There’s more than enough room for all of us.


Other Ways To Help:

All other monetary donations are welcomed and appreciated. 

  • Compelled to give more? Have something else in mind? Please reach out to our Fundraising and Grants Coordinator at breanne@hellapinay.com for additional and custom sponsorship opportunities.

    <3 <3 <3 we appreciate you <3 <3 <3

By backing Hella Pinay, you’re funding the belief that our creativity has value and that we can make it in media and entertainment. Support AAPI women and GNC folks. Support Filipinx creative culture. Help us reclaim the narrative and create the reflections we want to see of ourselves in the world.The money we raise will allow us to compensate our talented team for their valuable labor and create more sustainability around this work - as well as help turn this into a biannual print publication.All funds raised through this campaign will go towards:

Publishing and distributing our first print issue. The more money we can raise, the more copies we can print and the more stockists we can stock.

Paying our team and contributors. There is so much talent in our community, and yet so often we are asked to work for free. We don’t want to perpetuate that cycle.

Helping us throw our first hybrid IRL/virtual festival. It's gonna be so tite fr!

The ImpactWe believe it's super important to disrupt the traditional media landscape and create the reflections of ourselves that we want to see in the world. To see people who look like us represented in an empowering, beautiful way positively impacts not just ourselves, but also has intergenerational and cross-cultural effects.Asian culture is not a monolith; within the over 7,000 islands that came to be grouped together and called the Philippines under Spanish colonization, we have over 180 living languages alone. Too often our identities are erased within the already marginalized “Asian American” demographic - despite Filipinos being the second largest Asian immigrant group to the US. While solidarity amongst Asian Americans (and with ALL QTBIPOC groups) is critically important, we feel like it’s important for us to also make our own voices heard, to embrace and share our own cultures, and to be proud of who we uniquely are.There’s more than enough room for all of us.
Other Ways To Help:All other monetary donations are welcomed and appreciated. Compelled to give more? Have something else in mind? Please reach out to our Fundraising and Grants Coordinator at breanne@hellapinay.com for additional and custom sponsorship opportunities.<3 <3 <3 we appreciate you <3 <3 <3

story:
We are E, Q & L, three young graduates who have come together to publish Boshemia Magazine, a work of feminist creativity and collaboration. The three of us behind the magazine are best friends, who first came together in the south west of England whilst at university. We now operate trans-atlantically between the USA and UK. This work is a labour of our love and passion for raising women's voices up loud and supporting our sisters however we can.

 

Boshemia Magazine is a little treasure of enlightenment. Issue 01 was published in June 2017, and has successfully sold several hundred issues in a handful of stores in the UK and the east coast of the USA. It features a diverse range of work, from pop culture reviews to personal essays, satire to poetry, creative writing to spotlight interviews and political commentary. We also feature artwork, photography and illustrations. Many who have read the magazine and are new to feminism have described it as "feminism in a really digestible and approachable form". Others who are already very familiar with the feminist movement have hailed it as a comprehensive and on-the-mark piece of feminist literature. Boshemia Magazine is a significant publication because it is unique, it is accessible, it is beautiful, it is personal. We collaborate with women writers and artists from across the globe to create this piece of work.

 

Your contribution will go towards paying our contributors and printing Issue 02 of the magazine.

(pictured above: the creators page from Issue 01)

At this stage, funding is our greatest challenge. We have no shortage of talented artists and writers and collaborators who are working with us; we simply want to pay them. As a feminist organisation this is particularly important to us, as we recognise that mere exposure is not sufficient payment. Not being able to offer remuneration in exchange for labour excludes many people who do not have the economic freedom to take time out to write or create; thus, many voices who need to be heard the most are, once more, left unheard. We’re not okay with that. Those are the very voices we need to amplify the most, and that is the point of Boshemia.

(pictured above: contributors page from Issue 02)

Supporting this campaign demonstrates that you give economic value to the creative work of women in the feminist movement. An investment in Boshemia Magazine is not just an investment in us, but an investment in the future of independent print media and the representation of women worldwide. We earn nothing from the blog or magazine at this early stage, but it is imperatively important to us that we are able to pay the people who take the time and energy to contribute their work to the magazine. Collaboration is a key element of Boshemia; without collaboration and without working together with our sisters across the globe, the feminist movement is at a standstill.


 

The only thing that prevents our reach from growing is our financial ability to keep up with printing demands. We printed three small batches to keep up with demand of shops, but still could only afford to stock a dozen stores because of the high cost of small-batch printing. Every pound / dollar earned from a magazine sale has gone directly back to printing the next batch. With this campaign money, we are able to order in bulk instead of small batches. Small batches don’t provide us any profit, simply enough payment to order the next batch. In some arrangements with retailers we even lost money in order to give the stockists a fair deal. We plan to use the profits from this issue to go directly into operating costs and printing our third issue, and for the future of our company.


A specific challenge of our international and independent status is paying for shipping our stock to our vendors and customers. We print independently in the UK, and have shipped copies as far as California. We charge a small fee to our readers for shipping, but have subsidised their costs so that we often pay as much as half of these costs, because we want to make Boshemia affordable to our readers.


 

All of this boils back down to putting a proper and appropriate value on the time and emotional labour of women who are working to make a positive contribution to society, and accessibility. Accessibility not just to readers, but to contributors too.

Here’s how the numbers break down for us:

  • $1700 to print the magazine, including shipping.
  • $500 to pay our artists.
  • $300 to pay our designers.
  • $500 to pay our contributors.

This campaign will function as a “pre-order” system. If you donate $10 (just under £8 in the UK), you will have preordered your copy of the magazine. Any additional donation will entitle you to a range of additional benefits, detailed in the “perks” section of this campaign, which range from having your name printed in the magazine to tshirts to having a bespoke poem written about you by one of the Boshemia team to going for dinner with a Boshemia member. How could you resist?! At the very very top end of donations there is also the opportunity to step in and take up a role as Guest Co-Editor on Issue 03 of the magazine.

Following our success in bookshops in the UK, we have been invited to participate in a number of events around the time of Issue 02's release.

This has been made possible through lots of human kindness and favours called in from friends, but unfortunately, kindness can only get us so far. This is crunch time—this is where you come in. Please help us raise enough funds to thrive and grow, and set us up for future success.


__________

If you aren’t able to contribute financially, sharing our campaign on social media helps us spread the word to others who are able. Because our campaign is brief, a mere 6 weeks, the more sharing, the better the chances that we meet our goal!

Connect with us on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram, or visit the Blog.

story:
The Ferret, Scotland’s first investigative journalism platform, listens to and involves its readers. This is why our second crowdfunded investigation will be into housing and homelessness, after it topped a recent reader poll. Our last crowdfunded investigation, into fracking and unconventional energy, had a huge reach and impact, and we are asking for your support again.

Why is housing and homelessness an important topic to investigate? Because decent, safe shelter is a universal human need, yet too often an unmet one. 

We will organise public meetings as we go about planning the investigation to which everyone - from individuals to housing organisations - is welcome to come to, to discuss what you think we should look into.

We appreciate your support in whatever form it takes - a strong investigative media helps ensure a healthy society. Help us nose up the trousers of power!

Testimonials

Irvine Welsh: "If there is one thing local, national and international events continually hammer home, it's the importance of genuinely independent investigative journalism to the health of our ailing democracies. The Ferret, by relentlessly exposing the truth and holding power to account, is an antidote to the propaganda, misinformation and general laziness that passes for modern journalism. It needs and deserves our support."

Paul McNamee, Big Issue: "Rough sleeping is growing in Britain. Invisible homelessness is also on the rise.  There is no one easy simple explanation for it. What is needed is a deep, old fashioned investigation into the contemporary and historic reasons that are sending people into a spiral that leaves them homeless and broken. The Ferret know what they're doing, and I
trust them to really get to some hard truths. So should you. We at The Big Issue hope to be able to work with The Ferret team to publish the findings."

Homelessness Shames Glasgow: "The recent front page story of the Sunday Herald show the impact and huge importance of investigative journalism and organisations like The Ferret. Properly funded investigative journalism provides a crucial launchpad to building a better society by cutting right to the core of the issues and providing activists with a wealth of facts and figures. Please play your part in supporting this utterly crucial project."

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Some of the themes we would like to look into are: 

New building and affordable homes The Scottish Government has announced it will be investing £3 billion to deliver 50,000 affordable homes by 2021 and will work with local authorities to build record numbers of council houses. Housing association and local authority new build completions have been on the downturn, whilst private-led completions have been on the upturn and we want to know what determines an affordable home, and to whom? Who are getting the big contracts and are they delivering value for money? What is informing major planning decisions?

Waiting lists There are 142,500 people on local authority housing waiting lists across Scotland but this figure is likely to be an underestimate of the true level of need, and doesn't include households on lists for housing association homes (which, for example, is all the social housing in Glasgow) - which is perhaps why homelessness is becoming more visible on our streets.

Homelessness statistics The number of homeless applications has been going down, however we want to know if this reflects the real picture. Is this due to a  preventative approach adopted by local authorities in the form of housing options, rather than a change in the underlying drivers of homelessness? Or is it a result of how homelessness is measured and reported? Who is on the street, and why? And are homeless people being turned away from the help they should be getting?

Temporary accommodation Figures from the Scottish Government show that by September 2016, there were 5,751 children living in temporary accommodation across Scotland, an increase of 826 from the same date in 2015. Families with children make up 30% of the 10,570 households in temporary accommodation. What are the implications for children of living like this?

The new borders Landlords are expected to act effectively as immigration enforcement now, under the new Immigration Act - and what is the role now of homeless charities, health workers and education professionals when they are dealing with people with complex immigration statuses. 

Monopoly Scotland Who owns Scotland's properties - are more and more houses being snapped up by overseas investors and lying empty? Who is buying large numbers of properties and why? Are councils losing out on taxes from these properties and are arrears being chased?

These and more are subjects we want to look into - with your help.
