story:
BONJOUR!

Join Marie Antoinette’s pet pug Mops on a whimsical journey to learning French, modern etiquette, and how to live life just like a royal! Mops and The Royal Rulebook is a rhyming rulebook with paper illustrations by Disney artist Nathanna Erica! This charming children's story (ideally ages 5-8) shows us just how easy la vie française can be for any child or parent, no matter where you are in the world or life!

We dream to take Mops from the page to your bookshelf! Our crowdfunding goal of $8k will give us a mock-up for the publishers, while $35k will help complete the book in full and allow us to print physical copies for our readers. We would absolutely love for you to be a part of our story and are giving you or your pet a chance to be drawn right into the book! Want to know more? Keep reading below for detailed information, and many thanks for your interest and support!

Here are a few royal rules JUST FOR YOU!

Our story is illustrated by artist Nathanna Erica in her signature paper-cut style (yes, everything is really made out of paper!) and written by author Lindsay Delacoste. Mops’s journey began nearly 10 years ago and we are asking YOU to be a part of the story to help us publish and share Mops (and la vie en rose) throughout the world!

WHAT NEEDS TO HAPPEN FOR MOPS TO REIGN THE WORLD?

It's our DREAM to see Mops published and ready for purchase at your local bookstore or online marketplace!  We just need a little help to get there and this is where YOU come in...

Our crowdfunding campaign has three stretch goals, each which will get us closer to putting a physical book into your or your child’s hands! You can either "back" or "make a contribution" to our campaign with any amount of your choosing or select a "perk" to receive a signed illustration  or chance to be drawn into the story!

Our first goal is to make $8,000! This will help us complete a “dummy" (mock-up) that we can send off to agents and publishers.  This will consist of 32 sketches in black and white, as well as the graphics and text placed into the pages.

Our second goal is a big one, but the ultimate DREAM to achieve... it’s $35,000!  This will help us complete the final book, cover to cover. That’s with 32 fully illustrated pages, graphics, text, the works! Hitting this target will allow any publisher or ourselves to send the book off to the printers!

Our final goal is any amount over $35k, which will help us self-publish in case we’re not signed by a publisher. For example, $45,000 will allow us to have 1000 hardback copies printed!

HOW TO GET INVOLVED AND HAVE A CHANCE OF BEING IN THE BOOK!

Gaining your support, whether it’s $2, $20, or even an IG repost would mean the world to us (and Mops!) We have some amazing opportunities for you... such as the chance for yourself or your pet to be drawn right into Mops and The Royal Rulebook! 

That's right! We have several "perk" options available to choose from and start at $150 which gives you an "extra" role in Mops (think royal staff or town goer) A $300 contribution is a "supporting role" where you'll stand out a bit more from the crowd (like a party guest!) For $500 you or your pet will be a "guest star" and considered a part of Mops and Marie's in-crowd (tea or hide-and-seek, anyone?) And finally, for a contribution of $800 you or your pet will be a "leading star" in Mops! You'll get one-on-one time with Mops and Marie, and an entire page to yourselves!

We're also giving you the chance to donate for a signed Nathanna Erica illustration which will be sent to you in the post, while EVERY SINGLE BACKER will receive a digital sticker pack for iMessage or WhatsApp as a special thanks for your contribution!

THIS SOUNDS AWESOME! CAN I READ THE BOOK?

Absolument! Watch the video below to hear the entire story of Mops and The Royal Rulebook!

WHEN YOU REACH YOUR GOAL, HOW WILL MOPS TAKE ON THE WORLD?

Getting a physical book in your hands is only the beginning!  Nathanna Erica is often busy with a certain mouse and while illustrations will not resume until the end of 2021, the graphics and calligraphy will be completed beforehand in the Fall. Depending on the goal we reach, we anticipate the "dummy" to be complete by mid-2022, or the final book ready to print in 2023.

We have all kinds of ideas for merchandise (stuffed animals, stationary, clothing) and epic launch parties like the good ole' Harry Potter days (but instead of wizards, there will be pugs!) We also dream of an animated tv series, and even have sequels for the book already in mind!

Please read our FAQ’s if you have any more questions or concerns.  If you don’t see your question addressed, or if you’re a literary agent or publisher who wants a piece of the cake (believe us, you want a piece of the cake) then email us at MopsAndTheRoyalRulebook@gmail.com

MERCI x

story:
Short Summary

Away Away is A.E. (April) Spiller's first book. It's an adventure about teenage twins Abbie and Lane who discover a plot to take over Galveston while their parents are out of town. With the routes off of the island being taken out one by one, they are faced with an impossible decision- stay and risk imprisonment, or steal a boat and head out into the Gulf of Mexico. They ultimately decide to battle the elements in an attempt to make it to safety in time to warn their parents.

As an engineer and then a high school teacher, April Spiller has been sailing the waters of Galveston and the Gulf of Mexico since college. In her first book, she wanted to create an adventure that the whole family could enjoy, while hopefully inspiring our next generation to get out there and explore.

As a teacher, April has witnessed the attachment kids these days have with their phones. With the entire world literally at their fingertips, most of her students still preferred using their phones to chat with people in their same school rather than looking to the world around them. She decided that she wanted to write stories that open their eyes to the fact that they can do more and really get out there instead of staying focused on the 5 inch screen in front of them. 

It wasn't much of a stretch for her to imagine two teens adventuring on the high seas, since sailing has been one of her obsessions since college. Adventures on the high seas have been common for many many years, what is new about this book is that it is centered around two teenagers with only a little sailing experience, alone on a sailboat. It follows their exploits through winter storms at sea as well as the threat of piracy and the trouble they get into when they accidentally find themselves in Cuban waters.

Away Away is a fun read for anyone who has ever thought about sailing off into the sunset and for anyone who dreams of adventure. It's an exciting look at how two kids escape military capture and the monotony of high school.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is to help cover the costs of getting Away Away released and in bookstores. Spiller previously self-published Away Away on Amazon, but with very little marketing experience, she wasn't very successful in getting the book to her target audience. The book is being pulled from Amazon and published by Sistership Publishing.

Here are some of the costs we are hoping to get covered through crowd-funding:

  • Editing, Cover Design and Formatting ($950)
  • Printing- 200 copies for review and initial release ($1002)
  • Launch ($1500)
  • Promotional items for crowdfunding, launch and advertising ($1000)
  • Imprinted sea beans as give-away items ($250)
  • GoPro for YouTube and blog videos- for Away Away and future books in the series ($400)

We estimate that all together, we will need $5102 for the launch of Away Away. If we don't make our entire goal, the money will go toward the most necessary items first, like editing and cover design, and will then be stretched as far as we can stretch it to get as much covered as we can.

If we exceed our goal, the funds will be put toward future books in the Away Away series and in our other projects and toward beefing up our marketing programs so that we can build a better company and help more authors.

To make our campaign interesting, we are putting together really exciting perks. Of course we will have the standard free books, and ebooks, but we will also have other, more unique perks, like mugs, printed sea beans, handmade reading quilts, and more.

 

The Impact

Sistership Publishing is a different kind of publishing company. As authors ourselves, we know how much of their time and emotions authors invest in their books. Authors spend countless hours getting attached to their books, only to have them taken away as soon as a contract is signed, with publishers changing story lines, characters, even names without any input from the authors at all. What's worse is that authors receive advances, but those advances have to be paid back. They are like the payday loans of the artistic world. 

At Sistership, we want authors to be involved every step of the way and for them to retain creative control of their books and characters. We don't want them to do all the work only to end up with a measly 15% of the profits- as is the current industry standard. 

Contributing to this campaign will let us get our first of many books out onto the literary market and will permit us to begin expanding our publishing services to more authors. You are not just funding a really fun adventure book. You are funding something bigger.

Who knows, you may be funding your own future creative endeavors by helping us get off the ground.

 

Risks & Challenges

At this point you may be asking yourself why you should bother funding someone's first book or a publishing company's first efforts to break into a stale market.

Sistership Publishing was started by April Spiller (yes, the same April Spiller who wrote Away Away), her sister, Pam Spiller, and their friend, Diane McCloskey, who is already an established author. As three highly motivated women, we each bring unique skill sets to the table, and we are all committed to bringing Sistership Publishing onto the world stage. We all have vested interests in making the company a success and know what other authors are going through while trying to navigate the shark infested waters of traditional publishing.

We understand that there are challenges, but with our experience and stubborn unwillingness to quit, we are confident that together, we can make this work.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Away Away is A.E. (April) Spiller's first book. It's an adventure about teenage twins Abbie and Lane who discover a plot to take over Galveston while their parents are out of town. With the routes off of the island being taken out one by one, they are faced with an impossible decision- stay and risk imprisonment, or steal a boat and head out into the Gulf of Mexico. They ultimately decide to battle the elements in an attempt to make it to safety in time to warn their parents.
As an engineer and then a high school teacher, April Spiller has been sailing the waters of Galveston and the Gulf of Mexico since college. In her first book, she wanted to create an adventure that the whole family could enjoy, while hopefully inspiring our next generation to get out there and explore.
As a teacher, April has witnessed the attachment kids these days have with their phones. With the entire world literally at their fingertips, most of her students still preferred using their phones to chat with people in their same school rather than looking to the world around them. She decided that she wanted to write stories that open their eyes to the fact that they can do more and really get out there instead of staying focused on the 5 inch screen in front of them. 
It wasn't much of a stretch for her to imagine two teens adventuring on the high seas, since sailing has been one of her obsessions since college. Adventures on the high seas have been common for many many years, what is new about this book is that it is centered around two teenagers with only a little sailing experience, alone on a sailboat. It follows their exploits through winter storms at sea as well as the threat of piracy and the trouble they get into when they accidentally find themselves in Cuban waters.
Away Away is a fun read for anyone who has ever thought about sailing off into the sunset and for anyone who dreams of adventure. It's an exciting look at how two kids escape military capture and the monotony of high school.
 

What We Need & What You Get
This campaign is to help cover the costs of getting Away Away released and in bookstores. Spiller previously self-published Away Away on Amazon, but with very little marketing experience, she wasn't very successful in getting the book to her target audience. The book is being pulled from Amazon and published by Sistership Publishing.

Editing, Cover Design and Formatting ($950)
Printing- 200 copies for review and initial release ($1002)
Launch ($1500)

story:
Why an "Afterparty"?

Every issue, there are tons of people who miss the Kickstarter but still want the magazine. Sure, they can subscribe, but that only gets them the NEXT issue. We offer these rolling campaigns on Indiegogo, so everybody who wants back issues of Bystander can get them from us, at a 20% discount off retail. (PS — If you have trouble paying Indiegogo, just PayPal the amount of your pledge to "publisher@americanbystander.org" and we'll process the order that way. 

Original Campaign Text:

They said we couldn't do it. They said we shouldn't do it. They said we skrouldn't do it, and "skrouldn't" isn't even a word. 

But we have done it, three times. And now we're back with another collection of writing and cartoons from some of the funniest people on the planet, a spiffy little pile of paper and glue we like to call The American Bystander.

The idea behind Bystander is simple: gather a bunch of people from places like The Simpsons, SNL, The New Yorker and so on, and print stuff they can't do for The Simpsons, SNL, The New Yorker and so on. Then put it all together in a nice-looking book that feels just like the beloved humor magazines of the past — The National Lampoon, SPY, PUNCH, and so on. This scheme has proved to be a huge success, as you can read here and here. If you crave yet more details, please go to our website.

In a time where intelligent satire is more important than ever, The American Bystander is the first classic print humor magazine to be launched in the United States in 20 years. American corporate publishing is simply not equipped to produce this type of content — so we're turning to readers. And readers have responded, pledging over $140,000 to our crowdfunding campaigns. 


A sample spread.

But is there anything left to laugh at, in this dark and crazy era? SURE! El Presidente himself, for one thing. And also rats, Paul Bunyan, and Hell. When the going gets tough, funny people make more jokes. And who are we to tell them they skrouldn't?

(Some of) THE PEOPLE IN #4: Cover by Steve Brodner; Merrill Markoe, Roz Chast, Drew Friedman, Shannon Wheeler, Jack Handey, Brian McConnachie, Sam Gross, MK Brown, Larry Doyle, Howard Cruse, Todd Hanson, Mike Sacks, Alan Zweibel, Steve Young... and many more!


Cartoonist Sam Gross — beloved by generations of cartoon fans — has graciously allowed us to sell giclee prints of his cartoon from Bystander #3. Sam will even sign it, if you give us $250 smackeroos.

"This is shit. We're going to publish it."

 

Michael Gerber (Editor & Publisher): The American Bystander is the culmination of over 25 years as a writer, editor, and magazine consultant specializing in humor. I've written for The New Yorker, SNL, and many other places; my books have sold 1.25 million copies in 25 languages. In 2003, Barry Trotter and the Shameless Parody fried the brains of a generation of English tweens, and now we have Brexit. Sorry.

Brian McConnachie (Head Writer): Brian began his comedy career as an editor at National Lampoon and the Lampoon's "Radio Hour." From there, he went to Saturday Night Live, and SCTV, completing the Holy Trinity of Seventies comedy. In the 80s and 90s, Brian amassed the coolest bunch of cameos in the history of cinema. In more recent years, he has written for The Simpsons and recorded pieces for NPR.

Alan Goldberg (Senior Editor): has been making non-fiction television and radio for more than 35 years. His work includes biographies ranging from Fidel Castro to the Beatles; science programs with Dr. Richard Leakey; programs on drugs and epidemic diseases; histories of American railroads, diners, The Forbidden City and the Golden Gate Bridge -- and even live rock and roll and gospel concerts. Alan will be overseeing Bystander's eventual podcasts and live-event programming.

story:
Boozy Background

After fifteen years working in food and beverage I'm hitting the road! For those of you that know me well, working in bars and restaurants has been my life. Over that time I have developed some incredible relationships on both sides of the industry. Whether it was working with our staff and customers or running the beverage program(s) and meeting the suppliers and actual people making the products we all enjoy. I've been fortunate to share some great experiences locally in New York at breweries, distilleries and the like and now want to share these experiences with everyone across the country. Next time you plan a trip, let Boozy Excursions add something fun and different to your itinerary. 

Boozy Budget

I could probably just Google search everything, do some online questionnaire and find out generic information about each location along the route. That wouldn't be much for anyone here. Instead I am packing up and driving thousands of miles to meet the people who make it all possible. This campaign is to help create awareness for the book and help cover the costs of printing, editing, promotion, and other expenses along the way. More funding equals better content and coverage for the reader. 

Beyond The Booze

Not everyone will be able to contribute financially, and that's perfectly alright. I'll be out on the road for a few months, often traveling solo. Send along some messages of encouragement. Follow the story on Instagram @boozyexcursions. Help spread the word about this campaign. Join me along the way if you have some time to kill. Check out the itinerary and reach out to be a part of this amazing adventure (ahem, Excursion!)

 

Bourbon and Beyond Festival

Join me at Bourbon and Beyond Festival in Louisville. The VIP Experience details are below:

Concert Headliners include:

John Mayer, Lenny Kravitz, Sting, Robert Plant and many more!

ACCESS TO THE MINT GARDEN, AN EXCLUSIVE HANG AREA FOR VIPS ONLY

FRONT-OF-STAGE VIEWING OF THE OAK STAGE

ACCESS TO THE MINT TENT- A SHADED HANG SPACE WITH DEDICATED BARS & COMFORTABLE FURNITURE

LIVE AUDIO/VIDEO STREAMS OF THE BARREL & OAK STAGES

AIR CONDITIONED, FLUSHABLE RESTROOMS

PREMIUM FOOD & BEVERAGE OFFERINGS 

A COMMEMORATIVE VIP-ONLY LAMINATE & RFID WRISTBAND

 

Riot Fest 2018

Blink 182, Alkaline Trio, Incubus, Interpol, Beck, Dropkick Murphys, Bleachers, Cypress Hill, Bad Religion, Sum 41, The Front Bottoms and tons more!

✶ Unlimited Fest Re-Entry
✶ VIP Gate Access
✶ 5 Beverage Tickets
✶ Unlimited VIP Area Access:
✶ Private Bar
✶ Private Restrooms
 

Itinerary

(WILL BE UPDATED REGULARLY)

All itinerary details subject to change due to weather or other circumstances. The locations listed are not the only things possibly happening on those dates but I am allowing for some time for work and possible suggestions and surprises! 

Saturday September 8th: Rock The Roots @ Angry Orchard 

Sunday September 9th: Warwick Valley Winery & Distillery

Monday September 10th: Connecticut: Two Roads Brewery

Tuesday September 11th: Boston: Samuel Adams, Harpoon, Trillium

Wednesday September 12th: Brewery Ommegang

Thursday September 13th:

September 14-17 Chicago: Riot Fest 2018, 

September 21-23+2 Louisville, KY: Bourbon & Beyond Festival, Angels Envy, Copper & Kings, Old Forester, Makers Mark, Bulleit Bourbon

September 24-26 Nashville, TN:

September 27 Lynchburg, TN: Jack Daniels Tennessee Whiskey ---> Memphis

October 4-8th Austin: Austin City Limits

story:
Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia (the country, not the US state!) is a perfect chaos! Only here you will find the surreal mixture of megalomaniac futuristic architecture, soviet brutalism, buildings from the times of Russian empire, Ottoman style baths, Persian carpets hanging on the walls of the dining halls, centuries old churches, bizarre bazaars, racing taxi drivers, elderly street players of backgammon... The hipsters and ravers mingle on the streets with the orthodox priests and their conservative followers. All this is soaked in wine and chacha and washed down together with long, emotional and touching toasts. 

We are right there - between Europe and Asia, ancient and modern, traditional and progressive. 

Help us to raise funds, so we can publish a new USE-IT Tbilisi map, a cool and beautiful map with tips from the locals, who will show you how to get the best out of this crazy experience, how to understand the locals and keep coming back again and again, because you will never be able to get enough of this city!

USE-IT Europe is a creative network which publishes amazing, colourful, FREE printed maps and mobile apps that are currently available in 40 European cities and that make traveling a completely different experience by introducing the city from the perspective of locals, young people and those who know the best spots and hottest up-to-date tips and stories! 

Who are we? 

We are a creative collective based in Tbilisi, Georgia. We have published our first USE-IT Tbilisi map in November 2015 and it was a huge success. We couldn’t even respond all the messages of our fans writing us how many awesome places they could enjoy thanks to our map and and how they loved our playful design. (but we indeed tried) :) Today, the first map is outdated, because Tbilisi changes so fast that a place that was a total hype one season, sinks into oblivion a year later. That’s why we are working hard to publish a new map and save the travellers from awkward situations, tourist traps and confused crowds of organised tours. 

We cooperate with a Georgian non-governmental organisation called Youth Association DRONI, which works with and for young people, mainly those with fewer opportunities (refugees, young people from marginalised areas and communities), helps them to learn new skills, develop and get experiences that they cannot learn in educational institutions. The young people are involved in creating the content, design and promoting this map. We have loads of ideas and energy, only thing we lack is enough funding to print 30 thousand copies of the maps, which will make so many travellers happy!

Our project: USE-IT Tbilisi

We want to promote smart and sustainable way of exploring our city! In recent years Tbilisi has developed into a buzzing touristic destination where people from East and West, South and North meet and mingle. But still, there are many who have never heard of us or are afraid to visit! Based on our experience with our 2015 map and positive feedback from some of the travellers who were encouraged to explore Georgia on their own after finding Tbilisi on the network’s website, we decided that for the biggest impact of our map and promotion of the city, we want to stay a member of international USE-IT.travel family. 

We simply love the concept of free, noncommercial, no non-sense maps targeting mainly young travellers and backpackers, but also anyone who has a bit adventurous soul and wants to move around the city by public transportation, understand the rules of traditional Georgian supra and know the inside stories and urban legends. We need your help to achieve our goal! And if you decide to visit us yourself and try our map on your own, you will see that this was not a wasted investment. 

You cannot contribute, but still want to help?

We will appreciate all the tips for the cool places in Tbilisi to visit and check. If they are awesome, we might include them in the map. You can also prepare a little thematic tour for us, if you know some aspect of Tbilisi very well. Leave us a message here or write us on our facebook page.

story:
Hello

It's me– Kyle. If you're reading this, you probably know me–or maybe you don't– those are the two options. Either way, I want to explain what an important milestone my book, The Economics of Emotion, represents for me. Since I was 15, I've known I wanted to be a public speaker- inspiring people to be more kind with one another, help them build human-centric businesses, and ultimately contribute to the fulfillment and enrichment of their lives. This book is the biggest leap I've taken towards this goal yet. Unfortunately, after 18 months of writing, I'm only halfway through the leap. In order to really achieve my dream, I need to get this book out into the world.

It will cost nearly $15,000 to get this book in bookstores across America. Luckily I've saved up a big portion of this. Unfortunately, I still need help.

A Different Kind of Business Book

People who read lots of business books will find this one a little different…and it begins with an observation I made a few years ago:

All businesses are made up of people. Most businesses exist to serve people. The products and services we interact with all day, every day were created by people. Our beds and pillows were created by others, our floor was designed by someone for comfort and stability, our bathroom door and contoured toothbrush, our phone, our favorite weather app, our coffeemaker, our car, the roadway, the keycard to our office building, our computers, the tools we use to do our job, even our work environment—each meticulously designed by people for people.

Business has an unavoidable and tremendous impact on the human experience, because business makes up such a large part of the modern human experience—resulting in billions of interactions, every day.

What if instead of designing for features, businesses deliberately designed for feelings? Could they improve the human experience?

This is a book about emotion because, in my lifetime, I hope to significantly contribute to the long-term survival and success of humankind by exploring new ways to understand and work more kindly with each other. I believe the study of how humans use and respond to emotion holds the key to global compassion.

It’s also a business book, because business encompasses some of the most prominent ways we work with and serve one another. In the book, I share what I have learned through working with and studying some of the world’s most admired companies—enterprises like Apple, Disney, and The Ritz-Carlton. These companies have succeeded in creating happiness at scale, building communities of passionate customers and employees alike all while remaining at the top of their respective industries. I want to educate others on how they used emotion to do that.

 

Financial Goals

The base goal for this campaign is $5000 to help reach the distribution and publicity goal.

In the hopeful event that I am able to reach my goal, I have a stretch goal of $10k so that I can record audio book!

$5,000 > Distribution and Publicity

$10,000 > Audio Book

$15,000 > Hardcover Book

The whole point here is to get my book into the hands, and ears, of as many people as possible and I can't do it without your help!

Since I was 15, I've known I wanted to be a public speaker- inspiring people to be more kind with one another, help them build human-centric businesses, and ultimately contribute to the fulfillment and enrichment of their lives. story:
There are no self-help books in book stores on anti-racism, but I want to change that.

It is through story that we get the strength to do things we never thought we could. It is my desire, to inspire white people to get the help that they need through reading my book series.

Each book will be based on one of the seven racist signatures that I teach in my anti-racism coaching program.

Change cannot be rushed, because lasting change comes from within. I believe that these books will spark a revolution of anti-racism work across the country and around the world.

story:
THE STORY

Same Sins Separate Path, a 98,000-word fiction novel is the story of Titus Wilcox, the countrified brother from Beaufort South Carolina who enters wondrously into the corrupt world of Wilfred Grimes (CArJAk), the brash, jive talking, city slicker from Baltimore Maryland.

When Paps flees the backwoods of the Low Country, the only recourse for the remaining Wilcox clan is a journey to higher ground. A gig in Baltimore finally comes through for Aretha Wilcox, inciting the family's new beginning. Once on scene, Titus learns just how far behind the curve he really is when he crosses the path of CArJAk, a foolhardy "Merliner" whose life is plummeting toward an inevitably bad conclusion. Owed to some imperceptible force, out of some indiscernible need, the two are unified into a friendship bond that requires costly sacrifices. As the bare essence of CArJAk's hard luck existence unravels, Titus, who is still licking fresh and painful wounds of his own, is duty-bound to set his homie on a straight and narrow path. Amassing all efforts to stave off the inevitable devastation that follows CArJAk like death s dark shadow, Titus finds himself dangerously caught up into his friends vacuum of despair.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The bulk of the work involved in producing Same Sins Separate Paths, has already been completed. The story has been written, formatting and cover design has been completed, and a publisher has been identified. I am choosing to work with Ingram Spark, an established, well-known, and reputable print-on-demand-publisher with extensive industry experience and ties.

The next hurdle is in marketing and promotion. While future plans are to launch the novel in as many locations as possible, the two (2) primary settings, Beaufort SC and Baltimore MD have been targeted for initial launch. Devoting an equal amount of time in both venues may present a scheduling challenge but not one that is insurmountable when approached with great coordination, key contacts, and established resources on the ground.

USE OF FUNDS

If we are successful in reaching our targeted funding goal, the funds will be used for the following critical components necessary for making Same Sins Separate Paths a total success:

-Email pitch and press release creation
-Press release distribution
-TV and radio appearances
-Digital Marketing
-Scouting, filtering and selection of local bookstores, festivals and events for book signing/book talk
-Schedule guaranteed book signings depending on author availability and store schedule
-Callbacks and follow-ups using phone and emails
-Creation and maintenance of Facebook fan page, Twitter, LinkedIn and Pinterest accounts
-Locating targeted book reviewers

story:
What is this?

Fterota Logia is an online literary journal focused on young adult literature. About a year ago, the website launched in response to a lack of YA literary journals. Throughout the last year, our journal has had the opportunity to publish, and get to know, so many amazing authors in the young adult literature world. Halfway through the year, the journal expanded to include book reviews and author interviews. 

Take a minute and explore our website -- we promise, you won't be disappointed! 

Why Should You Contribute?

Alright, so here’s what you’re looking at. If we reach our goal, Fterota Logia will be able to print one whole issue commemorating our first year in existence. We’re talking a beautiful journal with over a hundred pages of fiction, essays, interviews, reviews, and artwork, featuring our wildly exciting and varied list of contributors.

BUT WAIT, THERE’S MORE.

Your contribution will also help us begin paying our contributors. This is something that we’ve unfortunately been unable to do in our first year, but something that we hope to remedy ASAP.
 

Fterota Logia's Mission Statement

Fterota Logia, or 'winged words', is a translation of the classical Greek expression 'epea pteroenta' used most famously by Homer. For Homer, the expression was used to either signify the importance of the words (the passion), to signify spontaneity in language or to connote 'unusual truths'. This feels very in tune with how young adult literature works for its intended audience. Additionally, it reminds us of the connection between YA literature and folklore/myths.

Fterota Logia aims to encapsulate the essence of young adult literature, while also providing a space for open discussion and theorizing of the genre.

Our mission is to create a forum where new works of young adult fiction will be celebrated.

Our mission is to cultivate intellectual discussion and a deeper understanding of the importance of young adult literature.

We are dedicated to working with authors to help them reach their full potential. We want every author, every child who puts pen to paper or adult who wants to indulge their creativity, to learn and grow.

We will scout out new authors and voices, those who love YA and those who hate it, those who are young – in body or in spirit – and those who have an intimate connection and understanding of young adult literature. We aim to fill our journal with insightful interviews, feature columns, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially. If you love what we do and want to support Fterota Logia, please feel free to share either this campaign or our online journal on your social media pages!

story:
As some of you already know, I received the opportunity of a lifetime to write my very own book.

Inspired by my inquisitive students and the performers I have mentored, I set out to create the very first self-help book for belly dancers.  There are so many answers that budding performers and professionals alike have asked me over the years.  Ranging from "how do I get my first booking" to "what do I do in a toxic community?"  I hope this will be your guide in the business of bellydance to not only unstick yourself but also reconnect you back to what you love most about our art form. 

Featuring a foreword by renowned artist Tamalyn Dallal and an epilogue by Shelley Parris Williams of The Womb Sanctuary, this book feels like a warm hug from a really smart businesswoman.  Who will tell you how to write your resume. 

Illustrated by Breanne and Gabby Roberts, it also has a dose of fun with worksheets to help jog the thinking juices and coloring pages for those rough days when you just need some color in your life.

Your donation will help me, Oriana, cover the costs of the editors, typesetters, graphic designers, ISBN and barcode being utilized by the amazing people at Cocoon to Wings Publishing.  Moreover, it will help birth this little baby book into the world where I hope it will further the conversation on Bellydance for the next generation to carry its legacy.

Also, if you donate to help with the publishing, I will give you 20% off your copy of the book after it's all said and done.  Autographed and sealed with a kiss.

story:
Description

The mission of the Shhh, Don't Tell Nobody! children's book and coloring book is to bring awareness to the children silenced by trauma and violence and with hopes of protecting children from abuse. Inspired by my personal life, as a survivor, I know firsthand how important it is for children to feel safe, seen, and heard. According, to Jane Ellen Stevens' Ace Study May 13, 2013, “Nearly 35 million U.S children have experienced one or more types of childhood trauma and the numbers are growing.” Unfortunately, childhood abuse is a topic most find hard to discuss. Rarely is the abuser a stranger in a creepy van; in truth most trauma occurs in our families or from someone close. According to a report, “Children in the United States are more likely to be victimized violently in their own homes than on the streets" (Current Trends in Child Abuse Prevention, Reporting, and Facilities: The 1997 Fifty State Survey.  Chicago, IL: Prevent Child Abuse America, 1999).  Like my uncle Billy would say “What happens in this family, stays in this family”--but it’s time to change this narrative. It is time to educate and heal. 

Shhh, Don't Tell Nobody! is a creative approach in starting a dialogue between parents, children, and caregivers. This book can be used as a tool to empower kids to share their truth when the truth matters most. Helping protect children from abuse, this book can also bring healing and hope to children, families, and communities.  

The companion Shhh, Don't Tell Nobody! coloring book was created to provide children with a fun and therapeutic way to release anxiety, help with relaxation, spark creativity, and keep imagination going, all while learning how to share their truth and be safe.   

About the Author, Tina Marie Turner 

I am an activist for healing children from trauma and violence. I am currently in the developmental stages of a new 501(c)(3) non-profit, HealUs, that caters to children silenced by trauma and violence, offering healing through the arts and creating hope for the hopeless. Shhh, Don't Tell Nobody! is my first published book. I am also a mother, actress, writer, director, motivational speaker, storyteller, an advocate for HIV/AIDS awareness, and cofounder of H.O.P.E (Healing One Production Entertainment) serving underprivileged youth with limited access to arts opportunities by teaching acting, writing, singing, and dancing. 

About HealUs, 501(c)(3)

Children will benefit from the 501(c)(3) HealUs as we strive to heal, motivate, and inspire change in our families and communities. We believe art has the power to mend broken hearts, give a voice to the voiceless, and inspire the hopeless. HealUs will use Shhh, Don't Tell Nobody! as a tool to educate families, schools, churches, clinics, and hospitals on the process of healing and the resources needed. I will continue to write and publish children’s books to improve the dialogue between parents and caregivers that help children to express their feelings and thoughts. HealUs will provide training and workshops for children and parents ready to commit to changing the stigmas behind keeping family secrets. We will join forces with child psychologists, life coaches, and mentors who are focused on helping children accomplish their personal goals and encourage them to become productive adults in today’s society.  

About the Illustrator, Elisha D. Jackson

Elisha D. Jackson is an independent artist who has been producing exceptional works of art since 2008.  He is a loving husband, father, and self-taught artist. He has illustrated everything from business logos, flyers, portraits, cartoons, and children's books.  

How will your donation be utilized?

We are partnering with a local women- and minority-owned publishing company, Wise Ink, to create a beautiful, professional book and coloring book that is able to open doors  and create change. For this work, we will need:

Project Management and Editing: $2,000

Custom Illustration and Design: $4, 800

Printing: $4,000

Total: $10,800

NOTE: Any donations beyond our goal will be used to help fund non-profit HealUs.

story:
When a deadly woman from a clan that tortures eagles into submission captures Morlen’s dear companion, Roftome, he embarks on a quest more terrifying than any he has yet undertaken.

Going alone into the Mountains of the Lost, Morlen treks an uncertain path through hostile forces that embody the grimmest legends. Worst of all are the Pyrnaq—wretched, twisted corruptions of the free eagles they once were—and their overwhelming presence is a constant reminder of the terrible fate that he must spare Roftome at all costs.

Despite the absence of their two strongest allies, King Verald and Lady Valeine lead the Eaglemasters on a massive campaign to wipe the Ferotaur Wildlands clean of their ancient enemies. But as they delve deeper into the overrun wasteland, they hear whispers of a watchful evil that their intrusion might soon unleash.

On the opposite corner of the world and threatened on every side, Morlen finds that his only hope is to unite with one of the fierce ghouls he fought in his first adventure. And as the days pass into weeks, and months, he grows more afraid whether the end of his long journey will bring him face to face with the friend he lost, or… with something else.

 

C. L. Murray's Story

I started coughing up blood every day last October. It began as just an annoying dry cough right after I’d slightly choked on a wasabi-slathered dumpling. I was sure my little culinary mishap had caused some kind of inflammation that led to bronchitis, and, having no insurance, I tried to just tough it out even as regular fevers accompanied the problem. The knifing pains that grew worse in my lower abdomen and back were just a result of the strain the cough was putting on my muscles, I kept telling myself.

Finally, after three weeks of wishing this would clear up on its own, I went to Urgent Care on Nov 1 and was swiftly diagnosed with testicular cancer that had spread to my liver and lungs. The doctor was quick to reassure me that this type of cancer is very treatable with an extremely high survival rate, and I drove home accepting the completed puzzle whose little pieces I’d been ignoring since long before that cough had set in.

I spent the next few days discovering my luck was so much better than I’d realized, getting insurance through Covered California and persuading the fine people who work for San Diego County to expedite my coverage so I wouldn’t have to wait till the New Year to start treatment. Turns out their timing was excellent as my left leg started feeling like it had a 30-pound weight strapped to it when I walked, then quickly became sore, swollen, purplish, and barely able to get me around the house.

One week after my diagnosis, I was finally able to see the oncologist I’d been referred to, who sent me for an ultrasound that revealed the cancer had caused a major blood clot extending through my leg into my abdomen. While seeing few alternatives to weeks of waiting for various scans before treatment could begin, I was again super fortunate to be seen by a urologist who took all of two minutes to assess my situation and have me admitted to the hospital.

During a week when I would have otherwise been twiddling my thumbs waiting for one minor step toward treatment, the hospital staff wasted no time knocking out every barrier between me and the lifesaving care I needed. An MRI showed that my brain was clear of tumors, and other procedures found that the blood clot had traveled through my heart and set up shop in my lungs with the cancer.

After five cycles of chemo, and five months of giving myself two shots in the stomach per day to keep my blood from turning to cottage cheese, my cancer and blood clots are on the run, but there's still a long road ahead. Chemo and related complications have gotten tougher, and I'm looking at seven weeks in the hospital for more intense treatment with a few breaks in between. The bad days are largely outnumbered by the good, though, and there won't be a trace left of this disease after a few more months.

Risks & Challenges

I'll be spending seven weeks in the hospital over the next few months getting high-dose chemo and other therapies, but I'll still be able to conduct my book marketing and deliver your e-books with just a few keystrokes on my laptop. I should be out of the hospital when it's time to sign and mail your paperbacks, which will provide me some much-needed fresh air and exercise.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you share this page on Facebook, Twitter, etc. I would sincerely appreciate it.

I started coughing up blood every day last October. It began as just an annoying dry cough right after I’d slightly choked on a wasabi-slathered dumpling. I was sure my little culinary mishap had caused some kind of inflammation that led to bronchitis, and, having no insurance, I tried to just tough it out even as regular fevers accompanied the problem. The knifing pains that grew worse in my lower abdomen and back were just a result of the strain the cough was putting on my muscles, I kept telling myself.
Finally, after three weeks of wishing this would clear up on its own, I went to Urgent Care on Nov 1 and was swiftly diagnosed with testicular cancer that had spread to my liver and lungs. The doctor was quick to reassure me that this type of cancer is very treatable with an extremely high survival rate, and I drove home accepting the completed puzzle whose little pieces I’d been ignoring since long before that cough had set in.
I spent the next few days discovering my luck was so much better than I’d realized, getting insurance through Covered California and persuading the fine people who work for San Diego County to expedite my coverage so I wouldn’t have to wait till the New Year to start treatment. Turns out their timing was excellent as my left leg started feeling like it had a 30-pound weight strapped to it when I walked, then quickly became sore, swollen, purplish, and barely able to get me around the house.
One week after my diagnosis, I was finally able to see the oncologist I’d been referred to, who sent me for an ultrasound that revealed the cancer had caused a major blood clot extending through my leg into my abdomen. While seeing few alternatives to weeks of waiting for various scans before treatment could begin, I was again super fortunate to be seen by a urologist who took all of two minutes to assess my situation and have me admitted to the hospital.
During a week when I would have otherwise been twiddling my thumbs waiting for one minor step toward treatment, the hospital staff wasted no time knocking out every barrier between me and the lifesaving care I needed. An MRI showed that my brain was clear of tumors, and other procedures found that the blood clot had traveled through my heart and set up shop in my lungs with the cancer.
After five cycles of chemo, and five months of giving myself two shots in the stomach per day to keep my blood from turning to cottage cheese, my cancer and blood clots are on the run, but there's still a long road ahead. Chemo and related complications have gotten tougher, and I'm looking at seven weeks in the hospital for more intense treatment with a few breaks in between. The bad days are largely outnumbered by the good, though, and there won't be a trace left of this disease after a few more months.

Risks & Challenges
I'll be spending seven weeks in the hospital over the next few months getting high-dose chemo and other therapies, but I'll still be able to conduct my book marketing and deliver your e-books with just a few keystrokes on my laptop. I should be out of the hospital when it's time to sign and mail your paperbacks, which will provide me some much-needed fresh air and exercise.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you share this page on Facebook, Twitter, etc. I would sincerely appreciate it.

story:
Hello!

My name is Daniel Ayerzon.  I spent the last year following Andrew Yang around the country and was able to witness a phenomenon that is very much unprecedented.  He changed the country for the better.  He did this in the most specific way by activating a mass amount of people that were waiting for a leader of his caliber to energize us all to get up and do something to create the kind of America we can be proud of.  This is my journey and what the campaign meant to me and so many others.   Contributions are not needed to be made just click on perk to preorder the book only.   If you want to contribute more it is appreciated. 

This project is important because many more people that were not paying attention need to be reached out to and find out about what happened to start the spark that will change our country. As I gain more funding I will be able to promote the book at a greater level and will be able to provide more content that has not been released to the public, as of yet.  Also, there is a movie based on the book that is in the works and this initial campaign is the start of this incredible movement to get the word out.  It all starts here so give much and give more so we can again create an America we can be proud of. 

I am raising ten thousand dollars for the initial campaign.  This is for the pre-sale of the book that you will receive via email digital download.  You will also receive a discount code for a signed copy of the physical book that will be out shortly after the initial digital delivery.  You will also receive full access to the Yang Gang website that will be launched on the day of the digital-book release.  That website will have extra video clips and content for those that pre-purchased the book.  You will also be listed on the website as a contributor.  If the goal is not met then you will not receive anything but a refund.  You will also have to wait an extended amount of time to receive the book.  You will be able to order instead off my Website with a donation. 

I do not have the resources to get the book published without your help.  If it is truly to be done then I need the Yang Gang to come together and help.   Let's get more information out there about our movement and the good word of Yang. 

I have been traveling around the United States and like many of you, I expected Andrew to get elected as our new president.  Because that didn't happen we need to prepare for our next opportunity.  Having a book is a step in that direction.  If you can't buy an advanced copy, you can share this campaign with others and use the Indiegogo share tool.   Let's get this done with the hashtag #YangLeaders and #YangwasRight

story:
Hi, I'm Eleanor, I am mum to three children; Maya, Oscar & Ava.

I used to be a secondary school teacher until recently, when I realised I could make more of an impact on children's futures away from the classroom. I am massively passionate about wanting to help children reach their true potential in life. My vision is to empower children to enable them to be successful in life.

Last year I launched my first two children's books, named after my two oldest children, to help encourage children everywhere to believe in themselves and dream big. 

This campaign will help to launch my third, and arguably most important, book so far. Ava was born in May 2018, we had a post natal diagnosis of Down's Syndrome quickly followed by finding out she had a hole in her heart. Ava is an absolute blessing to our family and everyone she meets. We all feel so incredibly lucky to have her in our lives. Since her birth and open heart surgery we regularly find ways to support the charities and community groups that have helped us and will continue to do so throughout Ava's life. Once I make a profit with any of my books some of the money will be donated to these fantastic causes.

I started to look for books to help my own children, and others who may meet Ava, to understand that differences in people are good and help them to understand that sometimes people might need a little more help to be able to join in. It appeared such books were few and far between. That became my inspiration and motivation for Ava The Mermaid.

By contributing to this campaign you will be helping to spread the message of acceptance, inclusion and understanding to children everywhere.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding I am asking for will be enough to have the book illustrated by an amazing local artist and get 300 copies printed ready to distribute.

Once the books physically exist I will be using them to work with children in schools, community groups, libraries, hospitals, etc.

Even if I do not reach the full amount requested it will be a start in the process.

As a contributor, you could be one of the first people to receive a signed copy of Ava The Mermaid to share with any little (or big!) people who are important to you. 

An acknowledgement to all contributors will be made in the book.

There are other perks available depending on what you are able to contribute.

Follow me on instagram or facebook @thesnowdropstory. Or take a look at my blog at www.thesnowdropstory.co.uk/rockstar.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to help financially please share the campaign wide and far as you never know who is just around the corner.

Thank you

 

Music in video from www.bensound.com

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone!!

My name is Tyia Lashe! I am a self-published children’s author from Kansas City, MO. My books are catered to little black girls! To me, it’s important for little black girls to see themselves in a positive light at all times. It’s important that little black girls see themselves being creative, loving themselves, being bold, embracing their gifts, being kind to others...and every other positive way!

 I am on a mission to self-publish 3 books in 3 months! Why 3 books in 3 months? Let me tell you! Urgency! I have self-published 5 children’s books over the course of 3 years! That’s a long time! I have so many poems & stories that are already written just waiting to get published! There is  a little girl who needs my books today at this point in their life! Not next year!

Well you’ve self-published before Tyia, why do you need my contribution this time? I’m glad you asked! Self-publishing can get expensive, especially when it comes to paying an illustrator out of my own pocket! Many self-published authors utilize sites to connect with artists around the world to create illustrations for the low! However, I  have realized that there are talented black female artists in Kansas City who can do the same job, if not better!! I want to support the artists in my city and pay them decently!

Your contribution will also help with maintaining my self-publishing software during the 3 months and ordering inventory once the books are completed!

Y’all...

I write to empower little black girls. I write to uplift little black girls. I write to inspire little black girls because I was once a little black girl who didn’t know her worth. 

Thank you in advance for your contribution to this campaign!

Check the FAQ to learn more about the 3 books!

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't contribute monetarily...that doesn't mean you can't help! Share this campaign with your family, friends, or folks who you think would be interested in contributing to this cause!I

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Dear friends,

Today we find ourselves at a crossroads with the realization that the business of making a magazine must adapt. The complete coronavirus upheaval has revealed a few truths. 

Many of our advertising partners, from travel and tourism to retail and hospitality, are struggling, which has made an immediate impact on how we function. Subscribers have always paid to read our content, but it has been those advertising dollars that paid for the paper, the printing and the distribution of Flamingo. 

Distributing print magazines across Florida has become logistically unsound. From hotel rooms to airports to doctor’s offices and hair salons and even events, like boat shows and wine festivals, where we used to sell and distribute Flamingo, challenges abound. A paper product that hangs around for weeks or months and is touched by many is no longer welcome.

These realities have forced us to take a digital-forward approach to fulfilling Flamingo’s mission: to unify the state and be the destination for Florida’s greatest stories.

SO WHAT DOES A DIGITAL-FORWARD APPROACH MEAN? 

It means we will deliver the same high-quality journalism, photography and design you’ve come to expect from Flamingo, only now you’ll be experiencing it exclusively on your phone or your computer. And in addition to our award-winning writing and photography, we've added video and audio content.

We understand this is a different iteration of Flamingo. But if you love what we do, your support is critical for us to remain the definitive voice of Floridians and to tell stories that matter and move us in this unpredictable world.

THAT'S WHY WE'RE KICKING OFF OUR FIRST EVER MEMBERSHIP DRIVE.

We have a goal to raise $30,000 over the next six weeks, 100 percent of which will go directly to support the work of our award-winning, Florida-based journalists, photographers, illustrators and editors who make Flamingo the destination for the state’s greatest stories. We hope you will continue to support us by purchasing whatever level of membership suits you. When you do that, you become a Flamingo Friend, helping us build our future and continue to tell important stories like the ones we are sharing now. 

If you already subscribed to our print edition, then you are already a Flamingo Friend, and we want to say thank you! We hope you will stick with us. Please share this membership drive campaign with your friends, family and beloved Floridians.

July 1 marked the launch of our first digital-only edition, No. 18, “Sunshine State of Mind.” New, exclusive Flamingo content will roll out on flamingomag.com and arrive in our subscribers’ email inboxes  throughout the summer. Then we plan to launch two more digital issues in the fall and winter of this year. 

THE GOOD NEWS IS ...

We are reaching more readers than ever since turning up the volume on Flamingomag.com, our Fresh Squeezed newsletter and our social media channels. We’re also having a ton of fun. Maybe you’ve enjoyed some of our virtual Flocktails or our live interviews with Florida chefs or our guides on what to cook, read and buy during the pandemic. And hopefully that content has given you some joy during these challenging times.

Five years ago this month, we began a journey to create a statewide magazine—for Floridians, by Floridians. Back then the difficulties of build a publishing business from scratch felt almost insurmountable. But our team felt strongly that Floridians deserve a magazine as great as the state. We took the challenge seriously, one story, one issue at a time. We stuck to the vision to create high-quality journalism rooted in Florida, and eventually, it paid off in a time when most people thought print was dead. 

What was alive then and is alive even more now is Floridians’ appetite for stories that showcase the authentic, intelligent, adventurous, thoughtful, quirky and sometimes complicated narratives of our state. 

We’re not saying there won’t be future print editions of Flamingo—one day there may be. But right now we must respect and respond to the need for a digital Flamingo experience.  Become a Flamingo Friend by giving to our inaugural membership drive. We still have so many places to go, people to see and stories to tell in the most vibrant of ways, and we need you right there with us. 

Sincerely,

Jamie & the Flamingo Team

story:
I Hope This Makes You Feel Less Alone is a book of poetry that welcomes you into my personal experiences, my losses and victories, my pains and joys, and many of the things which I’ve learned along the way. It represents the ways in which I’ve been impacted by others and the way in which our stories are woven together beautifully, though we may not notice it in the moment. It is a book about grief and loss yet finding hope in the midst of it.

My name is Jordin West and I penned I Hope This Makes You Feel Less Alone. I hope these pages leave you with a resounding echo of hope, strength, and communion. For there is brilliance and beauty in our journeys, especially when they get to encounter one another. I hope that from reading this book, that you’ll realize the impact that art can have in one’s life and that you can acquire a sense of gratitude for all that is around you. Most importantly, I wrote this book in hopes that every single reader is able to recognize two things: first, that you are less alone than you think. And secondly, that you are more loved than you think.

The Book:

The book begins with my acknowledgments of people who have helped me get to where I am. Then, there is a poem that opens up the idea of who I hope this book is able to reach and encourage (disclaimer: it’s everyone), regardless of current or past situations, pains, or regrets.

After the initial opening, the book is separated into two parts.

The first part is titled Sorrow and Pain. It walks through circumstances in my life that have left me feeling like I was sucker-punched, fighting and gasping for breath. It is a collection of some of my greatest pains and holds the depths of many of my sorrows. It is honest, raw, and unfiltered.

The second part is titled Hope Beyond What’s Seen. It is an assortment of lessons I’ve come to realize through my losses and phrases that have gotten me through to the other side. And I hope they can do the same for you: remind you of greater things ahead, pain left behind, and hope on the horizon.

 

What I Need & What You'll Receive:

I am publishing this book through Author Solutions. I have set-up tiers to help cover the cost that is in place to publish my work. The money raised in support will go towards editing, design and layout, launching and promoting, as well the production. 

There are perks included such as copies of the book, hand-written cards, personalized poems, and thank you videos! I'm excited to thank you guys individually.

If I don't reach the entire goal, I plan on keeping what was raised and finding another source to finish the publication of my book.

About the Author:

I am a current, soon to be graduated, senior at Geneva College. I will be receiving my bachelor’s in student ministries. I have never taken a writing class, except for one in high school. Writing wasn’t something that came naturally to me, but rather something that I picked up on my journey of attempting to process through difficult situations and emotions.

For an example of my writing, you can check out this spoken word I got the opportunity to write and be featured on a friend’s release! (https://youtu.be/bnWHFAak8_k)

Apart from writing and leading at church, I love to simply be in nature and experience the goodness of the created world. Creation encourages, inspires, and humbles me every single time I explore it.

I’m a firm believer that every encounter we have with one another, whether in passing, or through reading, or person, every encounter is priceless and holds potential. I believe that we are far more capable of great, brilliant, and stunning things together than we ever would be capable of on our own. The other has the ability to better us and help us become who we are intended to be. And that’s why I wrote this. Hoping that my words can remind you of your beautiful potential and help you fight another day, because you’re worth it.

I have walked through many losses, as well as anxiety at times and depression more so. I have felt more alone than I’d care to admit. And I would never want anyone else to feel alone in their pain, because there’s nothing worse. And so, if nothing else, I hope I am able to remind you of the beauty that is in the potential of tomorrow and of the hope that can be found in today. You are not alone, and never will you be.

Feel free to reach out if you have questions or want more information! You can contact me at the following:

  • Email: littlejordin1998@gmail.com
  • Instagram: @jordin_west_23
  • Facebook: Jordin West

 

Risks & Challenges:

As with anything, challenges arise. The main challenge with publishing a book is being able to distribute the finished product to each supporter. Because of that, I have taken the precaution of ensuring that this will not be an issue by incorporating the costs of shipping and mailing of the copies within each tier.

Other Ways You Can Support:

For some, it’s understandable that you may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t diminish the role you can play in this process.

Please share my campaign on social media platforms, as well as personally with friends or family. If you post, feel free to tag me and my publisher (Author Solutions).

Whatever part you may play in this process, know that you’re appreciated and that you’re never alone. Thank you for the support and for the love, it is returned to you!

 

With all my gratitude,

Jordin West :)

I am publishing this book through Author Solutions. I have set-up tiers to help cover the cost that is in place to publish my work. The money raised in support will go towards editing, design and layout, launching and promoting, as well the production. 
There are perks included such as copies of the book, hand-written cards, personalized poems, and thank you videos! I'm excited to thank you guys individually.
If I don't reach the entire goal, I plan on keeping what was raised and finding another source to finish the publication of my book.
About the Author:
I am a current, soon to be graduated, senior at Geneva College. I will be receiving my bachelor’s in student ministries. I have never taken a writing class, except for one in high school. Writing wasn’t something that came naturally to me, but rather something that I picked up on my journey of attempting to process through difficult situations and emotions.
For an example of my writing, you can check out this spoken word I got the opportunity to write and be featured on a friend’s release! (https://youtu.be/bnWHFAak8_k)
Apart from writing and leading at church, I love to simply be in nature and experience the goodness of the created world. Creation encourages, inspires, and humbles me every single time I explore it.
I’m a firm believer that every encounter we have with one another, whether in passing, or through reading, or person, every encounter is priceless and holds potential. I believe that we are far more capable of great, brilliant, and stunning things together than we ever would be capable of on our own. The other has the ability to better us and help us become who we are intended to be. And that’s why I wrote this. Hoping that my words can remind you of your beautiful potential and help you fight another day, because you’re worth it.
I have walked through many losses, as well as anxiety at times and depression more so. I have felt more alone than I’d care to admit. And I would never want anyone else to feel alone in their pain, because there’s nothing worse. And so, if nothing else, I hope I am able to remind you of the beauty that is in the potential of tomorrow and of the hope that can be found in today. You are not alone, and never will you be.
Feel free to reach out if you have questions or want more information! You can contact me at the following:

Email: littlejordin1998@gmail.com

Instagram: @jordin_west_23
Facebook: Jordin West

 

Risks & Challenges:
As with anything, challenges arise. The main challenge with publishing a book is being able to distribute the finished product to each supporter. Because of that, I have taken the precaution of ensuring that this will not be an issue by incorporating the costs of shipping and mailing of the copies within each tier.

Other Ways You Can Support:
For some, it’s understandable that you may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t diminish the role you can play in this process.
Please share my campaign on social media platforms, as well as personally with friends or family. If you post, feel free to tag me and my publisher (Author Solutions).
Whatever part you may play in this process, know that you’re appreciated and that you’re never alone. Thank you for the support and for the love, it is returned to you!
 
With all my gratitude,
Jordin West :)

story:
My Memoir

This book is my memoir—a memoir that for several years now, I have known I would one day write. But let’s set the record straight right here. Part, but only part, of the impetus for writing my memoir at this time, is the publishing of our daughter’s book, Educated.

I want to tell the story of my life as I really lived it.  I want my grandchildren to know who their grandmother is and was, and I want to be a force for good in their lives. Also, I feel a compelling desire to shine a light of accuracy on homeschooling, herbal medicine, and the living of a conservative and Christian way of life.

Self Publishing

There are significant differences between self-publishing a book and submitting a manuscript to a publisher. One important difference is that when an author signs with a publisher, the author may be relinquishing at least some control over the content of their book. Final editorial decisions often rest with the publisher, even if those decisions are contrary to the author’s wishes. The motivations of the author and publisher may not always be aligned.

My Dream

The educational changes being implemented as a result of Covid-19 are changing perspectives about education. Parents everywhere are now carrying more of the responsibility of educating their children, and they are discovering how challenging— and how rewarding—it is to interact with your children in this way day in and day out. I see parents having the same desires for their children’s educations that we had in our day.

I also see a great deal of frustration as families try to ascertain what will work best for them. I tell these harried parents that filling in for the teacher temporarily is not the same as settling into homeschooling as a way of life and that it will get easier as they proceed. I feel a great deal of admiration for them as they take it on, adjusting and making the best of challenging situations.

I hope that this book in some small way will be encouraging to those struggling to pioneer a new way of educating their children.

About the Author

LaRee Westover was born in southeastern Idaho and attended public schools and Brigham Young University. She was blessed with an inquisitive mind, and stories about her early childhood often end with her having said, “I can do it myself!” She and her husband, Val, are the parents of two girls and five boys, all of whom were homeschooled. Six went on to receive more formal education, and three earned PhD degrees. Her family, which now includes 36 grandchildren, is the joy of her life LaRee prepared extensively and worked as a midwife for several years. She has published four books on homeopathic remedies, herbal remedies, and essential oils for the multimillion-dollar business, Butterfly Express. As an incorrigible optimist and consummate hard worker, LaRee continues to share her knowledge and experience by
teaching classes about alternative health care modalities. She is an active member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and lives with her husband of 45 years in Clifton, Idaho.

Thank you for taking time to read  my  campaign.
  If you decide to read my book I hope you enjoy it and come away with a happy heart.

story:
HELLO

My name is John Frederick. I am someone who at one time had a miserable life — many health issues, depression, addiction, financial difficulties, bankruptcy, homelessness and general discouragement. I was fairly hopeless; I didn’t think that that life was ever going to work for me.

Then starting in 1990, things began to change. Circumstances drove me to desparation and I began to learn spiritual principles that brought me up and out of the pits of despair into a life beyond my wildest dreams. Out of this journey, I have developed a 12-week course that is soon to be a self-published book:

Prosperity Now! A 12-Week Journey to the Life of Your Dreams

Using my own life’s story, from homeless, hopeless and addicted, to an amazing life of purpose and abundance, the Prosperity Now! course will show people how they can transform their life too. Using ancient and modern, practical spiritual principles — ones that anyone can develop and practice — people can move beyond their current circumstances— no matter how dire — and begin to see the possiblities and realize their dreams!

 

MY CAMPAIGN — Phase II

This 2nd Indegogo campaign will help me defray the costs of publishing the course as a self-study book. I want to help as many people as possible, but I can only take on a limited number of  individual students and groups. I want to publish the course as a book to get it out into the world.

Especially Now! in 2020, people need help, need answers, need hope. By contributing to Prosperity Now! you will be helping me to shine this light into the darkness, giving people the practical means they need to lift themselves out of poverty, dispair and helplessness.

In the current world crisis, this book is needed more than ever. I hope millions will use it to see past appearances, to the truth of their own greatness, and begin the journey to fulfill their deepest heart’s desires.

You can be a part of this effort to help people transform their lives, and thus help transform the world!
 

TESTIMONIAL 

John A. Frederick’s new book, Prosperity Now! A 12-Week Journey to the Life of Your Dreams, is a tour-de-force of practical, spiritual, and financial advice on how to achieve the life you’ve always wanted. Drawing upon [many spiritual paths, including] the Twelve Steps of Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), Frederick walks readers through a twelve-week course that teaches them not only how to find prosperity, but how to eliminate all the things blocking them from achieving it.
— Tyler Tichlaar, PhD., award-winning author of Narrow Lives and The Best Place


CAMPAIGN BUDGET and GOALS

So far, I have spent about $6,300 to ready the course as a self-published book.  I am looking for investors to support my work, and recoup some of my investment so I can use those funds to distribute the book widely, to schools, churches, support groups and others who could benefit from this knowledge.

I DO NOT charge a fee to Prosperity Now! students and groups for my courses. Everything is on the basis of “Tithing” which is the most powerful spiritual concept I use in my own life, to change my thinking and my circumstances. Tithing is the spiritual concept that recognizes that it is the Universe (or God if you prefer) that supplies our good. We are merely giving back a small portion of what we have been blessed with, to gain even more abundance. A tithe is 10 percent.

So, in this way, someone who has nothing (literally) pays nothing (literally). Ten percent of zero is — zero! I do not charge a fee because I do not see this as a profit-making venture, but rather a vehicle to spread joy and abundance to people who need it.

My budget is as follows:

Editing, layout and book cover: $4,215

Website design, domain name, email, $1,840

Misc. $545

TOTAL $6,600

For investors/donors to my Indegogo campaign, I will offer autographed copies of my book, once it is available.

At higher donation levels, I will offer Zoom counselling sessions, from a 1.5 hour session all the way up to a full 12-week full-blown Prosperity Now! course for 8-10 people!

If I do not reach my entire goal, the funds I do receive will go toward making the course/book available to people all over the world who need a path out of poverty to success. If the goal is exceeded, there are plans to have the course translated into other languages!

 

THE IMPACT

I fully believe that the secrets to abundance and prosperity are not secret at all. They are just ways of seeing that are usually 180 degrees opposite of how people are taught to see things. 
By helping people see in a new way, I believe that these ideas will help make individual lives better, thus their families will improve, thus their neighborhood and community will be inspired and change, and then their nationand the whole world.

It is not the world that needs changing so much as how we see it, for when we “see it right” it changes before our very eyes! 
 

I have helped 2 dozen people individually and in small groups, and the impact has been measurable. It is the right time to cast a wider net and help more people be free, to grow and have better, richer, fuller lives!

Perhaps some people will be put off by the emphasis on the Christian Bible. Others perhaps by my mention of Taoism, or A Course in Miracles, or 12-Step programs. Perhaps they will look unfavorably on my emphasis on tithing and money as a vehicle to open up consciousnesses. Perhaps they will cynically view this as just another “scam” to get rich by taking people’s money.

I cannot be affected by those energies, except to quote Herbert Spencer, “There is a principle...which cannot fail to keep [people] in everlasting ignorance — that principle is contempt prior to investigation.”

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help, because YOU CAN! Here’s how:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools and circulate widely!

Sign up to take Prosperity Now! with me. I do not charge a fee for students!! Your only cost is to purchase the book. Prosperity Now! is a tithe-based program. As you prosper, you tithe and everyone around you prospers too. It’s all explained in Chapter 1.

And that's all there is to it.
