story:
My name is Jax Goss, and my great love and passion is finding strange and quirky tales and poetry and art and putting them out into the world for people to read. I want to be the way you discover your new favourite writer. 

For the last year or so, I have been creating a little journal of stories and poetry using the power of crowdfunding, through Patreon. Latchkey Tales started out as an experiment in subscription-based crowd-funding, but has turned into something a lot more: it is now a labour of love for me - kind of my urchin child. The quality of the stories, poetry and art that I receive for this project constantly amazes me, and it is an honour to be able to bring them to you. 

This campaign is for an Omnibus of all our first year's writing and art, packaged beautifully in a single book. The breath-taking cover design is by Crimson City, Inc.  

Funding Goals

The primary funding goal goes towards all the writers and artists who have been willing to work for Latchkey for minimal payments. They get a cut of the subscriptions from Patreon, but it is nowhere near what they deserve, so my goal with this campaign is to knock their payments up to what I would like to be paying. 

Anything extra will go into the current year's batch of writers and artists, and allow me to supplement the Patreon subscriptions. 

There are a number of rewards, and I have a few stretch goals up my sleeve if we hit our target! But the major reward you get is this amazing book full of truly exceptional writing by some of the best up and coming indie writers. 

Why Indiegogo?

I often get asked why I choose to use crowdfunding instead of taking more traditional routes. Several years ago, Dominica Malcolm and I started Solarwyrm Press. We wanted to connect directly with readers, fans and other writers and artists, and we thought that the crowdfunding model was an exciting and effective way to do that.  We didn't really know what we were doing, and were kind of making it up as we went along, but since then we have discovered that our basic tenet was spot on. 

In the time since then, Solarwyrm has produced a number of books, and we've had the opportunity to work with a wealth of incredibly talented people, and to connect with readers and fans all over the world. The community in which crowdfunding allows creative people to work is constantly inspiring and astonishing to me. 

Latchkey Tales is, in many ways, the epitome of this. Many of the people who have created stories, poems and art for Latchkey have become more than just work colleagues - they've become community, friends. There is no way Latchkey could exist without the willingness of the artists and writers to put their hearts into it with me. And there is no way it could exist without the subscribers who buy and read these stories month after month. It can't exist without you. I call it my urchin child, but it is really the urchin child of this entire community, which continues to foster and nurture it. 

If you're not already part of that community, you should come join us. It's lovely in here. ;) 

Other Ways You Can Help

As always, if you can't contribute to the campaign directly, please spread the word! The best thing you can do for us (short of buying the book of course) is to hit the share buttons. Do it! :D

story:
Հավաքված գումարն ամբողջությամբ տրամադրվելու է Ջորջ Ռ. Ռ. Մարտինի «Երգ սառցի և հրո» վիպաշարի առաջին հատորի՝ «Գահերի խաղի» թարգմանությանը:  

Շատերդ եք դիտել սերիալը: Շատերդ սպասում եք հերթական սեզոնին: Գիրքը կարդացողները ևս քիչ չեն: Ցավոք, առայժմ գիրքը միայն անգլերեն, ռուսերեն կամ էլ այլ լեզուներով է: Եվ, առհասարակ, ներկայումս շատ քիչ հայերեն թարգմանություններ են լույս տեսնում:

Մենք ուզում ենք գիրքը կարդալ հայերեն: Ուզում ենք,որ մեր հայրենակիցներն էլ կարդան: Թարգմանիչ կա: Բայց գրքի (գրքերի) ծավալը մեծ է, շատ մեծ: Ամեն մի հատորը ամիսների աշխատանք է ենթադրում: Գործը պետք է ֆինանսավորել, ինչի համար էլ բացել ենք այս դրամահավաքը:

Մենք մեր առջև դրել ենք բավականին իրատեսական նպատակ՝ հավաքել ընդամենը $2500, որը բավականին փոքր գումար է նման հսկայական թարգմանչական աշխատանքի համար: Մենք ձեզ չենք առաջարկում տարատեսակ փոքրիկ նվերներ, փոխարենը՝ դրամահավաքի հաջող ընթացքի դեպքում դուք կունենաք հնարավորություն կարդալու սիրելի գիրքը մայրենիով՝ որակյալ թարգմանությամբ:

Աջակցե՛ք մեր գործին՝ կատարելով ձեր ներդրումը կամ էլ պարզապես տարածելով դրամահավաքի էջը:

******* ******* ******* ******* ******* ******* ******* ******* ******* 

The gathered funds will be wholly spent on the translation of "A Game of Thrones" into Armenian. "A Game of Thrones" is the first novel in “A Song of Ice and Fire”, a series of high fantasy novels by American author George R. R. Martin.

Many of you have watched the television series, many of you are waiting for the upcoming season. There are also lots of people who prefer reading. The books have been published in several languages, but, unfortunately, there is no Armenian version until now. Overall, nowadays there is a lack of qualitative translated literature in Armenian.

We would like to have the opportunity to read this book in our native language. There’s a professional translator, who is eager to work with us. But on the other hand, the translation of a single volume implies months-long labor, which requires considerable funds. That is why we have launched this crowdfunding campaign.

We have set ourselves a realistic goal – to collect a total amount of $ 2500, which is quite a humble sum for such an immense translating work. We do not offer you a variety of small gifts, but if the fundraising campaign is a success, you will have the opportunity to read the favorite book in our native language.

Support us by contributing to our crowdfunding or just spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

·  My names are Cornelius David, an African-American. An Amazon author with many books in my credit.

·The internet is all about websites, and websites are about valuable contents for visitors. And websites contents are mainly articles. You’ll visit a website because you want certain information; and over 90 percent of information on websites is usually in form of articles.

So, it means that for website owners to draw and satisfy their visitors, they need to have valuable articles on their websites, lots of websites owners can’t write article themselves because their busy schedules. And this where the opportunity has opened up for article writers who could write articles and make great income right from their homes, at their set time. The book $700 - $5,000 For 1,000 Words contains an immediate access to the job, specifically for U.S residents only.

Non U.S residents can equally do the job, but MUST choose the No. 4 perk of this project to get the step by step guide and procedure that is compiled in the chapter 10 of the eBook ($700 - $5,000 For 1,000 Words). The company will ask you to choose topic preferably one that you are passionate and knowledgeable about. And receive your money via PayPal.

Let me expatiate a little on the job’s requirements: you will be expected to write a test on any of the below topic to substantiate your knowledge in article writing:

1.  Sight-seeing in your city (or your favorite city visit

2.  Party location in your city.

3.  Objective description of a technical object.

4.  A description of your favorite store, business or brand.

Your best in the test determine your rating and how much you will be paid per word. Details as follows:

** Comprehensiveble  $0.7 cent per word X 1,000 words $______

*** Average  $1.0 cent per word X 1,000 words $______

**** Above average $1. 4 cent per word X 1,000 words $______

***** Professional $5.0 per word X1, 000 words $________

My assurance, eventually you got this online job offer kit and the eBook, what I stated in there is not REAL, be the first to blow the trumpet before the expiration of this project on “Indiegogo crowd funding platform. Immediately you got the writing job kit and the eBook, commence their free registration right away.

We are just starting, thinking to grow into world class publishing company; without funds we can’t get there: but with our backers believing in what impact we can create. We all together achieve the greater height of our dreams. The project is in important to us, but the expectations of our BACKERS on this project must came first in realization of our goal.

With this campaign, we plan to raise funds to establish a publishing company and to help publish the hard copy of the eBook ($700 - $5,000 For 1,000 Words). The book has all one needed to succeed as an article/content creator.

What We Need & What You Get

The project will gulp about $150,000; it might not sound interesting that this project funding goal is $500 here.  I’m not dislodged of low fund goal, neither proud of how much bucks this project got to fetch, but how many lives it will affect.

What We Need & What You Get

·  We have some great perks, including a work from home online writing job, $700-$5,000 For 1,000 words eBook, authoring a chapter( if you’re aspiring writers/authors). Also we have low cholesterol foods like cashew nut and kidney beans. And bitter cola. Finally, our eBook in hardback cover.

·  If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will learn from the mistake and start small with what we have.

The Impact

We hope to raise awareness: not just for working from home sake, but using this medium to salvage those whom where not okay with their current job

·  Apart from being an author, freelancer/ghostwriter, I haven’t done any project of this kind, gradually taking the ladder of success step by step.

Risk & Challenges

Before I became Amazon author, I have done a book project with a company that the name cannot be mention here. After receiving my book publishing kit and charges paid, they couldn’t promote my book. I lost all the bucks invested; I gathered the pieces and start all over again. Dashing back to my freelancing job helped me a lot.

·  On engaging on project or contract, the clause must be well-understood, and also split the contract or project into various parts, and ensure that I must get a perfect outcome.

Other Ways You can Help

Some people can’t just contribute, but doesn’t mean you can’t help.

·  Get the word/link of the project out and make some noise, with your facebook update news feed precisely. Also your twitter handles and email messages. You may have touch live somewhere out there, and they can’t stop thanking you.

·  Thank you so much for taking the time to get involved. This means so much more to us than you will ever know.

story:
Who Are You Exactly?

We're UNTUCKED, your friendly neighborhood arts magazine. We gather local writers, musicians, and artists and get them together so young, passionate, creative minds like yourself can enjoy the fruits of their labors. Most importantly, we put an honest to goodness real live magazine in your hands, because we understand how important it is, in this ephemeral age of information, to hold a solid page in your hands and drag your eyes across some good art. The printed issue is the center of everything we do at UNTUCKED, and it’s where you and your donation come in.

So What's My Money Get Me?

Let’s face it: books don't grow on trees. Well, technically they start as trees, but we don't have time to get into that here. Eventually, once the trees have reached the point of being paper, the paper needs to be printed, bound, finished, and delivered. And that costs money. Though a portion of your donation does go to various other things like overhead, funding this campaign, donor perks, etc, the bulk of the money goes directly to the production of the physical magazine.

We've priced out the minimum amount of money we need to publish Volume I, Issue II. In the graph below you can see exactly how much money will go where if we meet our $7,500 goal.



If we do meet our minimum we will post "stretch goals" that will further help the production and success of Volume I, Issue II of UNTUCKED. We promise to never use the money for anything other than progressing the magazine. Your money will not get the Editors a trip to Hawaii, nor will it pay for a brand new car. Every penny raised from this campaign will support our dream of producing a magazine that we (and you) can be proud of.

So Why Should I Trust You?

We've got experience. This is the second issue of UNTUCKED and we've worked out the kinks, kicked the tires, and taken it around the block. The Staff of UNTUCKED have combined years of experience in the production and distribution of periodicals, from the high school to the university levels and beyond, and we have connections to outlets capable of getting UNTUCKED into the hands and minds of the community. So, as much as its always a bad sign when a fictional character says it: trust us, we've done this before.

Ok, But What Are The Risks? Didn't I Read That Print Was Dead? Can I Be Charged With Grave Robbing? 

Print is a proven technology. We're not designing, prototyping or doing anything with hypotheticals. It’s simple, we've got the writing, we've got the art, we've got the design. All we need is you, and your donation, and we can push the button that gets the magazine rolling off the presses. Really, the only risk in this day and age is that no one reads it. And you wouldn't not read a magazine you funded, would you?

So join us. Help us give a platform to the voices of young writers and artists who have important things to say about their experiences and our world. Help us do something that brings communities together. Help us do something we can all be proud of.  Help us do something that you can honestly say is good. Join us. Let your hair down, loosen that tie, stop censoring yourself. Be unscripted, unbuttoned, UNTUCKED.

So What Else Can I Do To Help?

There are plenty of other ways you can help us reach our goal.  You can start by sharing this page with everyone you know! Email your friends and family and make Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram updates.  Every little bit will help us reach our goal.  Check the list below for other ways you can help us out:

1) Submit a piece for consideration and encourage your friends to, too! We're always looking for great new work to publish. 

2) Tell people in person! We also have a Call for Submissions below that you can print out and share.


                      


3) Do something crazy*, film it, and tell people you’re doing it to help UNTUCKED raise money for Volume I, Issue II. After you've completed your task send the video on to us and we'll share it around as well.

*Please don't hurt yourself though, we can't cover any medical expenses!!

4) Get creative!  Money is great but we also need help getting the word out! And if you do come up with a fun way to spread the word please tell us all about it!


Thank you so much for your support! We truly appreciate your time and commitment.

All the best,
the Editors

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lupita Peimbert. As professional journalist, I have been telling stories on traditional media for as long as I can remember. I currently blog, post, tweet, and pin often - with the intention to somehow inspire others to do what they have always wanted.  I aspire to become a published author.

A few years ago, I crossed the ocean from North America to France, in an imperfectly planned relocation, alone. I trusted that if I stayed forever or even just for a few months, it would be transformational, and Paris was worth the risk. Divorced, single, and more or less stuck in matters of the heart, I was hoping to find love once and for all.  

Winter in Paris (working title) is creative storytelling about dating, being alone, lust, and friendly coincidences. It’s mix of reality and fantasy that I lived or perceived during my three-month stay. Readers will also learn about beautiful Paris, what it may take to relocate, and how to meet people and date in another city. I took beautiful pictures and plan to include some of them too.


What We Need & What You Get

I plan to self-publish first. This campaign will help me cover publishing costs (i.e. for an editor, proofreader, fact-checker, and graphic designer), and marketing costs such as website and collateral materials for promotions and sales. 

In appreciation for your generosity, I offer several unique perks that you can choose from:

  • Everyone who support this campaign will be mentioned on the website.

  • Your name on the book's website. Thank you! (Contribute $5)

  • Your name on the book's website, and a thank you note. ($10)

  • Email correspondence about a topic that interests you ($25)
    a) Tips for dating
    b) Planning a trip to Paris
    c) Brainstorming about relocating

  • A phone call about one of the above subjects ($40)

  • A signed copy, when printed. ($50)

  • I'll speak about Paris at a gathering organized by you ($100)

  • Your name included in the book, as supporter ($150)

  • I’ll meet and talk about writing or publishing your own book ($200)  

  • You’ll be in the guest list for an unforgettable cocktail party in Paris, shall I ever become wealthy enough to host it. I mean it. ($500 or more) 

If we surpass our goal, I could apply to distributing the book or go on a book tour, or make postcards out of some of the amazing pictures I took, and pursue publishing houses. Shoot, I could even translate the book to other languages. (I’d better stop here!) 

If we don't reach our goal, I would apply the collected funds to self publishing as possible, with priority given to editor, graphic designer, and whatever other publishing needs are pressing from there. 

The Impact

Publishing Winter in Paris will help me tell stories that resonate with single women and men around the world, inspiring them to act. Who does not want to find love? How far would you go? How important is it to take a leap of faith, and trust the outcome? How about moving to the city of your dreams? What if you move and end up not finding love? What happens when you go home? My stories are your stories, too, or they could be.

Risks & Challenges

I have never self-published, and so I may be oblivious to certain details. But I have taken workshops and read about successful paths to self-publication. 

Like anyone, I have self-doubt at times. English is not my first language. Vocabulary may be a roadblock at certain moments, to convey exactly what I mean. But when I think about the voices of millions who call North America home, I feel confident that we need to be heard and our stories told and published.

Most importantly, I am a communicator and an aspiring writer. Good storytelling comes from the heart and the spirit. I will find support in a good editor. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you believe in this project, are curious about my stories, or simply love Paris, there are many ways you can help:

  • Please become a team member for the Winter in Paris campaign.

  • Help me get the word out via your Facebook and other social media pages.

  • Send a massive email to your friends, in support of printing Winter in Paris, and include links to this Indiegogo campaign.

Please make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools! 


I say thank you in advance, and I sincerely wish that you realize your dreams and goals. 

Sincerely, 
Lupita Peimbert.
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Lupita Peimbert. As professional journalist, I have been telling stories on traditional media for as long as I can remember. I currently blog, post, tweet, and pin often - with the intention to somehow inspire others to do what they have always wanted.  I aspire to become a published author.

A few years ago, I crossed the ocean from North America to France, in an imperfectly planned relocation, alone. I trusted that if I stayed forever or even just for a few months, it would be transformational, and Paris was worth the risk. Divorced, single, and more or less stuck in matters of the heart, I was hoping to find love once and for all.  
Winter in Paris (working title) is creative storytelling about dating, being alone, lust, and friendly coincidences. It’s mix of reality and fantasy that I lived or perceived during my three-month stay. Readers will also learn about beautiful Paris, what it may take to relocate, and how to meet people and date in another city. I took beautiful pictures and plan to include some of them too.

Sincerely, Lupita Peimbert.

story:
Las mejores Cheesecake, las de mi abuela...

Desde que era una niña muy pequeñita disfruté de los postres de mi abuela, mi favorito y el de toda la familia, la cheesecake.  Durante años fue mi perdición, no podía esperar a que llegara el fin de semana para visitarla y chuparme los dedos . La rubia, como llamaban a mi abuelita era tan especial y me quería tanto que después de muchos años cuando le pedí su receta super secreta no lo dudo en ningún momento.

Aunque a mi no me sorprendió porque sabía que su corazón era enorme, demasiado grande diría más bien, además de darme la receta me enseñó con mucha paciencia y paso a paso como hacerla, lo mejor de todo fue que me transmitió el cariño y la pasión que debía añadirle para que todo tuviera sentido.

Comencé haciendo su cheesecake para los cumpleaños de la familia, luego para los de mis amigos, después para algunos restaurantes y al final por encargo. Durante los últimos años he recorrido muchas ciudades, en todas he dejado una huella y por fin, después de mucho andar, regreso con alegría a Madrid. Todos quedan encantados con mi cheesecake y otros postres que hago de forma totalmente artesanal siguiendo sus maravillosos consejos. 

Siempre me han insistido como locos para que abra una tienda, pero no he podido, por eso recurro a todos ustedes, para hacer mi sueño realidad.  Llevar el cariño inmortalizado de la rubia en forma de cheesecake a esos momentos tan especiales en los que se comparte un postre.  




Lo que necesito

Para poder abrir mi pequeña tiendita de cheesecakes en Madrid necesito conseguir gracias a todos ustedes por lo menos 20 mil euros que irán destinados a la obtención del local (alquiler), su acondicionamiento, equipos, materiales e ingredientes para mis postres artesanales.  En caso de exceder esa cantidad (saltaría en una pata), el dinero se invertirá en consolidarme aún más en el mercado. Por otro lado, en caso contrario, si no llegamos a la meta lo usaré para mejorar mi negocio hasta alcanzar la posibilidad de abrir las puertas de mi local.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si ahora no puedes aportar económicamente, no te preocupes, también puedes colaborar de forma muy significativa. Me puedes ayudar a difundir la campaña en tus redes sociales, con amigos, familiares, amantes de los postres artesanales y generar eco para que pueda así abrir mi tienda de cheesecake.

story:
Short Summary

Sometimes we find ourselves sliding down a slippery slope. Everything is fine until one day, we find ourselves at the bottom of the slope and we can't climb back up. We can't climb back up because it's too slippery and we are tired and have no energy or motivation to do so. 

We need to find a way to learn "The Art of Uphill Skiing"

The Art of Uphill Skiing will be an easy to read workbook, written as a result of my own personal journey back up that slippery slope. It will explain the 15 steps I use every day (see below)  when I need to feel happier, healthier and more in control

If you too are feeling a little lost, frustrated or unsatisfied with your life. If you, or anyone you know, are looking for a light-hearted, easy to follow solution that will help you find a way to be happier, healthier and more in control of your life every day. This book is the perfect place for you to start.

I'm looking for people to support me getting this project completed by pre-purchasing my book, to help me fund the publishing process and of course to let me know that you believe it is a worthy cause!

If you want to know more about me, my story and why I am writing this book, then read on....

My Story

I have been thinking about writing this book for over a year now, but in reality it's been a project that's been in the making for about 10 years and it's finally time to make it real, so that I can help others who are struggling just like I was.

It was January 2012 and I was curled up on my living room floor, crying uncontrollably. I was squinting at my mobile phone through floods of tears and trying to figure out how to could call for an ambulance. I could barely breathe, let alone talk to anyone and who could I call anyway?

I had run out of money, I felt like I had no friends and my life was in tatters.

I didn't know it at the time, but I was suffering from an anxiety attack. After struggling with depression for several years before, my body had finally had enough and it had decided that it needed me to deal with my situation.

Fortunately, I did find a friend to text and even though he was in Birmingham at the time, Mark helped me get my breathing under control and I managed to get an appointment to see a doctor.

My doctor prescribed anti-depressants. Having been on the pills before, I did not want to be stuck on them again and I wondered if maybe there was a better way to deal with the depression. My doctor got me to start claiming benefits to sort out my immediate money worries and suggested exercise, mindfulness and counselling. Some of this worked, but not consistently. So I started working on finding other ways to understand and overcome the depression and anxiety and finding ways to make it easier and longer lasting.

What I found was a set of tools that can be used by anyone to make them feel happier every day and to stay that way more often. These things can help us all and if you are a happy person most of the time, you will find that you are already doing many of them anyway, I know that I certainly was before I started to run into difficulties.

The Art of Uphill Skiing is the result of my personal journey and the solutions I found along the way. It will lay out the 15 steps I now use (almost) every day to help me feel happier and to live my life on my terms rather than just letting life happen to me. It's based on a lot of personal development books, audios and courses that I used (and continue to use) to help me recover and stay out of that deep hole of depression!

The 15 steps

The book will summarise everything I have learned, and signpost you to other books for further reading. It will be an easy to read, practical book, with exercises and tasks included to help you get into new, more beneficial habits. I will break down why each of these things is beneficial, how to do them and how to stick at them, and why sometimes we don't stick to our beneficial habits!

  • Being Happy
    • Write down 3 things you are grateful for every night
    • Make a positive music playlist
    • Spend time with people who lift you up
    • Do more things you enjoy
    • Read more life enriching books
  • Being Healthy
    • Eat & drink healthy
    • Get out into nature every day
    • Excercise more
    • Learn to breath more effectively
    • Practice meditation and/or mindfulness
  • Taking Control
    • Make bedtime sacred
    • Turn negative thoughts into positive ones
    • Have more money coming in than you have going out
    • Limit your intake of news and trashy TV
    • Avoid excess alcohol or similar vices

In Addition

I am already running workshops to help other people understand why they get stuck in depression and struggle with anxiety and what to do about it. In particular how to change that negative inner critic into a positive inner coach. This book will work as a companion workbook for those courses.

The book is going to be published on 3rd October at a book launch near Cardiff, UK. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word, because everyone is fighting a battle you may know nothing about, and this book could just help them.

Finally, do you know an illustrator who can help me with the diagrams and cartoons?

story:
The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat - October 22nd-25th, 2015



My name is R.J. Cavender and I love working with horror writers.

That's why I'm hosting this second writers retreat at the historic and haunted birthplace of Stephen King's The Shining, The Stanley Hotel in Estes Park, Colorado.

If you want to join us, simply register by choosing a package here on this campaign and I'll send you the code to receive the group discount rate when you make your hotel reservations.

*Editing Packages and Event Registration does not include your hotel room or transportation fees. Hotel room rates are listed at the bottom of the page.*

But your registration does include all our group discount perks, select editing packages, inclusion on any outings/trips over the weekend, and a guaranteed tour of Room 217.

Join us on our Facebook group page and help us plan the trip together for 2015: https://www.facebook.com/stanleyretreat






We don't want to set a rigid schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and very limited programming. Instead we're offering a unique experience with a great group of authors and publishing professionals, in a fantastic hotel with a history steeped in horror (fiction?)

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors, whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your once-in-a-lifetime writing escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a scenic and spooky locale.

For the last few years I've served as the pitch session coordinator for three horror writers conventions, two of which I was also a co-chair. So I've had some solid experience seeing how hosting events operates from the inside. And with the first Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat being a successful event, we've decided to return in 2015 for a weekend we'll all remember for years to come. I hope you find this idea as exciting as I do, and I truly hope you'll join us for this unique and haunting writing experience! The Stanley Hotel is truly amazing...






Advance tickets will be available through the hotel for the Friday night Murder Mystery Dinner at The Stanley Hotel and the annual Shining Masquerade Ball on Saturday night, as well! Group rates are also available for ghost tours of the hotel and paranormal investigations.

Event registrations/packages for The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat are transferable, but non-refundable. If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register. Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles, and other event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this now...don't flake out...and we'll see you then!

Fees for cancellation with the hotel and every last detail to reserve rooms are listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will be within 24-hours, with instructions on how to redeem your room discounts at The Stanley Hotel once you've registered.

We hope to see you in October!





+Guest of Honor Authors+ appearing @ Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat 2015:

JACK KETCHUM



http://www.jackketchum.net/


JOSH MALERMAN


http://www.harpercollins.com/cr-107479/josh-mal...


RICHARD CHIZMAR


https://www.facebook.com/richardchizmar


TRENT ZELAZNY


https://www.facebook.com/trentzelazny


KEALAN PATRICK BURKE
(Due to impending deadlines, Kealan Patrick Burke has had to cancel.)


DANIEL KNAUF


http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0460567/


And don't forget about out pre-event party in Denver!
Wednesday we'll be staying at the La Quinta Inn - Denver Central.

http://www.laquintadenvercentral.com/

We'll be making a field trip over to StarBuds Medical and Recreational Marijuana Dispensary for those who'd like to buy some goodies for the trip!

It's LEGAL in Colorado, but feel free to ask me about any details...I'll be sure to answer any questions you may have about recreational marijuana and CO laws. 21+ only for this event. (Consume responsibly.)

http://starbuds303.com/


Later on Wednesday night (I'm thinking we'll likely go around 7pm):

http://www.13thfloorhauntedhouse.com/

And be sure to stay through SUNDAY...as that's when we're having our Overnight Paranormal Investigation and Sit-Down Writing Exercise!

The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat will have its own private paranormal investigation that WILL INCLUDE time to sit down and write in the infamously haunted Stanley Hotel Concert Hall! Discount group pricing of $40 will be collected closer to event time...with the investigation/write-in lasting for 5 hours, 10pm-3am on Sunday night.



About Your Hosts/Editors




R.J. Cavender is an Associate Member of the Horror Writers Association and the thrice Bram Stoker Award®-nominated editor of the +Horror Library+ anthology series from Cutting Block Press. Horror Library IV (co-edited with Boyd E. Harris) won the 2010 reader's choice Black Quill Award from Dark Scribe Magazine  in the Best Dark Genre Anthology category.

R.J. is also a publishing consultant and co-editor of the Bram Stoker Award-nominated Horror For Good: A Charitable Anthology, which includes stories from award-winning authors Jack Ketchum, Ray Garton, Ramsey Campbell, and Benjamin Kane Ethridge. His latest project for Dark Regions Press is The Midnight Meat Train: Special Definitive Edition by Clive Barker.

R.J. Is the managing editor of horror at Dark Regions Press, editor-in-chief at the new Cutting Block Books, an acquisitions editor at Blood Bound Books, and pitch sessions coordinator for World Horror Convention.

R.J. lives in Tucson, Arizona. His Favorite novel is The Shining. 




Chris Morey has edited the works of Joe R. Lansdale, Tom Piccirilli, Jeff Strand, Weston Ochse and Gord Rollo. Formerly the webmaster and Internet marketer for Dark Regions Press, he is now the owner and publisher of the press. He is the creator and editor of the Black Labyrinth imprint illustrated by Santiago Caruso, and is currently working on a hardcover project with Clive Barker. Chris has interviewed many renowned authors such as Ramsey Campbell, Rick Hautala, Mort Castle, W.H. Pugmire, Jeffrey Thomas, Simon Strantzas, Jeff Strand and many others. He has been interviewed by Dark Discoveries Magazine, Cemetery Dance Magazine, and Horror World.





Boyd E. Harris is the founder, co-editor, and former owner of Cutting Block Press, a small press company that specializes in anthologies of short and long horror fiction.  As publisher, his books Horror Library Volume 3, Volume 4, Volume 5, and Tattered Souls 2 were nominated for Bram Stoker Awards® for Superior Achievement in an Anthology. His last published anthology, Horror for Good: A Charitable Anthology was also nominated for a 2013 Bram Stoker Award.

Boyd has the exclusive distinction of being a Black Quill Award winning editor in two mediums, one for Dark Recesses Press magazine, and one for Horror Library Volume 4.

Boyd's work as editor has helped authors get stories optioned for films, as well as getting authors opportunities with larger publishers.

Boyd applies a theory that there should be balance between the storyline and the structure, and emphasizes the value of challenging a reader's imagination, while not allowing the read to become arduous. 




*Hotel Reservation Information* 


Attendees will be responsible for phoning in their reservations at The Stanley Hotel reservation line at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.

To receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code they received upon registering through this campaign.

Individuals will be responsible for paying their own room, tax and incidental charges. Guests will call The Stanley Hotel to make a reservation from the group room block and will be required to pay a deposit equal to 1 night  room rental.

Group rate of $179.00 per room, per night will be applied to guest’s entire 4-night stay-- October 22rd-25th, 2015. Single or double occupancy. 

Individual Cancellation Policy: Individual cancellations received within 30 days of arrival will be charged at the full rate for the entire stay, whether or not the group block commitment has been met or exceeded.

Cutoff Date

The block of rooms will be held until September 22, 2015.  Those rooms not reserved prior to this date will be released for general sale.  Reservations requests after this date will be taken on a space available basis at the higher of the contract rate or rate available at that time.  Should such requests be accepted, such room nights will be credited to your block for purposes of any calculation of attrition.

Room Assignments

The reservation department will attempt to accommodate specific requested room types, but cannot guarantee specific room types, locations, or room numbers.  Requested room types that are not included in the group block will be charged the prevailing  guestroom rate at the time the reservation is made.

Pre/Post Group Rates

The group rates will be honored on space available basis for group attendees up to 3 days before or after the group’s scheduled stay.

Check-in/Check-out/Change Rooms

Check in time begins at 4:00 pm.  Room availability cannot be confirmed until that time.  Check out time is 11:00 am. 

No Shows & Early/Late Departures

Rooms which have been reserved by and whose occupants fail to show on scheduled day of arrival will be billed for the total lodging amount for the contracted time.  Early departures and/or late arrivals will be charged the contracted nightly rate for the entire reserved stay.

Splitting Room Charges

If group attendees are to pay for their own rooms, tax and incidentals AND are sharing rooms, the following must be considered: The Stanley Hotel is unable to divide certain charges (telephone calls, restaurant charges, incidentals, etc.).  It is the responsibility of the individual whose name appears on the reservation folio to finalize all charges between the occupants BEFORE check out.

It is the responsibility of the group leader or meeting planner to inform all attendees of the above.

Package Delivery and Storage

All incoming boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee.  All outgoing boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee in addition to the shipping charges (if the hotel incurs these shipping charges) and must be made via FedEx or UPS with appropriate tracking information.  These charges will be billed to the Master Account.

Materials for your function may be sent to The Stanley Hotel no earlier than 72 hours prior to the beginning of your event. All packages must be properly addressed to the both client and the conference services manager; they must also outline the name of the group/event and the dates of the function. 

Shipment contents and delivery schedules are not the responsibility of The Stanley Hotel.  Return shipments must be completed within 48 business hours after the close of the event; clients are responsible for packaging and completing all shipping documents prior to departure from the hotel.



2014's Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat Group Photo


The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat Keytag
story_txt:
The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat - October 22nd-25th, 2015My name is R.J. Cavender and I love
working with horror writers. 

That's why I'm hosting this second writers retreat at the historic and
haunted birthplace of Stephen King's The Shining, The Stanley Hotel
in Estes Park, Colorado. 

If you want to join us, simply register by choosing a package here on this campaign and I'll send you the code to receive
the group discount rate when you make your hotel reservations. 

*Editing Packages and Event Registration does not include your hotel room or
transportation fees. Hotel room rates are listed at the bottom of the page.* 

But your registration does include all our group discount perks, select
editing packages, inclusion on any outings/trips over the weekend, and a
guaranteed tour of Room 217. 

Join us on our Facebook group page and help us plan the trip together for 2015: https://www.facebook.com/stanleyretreatWe don't want to set a rigid
schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since
this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and
very limited programming. Instead we're offering a unique experience with a great
group of authors and publishing professionals, in a fantastic hotel with a
history steeped in horror (fiction?) 

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors,
whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or
you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your
once-in-a-lifetime writing escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a
scenic and spooky locale. 

For the last few years I've served as the pitch session coordinator for three horror writers conventions, two of which I was also a co-chair. So I've had
some solid experience seeing how hosting events operates from the inside. And
with the first Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat being a successful event, we've decided to return in 2015 for a weekend we'll all
remember for years to come. I hope you find this idea as exciting as I do, and
I truly hope you'll join us for this unique and haunting writing experience! The Stanley Hotel is truly amazing...Advance tickets will be available through the hotel
for the Friday night Murder Mystery Dinner at The Stanley Hotel and the annual
Shining Masquerade Ball on Saturday night, as well! Group rates are also
available for ghost tours of the hotel and paranormal investigations.
Event registrations/packages for The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat are transferable, but non-refundable.
If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register.
Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles,
and other event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this
now...don't flake out...and we'll see you then! 

Fees for cancellation with the hotel and every last detail to reserve rooms are
listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will be within 24-hours,
with instructions on how to redeem your room discounts at The Stanley Hotel
once you've registered. 

We hope to see you in October!+Guest of Honor Authors+ appearing @ Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat 2015:JACK KETCHUMhttp://www.jackketchum.net/JOSH MALERMANhttp://www.harpercollins.com/cr-107479/josh-mal...RICHARD CHIZMARhttps://www.facebook.com/richardchizmarTRENT ZELAZNYhttps://www.facebook.com/trentzelaznyKEALAN PATRICK BURKE(Due to impending deadlines, Kealan Patrick Burke has had to cancel.)DANIEL KNAUFhttp://www.imdb.com/name/nm0460567/And don't forget about out pre-event party in Denver! Wednesday we'll be staying at the La Quinta Inn - Denver Central.http://www.laquintadenvercentral.com/We'll be making a field trip over to StarBuds Medical and Recreational Marijuana Dispensary for those who'd like to buy some goodies for the trip! It's LEGAL in Colorado, but feel free to ask me about any details...I'll be sure to answer any questions you may have about recreational marijuana and CO laws. 21+ only for this event. (Consume responsibly.)http://starbuds303.com/Later on Wednesday night (I'm thinking we'll likely go around 7pm):http://www.13thfloorhauntedhouse.com/And be sure to stay through SUNDAY...as that's when we're having our Overnight Paranormal Investigation and Sit-Down Writing Exercise! The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat
 will have its own private paranormal investigation that WILL INCLUDE 
time to sit down and write in the infamously haunted Stanley Hotel 
Concert Hall! Discount group pricing of $40 will be collected closer to 
event time...with the investigation/write-in lasting for 5 hours, 
10pm-3am on Sunday night.About Your Hosts/Editors 
R.J. Cavender is an Associate Member of the Horror Writers 
Association and the thrice Bram Stoker Award®-nominated editor of the 
+Horror Library+ anthology series from Cutting Block Press. Horror Library IV (co-edited with Boyd E. Harris) won the 2010 reader's choice Black Quill Award from Dark Scribe Magazine  in the Best Dark Genre Anthology category. R.J. is also a publishing consultant and co-editor of the Bram Stoker Award-nominated Horror For Good: A Charitable Anthology,
 which includes stories from award-winning authors Jack Ketchum, Ray 
Garton, Ramsey Campbell, and Benjamin Kane Ethridge. His latest project 
for Dark Regions Press is The Midnight Meat Train: Special Definitive Edition by Clive Barker. R.J.
 Is the managing editor of horror at Dark Regions Press, editor-in-chief
 at the new Cutting Block Books, an acquisitions editor at Blood Bound 
Books, and pitch sessions coordinator for World Horror Convention. R.J. lives in Tucson, Arizona. His Favorite novel is The Shining. Chris Morey has edited the works of Joe R. Lansdale, Tom 
Piccirilli, Jeff Strand, Weston Ochse and Gord Rollo. Formerly the 
webmaster and Internet marketer for Dark Regions Press, he is now the 
owner and publisher of the press. He is the creator and editor of the 
Black Labyrinth imprint illustrated by Santiago Caruso, and is currently
 working on a hardcover project with Clive Barker. Chris has interviewed
 many renowned authors such as Ramsey Campbell, Rick Hautala, Mort 
Castle, W.H. Pugmire, Jeffrey Thomas, Simon Strantzas, Jeff Strand and 
many others. He has been interviewed by Dark Discoveries Magazine, Cemetery Dance Magazine, and Horror World.Boyd E. Harris is the founder, co-editor, and former owner of 
Cutting Block Press, a small press company that specializes in 
anthologies of short and long horror fiction.  As publisher, his books Horror Library Volume 3, Volume 4, Volume 5, and Tattered Souls 2 were nominated for Bram Stoker Awards®  for Superior Achievement in an Anthology. His last published anthology, Horror for Good: A Charitable Anthology was also nominated for a 2013 Bram Stoker Award. Boyd
 has the exclusive distinction of being a Black Quill Award winning 
editor in two mediums, one for Dark Recesses Press magazine, and one for
 Horror Library Volume 4.Boyd's work as editor has helped
 authors get stories optioned for films, as well as getting authors 
opportunities with larger publishers. Boyd applies a theory that
 there should be balance between the storyline and the structure, and 
emphasizes the value of challenging a reader's imagination, while not 
allowing the read to become arduous.  *Hotel Reservation Information*  Attendees will be 
responsible for phoning in their reservations at The Stanley Hotel 
reservation line at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.To 
receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code
 they received upon registering through this campaign.Individuals
 will be responsible for paying their own room, tax and incidental 
charges. Guests will call The Stanley Hotel to make a reservation from 
the group room block and will be required to pay a deposit equal to 1 night  room rental.Group
 rate of $179.00 per room, per night will be applied to guest’s entire 
4-night stay-- October 22rd-25th, 2015. Single or double occupancy.  Individual
 Cancellation Policy: Individual cancellations received within 30 days 
of arrival will be charged at the full rate for the entire stay, whether
 or not the group block commitment has been met or exceeded.Cutoff Date The
 block of rooms will be held until September 22, 2015.  Those rooms not 
reserved prior to this date will be released for general sale.  
Reservations requests after this date will be taken on a space available
 basis at the higher of the contract rate or rate available at that 
time.  Should such requests be accepted, such room nights will be 
credited to your block for purposes of any calculation of attrition. Room AssignmentsThe
 reservation department will attempt to accommodate specific requested 
room types, but cannot guarantee specific room types, locations, or room
 numbers.  Requested room types that are not included in the group block
 will be charged the prevailing  guestroom rate at the time the 
reservation is made. Pre/Post Group Rates The
 group rates will be honored on space available basis for group 
attendees up to 3 days before or after the group’s scheduled stay.Check-in/Check-out/Change Rooms Check in time begins at 4:00 pm.  Room availability cannot be confirmed until that time.  Check out time is 11:00 am.  No Shows & Early/Late DeparturesRooms
 which have been reserved by and whose occupants fail to show on 
scheduled day of arrival will be billed for the total lodging amount for
 the contracted time.  Early departures and/or late arrivals will be 
charged the contracted nightly rate for the entire reserved stay. Splitting Room Charges If
 group attendees are to pay for their own rooms, tax and incidentals AND
 are sharing rooms, the following must be considered: The Stanley Hotel 
is unable to divide certain charges (telephone calls, restaurant 
charges, incidentals, etc.).  It is the responsibility of the individual
 whose name appears on the reservation folio to finalize all charges 
between the occupants BEFORE check out. It is the responsibility of the group leader or meeting planner to inform all attendees of the above. Package Delivery and Storage All
 incoming boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee.  All outgoing 
boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee in addition to the 
shipping charges (if the hotel incurs these shipping charges) and must 
be made via FedEx or UPS with appropriate tracking information.  These 
charges will be billed to the Master Account.Materials for your function may be sent to The Stanley Hotel no earlier than 72 hours prior to the beginning of your event. All packages must be properly addressed to the both client and the conference services manager; they must also outline the name of the group/event and the dates of the function. Shipment
 contents and delivery schedules are not the responsibility of The 
Stanley Hotel.  Return shipments must be completed within 48 business 
hours after the close of the event; clients are responsible for 
packaging and completing all shipping documents prior to departure from 
the hotel. 2014's Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat Group PhotoThe Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat Keytag

story:
Short Summary

The Drunken Odyssey with John King is a weekly podcast about the writing life. Since June of 2012,  I’ve released a new episode ranging from about an hour to 2 hours, with the occasional epic-length podcast. All 164+ episodes are free to download. I’ve interviewed many famous writers on this show, including David Sedaris, Cheryl Strayed, Chuck Klosterman, John Waters, Nikki Giovanni, Rick Moody, Tony Hoagland, Greg Proops, Sharon Olds, Irvine Welsh, Martin Amis, Walter Mosley, and many, many others. Besides interviewing writers, I bring in other writers for roundtable discussions related to literature, as well as respond to listener mail with David James Poissant and review books about the craft of writing with Vanessa Blakeslee.

The experience of putting on and releasing this show has been an extraordinary pleasure for me, but I do need some help making the show sustainable in the future. There are regular expenses of producing the show, travel expenses, and upgrades that would really help The Drunken Odyssey be able to keep releasing great content. I am asking m y listeners, new and old, to donate to the show towards these goals.

What We Need & What You Get

This year, I’m trying to raise $1,500. Any progress toward this ultimate goal will help us to achieve a number of incremental goals:

  • Administrative costs: hosting on Wordpress and file hosting on Libsyn.

  • Equipment upgrades: TDO really needs more microphones, digital recorders, and a good camera to build up our youtube content.

  • Travel: Miami Book Fair International is a significant cost, despite how frugal your podcast host tends to be.

  • Any cash left over will be saved towards future administrative costs. 

  • The perks are fab! 

  • If I reach my goal of $1,500, I'll record a bonus episode for donors.

The Impact

The Drunken Odyssey offers a great value to the literary community. Its interviews are remarkable. The breadth of its scope is impressive; where else can you listen to novelists, short story writers, poets, journalists, screenwriters, scholars, and artists discuss their process and life’s work? Plus, it’s like an uncensored NPR, so the host and guests can curse when necessary, or admit when the world happens to be fucking far from a civilized place.

I have managed to keep up the high quality of the show with a very limited budget, but will need a little help to sustain and improve upon the quality of the work I have been doing.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk of my podcast, as I see it, is stagnation. I don’t want the show to seem like an exercise asking the same questions and fielding a predictable range of answers. I happen to be fiercely curious, hence my unwillingness to limit the show to a genre. I have genuinely enjoyed every interview, whether the writer is experiencing her first book publication, or the author was an inaugural poet, like Richard Blanco. But I do want to keep exploring with this show, and to keep expanding the media it produces. In 2014, TDO released its first documentary, on the mermaids of Weeki Wachee Springs. There are many plans in the works for the future of TDO, both for the audio podcast and its youtube content.

The challenge is expanding without losing the high quality you’ve come to expect on the show. Generally speaking, TDO sounds great. The interviews sound sharp, and are memorable. If the economics of running the show were taken care of for the next year, which $1,500 would take care of, then I should be able to focus on these new adventures.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word of this campaign.

  1. You can spread the word of this campaign: http://igg.me/at/thedrunkenodyssey

  2. You can review the show on iTunes.

  3. You can like us on facebook.

Thank you for helping me keep up the good work!

story:
In August 2015, I will make my 3rd annual attempt to design, compose and mail 60-100 postcard poems to campaign contributors and to participants of the annual August Postcard Poetry Festival run by Paul E. Nelson. Contributions help pay for postcard printing costs, postage, and campaign gifts. 

This year I plan to compose poems in sets of approximately 10. Each set will be governed by a Celtic Cross tarot card spread. The source materials will be chosen based on the cards.

[photos and poem, titled "Anthropocenic: a celtic cross haibun," by Matt Trease]

story:
" 'Midnight, Me & Bob Macabre'  is a book I wrote for my son Jax, who was suffering from severe night terrors. It originally began as a little poem to help comfort the child, but I eventually decided to make it something bigger to try and help other kids get through their nightmares. It's also a kind of tool for parents to help diffuse the fear that their kids experience when faced with unpleasant sleeps."     -Crash LaResh

        

                                                    

The book is about  a little boy named Vex who has violent night terrors riddled with "Spookies". The night terrors are so bad that the Spookies invade his waking world. On top of being taunted by the foul creatures, everyone refuses to believe Vex- even his Mum and little sister Twink think he's crazy...poor kid. 

Enter Bob Macabre- infamous Spookie Wrangler and head of the Nightmare World. Bob teaches Vex how to conquer his fears and defeat the Spookies through a series of adventures.

                         

Tricia Martin- "I'm illustrating the world Crash has formed in his head based on Jax's descriptions of his night terrors...at least I try to ;) Each drawing has to receive the stamp of approval from Jax before they're made a permanent part of the book. I cower in fear each time I submit a drawing (kidding- we all actually get along quite well.)  

We've been working on the book together since 2007, and we wanna' finally be able to share it with the world and maybe help some kids...and their parental units, sleep a little better. "

        

                                        

What We Need & Your Prizes For Helping Us

We need to raise at least $8,000 to help us out with the artwork, IndieGoGo and Paypal fees, editing, layout and design of the book, creation of an e-book version, printing of hard copies, and the creation of the awesome perks we have for you over there on the right side of your screen. 

Perks include spooktacular t-shirts, signed posters, handwritten postcards, signed prints (You can see the poster/print designs that fans voted for in our Gallery), signed copies of the book, personalized greetings written for you or your kid by Crash LaResh himself, custom doodles by me- Tricia, and many, many more! Even our $5 donors get a prize! Yay! The perks won't bite, so scroll through and have a look. No worries, it's safe...very, very safe. 

                

If we don't make our goal, that's also safe- all donors will still receive their perks and our gratitudes...TENS of gratitudes! Of course the book perks would take much longer to get to donors because we'd have to find an alternate way of funding the production of them, but yes- we guarantee to honor all perks in as timely of a manner as possible.

If we exceed our goal by $1,000, there will be an initial stretch goal to create a Midnight, Me & Bob Macabre coloring book! Yay!  And YOU will be a part of deciding what that looks like! We'll be giving everyone a chance to vote on which of Tricia's drawRings are included in the coloring book- neat!

FUTURE STRETCH GOALS! If there is enough interest, we'd love to see this story animated! We've been in touch with Tony Todd (who played "Candyman") and have spoken with his agent about Mr. Todd doing the narration for a full-length animated version of the story. You can let us know if you'd like to see this happen by posting on FaceBook or Twitter using the hashtag #AnimateBobMacabre. We'll of course include new and more awesome perks :) More information to come if we reach our first two goals. Animation AND more perks! Yay moreperks! (yes all one word) 


The Impact You Have

ANY CONTRIBUTION has a HUGE impact on helping us bring this book to the world! I mean, yes we do need dollars to help make this book a reality, but sharing and spreading the word is just as important to us and just as much appreciated. You will be an integral part of making eight years of hard work and love for this book a reality and no words can express how awesome that is. 

We're working insanely hard to make this book as amazingly epic as possible for everyone. This is our first time doing anything like this, but every nano-second of work we put into it is more than worth the effort...a true labor of love. We sincerely hope you guys love it as much as we do.

                 

      


Dollar-Free Ways You Can Help

For those who can't help us with dollars, here's how you can still contribute...we appreciate it more than you know! 

-You can use the IndieGoGo share tools

-Share our campaign and update videos on Facebook and Twitter and tag peoples you think may like the book. 

-E-mail friends and family who may need more sleeps because of Spookies  (they need this book too...no matter their age)

-You can embed this campaign on your blog

-And if you have any other creative ways of helping us out, let us know! 

Seriously, a little bit of help goes a long, long way. Again- we appreciate any kind of support :)

                                            

Regarding Murphy's Law...

A few things we have to consider- Sometimes life happens and things end up getting slowed down. Our estimated shipping time is dependent on nothing weird happening along the way- such as mail being slow or something blowing up at the printer's. Perks and books are estimated to be shipped out sometime in November 2015- but hopefully we can have some of them out in time for Halloween. 

With the help of Tricia's husband Gordon, we will be making many update videos along the way and if anything drastic pops up to delay shipment, we'll let you know. We'll take care of any issues with the quicknesses of a bunny who is young and full of quicks. All appendages crossed everything will go smoothly :) 

About the shipping of perks- We researched the average shipping costs based on the weight of our perk packages to different parts of the Earth. Shipping and handling will be added to your pledge amount upon checkout depending on where you are in the world.

Always feel free to email us through IndieGoGo if you have any questions, or are interested in upgrading your contribution perks. Also, if you have any ideas for new or unique perks, we'd love to hear about them!  We're happy to help and appreciate any feedback you may have to offer :)

We'll be posting the update videos on our youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHlTb6em0QDtZW... 

and on our Facebook page and Twitter: 

https://www.facebook.com/midnightmeandbobmacabre 

@BobMacabre

If you've made it to this point....THANK YOU for taking the time to read through our campaign. You're awesome, and if we meet, we'll possibly bake you some tasty biscuits...that is- if you like biscuits. You like biscuits?

You will be an integral part of making eight years of hard work and love for this book a reality and no words can express how awesome that is. 
We're working insanely hard to make this book as amazingly epic as possible for everyone. This is our first time doing anything like this, but every nano-second of work we put into it is more than worth the effort...a true labor of love. We sincerely hope you guys love it as much as we do.
                       



Dollar-Free Ways You Can Help

 
For those who can't help us with dollars, here's how you can still contribute...we appreciate it more than you know! -You can use the IndieGoGo share tools-Share our campaign and update videos on Facebook and Twitter and tag peoples you think may like the book. -E-mail friends and family who may need more sleeps because of Spookies  (they need this book too...no matter their age)-You can embed this campaign on your blog-And if you have any other creative ways of helping us out, let us know! Seriously, a little bit of help goes a long, long way. Again- we appreciate any kind of support :)                                            Regarding Murphy's Law...A few things we have to consider- Sometimes life happens and things end up getting slowed down. Our estimated shipping time is dependent on nothing weird happening along the way- such as mail being slow or something blowing up at the printer's. Perks and books are estimated to be shipped out sometime in November 2015- but hopefully we can have some of them out in time for Halloween. With the help of Tricia's husband Gordon, we will be making many update videos along the way and if anything drastic pops up to delay shipment, we'll let you know. We'll take care of any issues with the quicknesses of a bunny who is young and full of quicks. All appendages crossed everything will go smoothly :) About the shipping of perks- We researched the average shipping costs based on the weight of our perk packages to different parts of the Earth. Shipping and handling will be added to your pledge amount upon checkout depending on where you are in the world.
Always feel free to email us through IndieGoGo if you have any questions, or are interested in upgrading your contribution perks. Also, if you have any ideas for new or unique perks, we'd love to hear about them!  We're happy to help and appreciate any feedback you may have to offer :)We'll be posting the update videos on our youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHlTb6em0QDtZW... and on our Facebook page and Twitter: https://www.facebook.com/midnightmeandbobmacabre @BobMacabreIf you've made it to this point....THANK YOU for taking the time to read through our campaign. You're awesome, and if we meet, we'll possibly bake you some tasty biscuits...that is- if you like biscuits. You like biscuits?

story:
I Trebor C. Worthe Sr. am on a noble quest to write quality stories that will educate and inspire. I have written 3 quality picture books to be self published and sold online and at upcoming children's festivals.


Bless You


Little tissue pleads to sneeze a me but mother tissue yearns for her child's protection.

Despite their differences, they work together and find out how blessed they really are.


"Little Tissue had a big issue.

MOM! Please! Bless me to SNEEZE!

Boogers! Gook! Eww the mess!

Trust me Tissue, a mother NOSE best!"

Tacocat


An evil olive named Dr. Olive unleashes his latest greatest creation, Tacocat to wreak havoc on the citizens of Wassanassaw.  Filled with humor and palindromes (words spelled forwarded and backward) readers will learn the importance of subtext.


"Elle, I’ll need the following ingriedents"!"

1 Tahini Hat! 101 Tangy Gnat!

"Wontons?"
 "NOT NOW, HANNAH!" Dr. Awkward was biserk.
"No lemon, no melon. Just stressed desserts! Thats it Anna! Nab A Bananna! Now Stir Grits!"

It was a wet stew that started to brew.

"Evil, a sin, is alive!"

I am a Thundercloud


Thundercloud empowers all children including those who are disabled. This book was written to celebrate children’s behavioral differences and teach children to accept their peers. Thundercloud provides an outlet for children by incorporating weather as the central theme. Illustrated by special needs children.


"I am a thunder cloud 
Boom boom pow
I'll say it twice and I'll say it loud!

I am a thunder cloud!
I am a thunder cloud!

Zip zip zap!
Zip zip zap!
I am a lightning bolt,
Zip zip zap!
Don't touch this and don't touch that!
I am a bolt a jolt of the Heebie jeebies,
"I can't help it I'm just me!"

Here's what you money breaks down to:

316.00 25 copies of 3 children's books through Create space

  • 99.00 scbwi one year membership fee
  • 450.00 scbwi winter conference registration fee (Publisher pitch, workshops, and agent sessions)
  • 35.00 Collingswood Book Festival Vendor Fee (October 3rd, 2015)
  • 100.00 for promotional materials (banner signs and business cards)

Percentages of my earned income will benefit the following organizations


Camp Winnarainbow


Together we can make this goal a reality. Bless you for your time, heart and donation!

story:
Este es Samu

Samu es una persona muy entregada con los demás. Le encanta el deporte, la salud y ayudar a los demás. Trabaja para diferentes asociaciones (niños, personas con discapacidad, etc.) y no para de esforzarse para poner su granito de arena y conseguir que las personas con dificultades tengan la vida un poco más fácil.

Sin embargo el tiene también una pequeña alteracíon en su visión. no es capaz de distinguir bien los colores.

Por eso, antes de que se vaya con una beca a ayudar a personas sordas en dificultades en la India, queremos hacerle lo que puede ser el mayor de los regalos:


Regalarle los colores.


Enchroma y su nueva tecnología


Hace menos de un año la empresa estadounidense Enchroma lanzó una tecnología novedosa que permitía a las personas con daltonismo apreciar los colores que no son capaces de ver normalmente.

Enchroma vende unas gafas de apariencia totalmente normal pero que tienen una polarización que permite que el solapamiento de los colores que se produce en estas personas se disuelva.

El precio de estas gafas está entre los 400 y los 500 euros sin contar gastos de envio desde EE.UU. Por eso necesitamos tu ayuda.

Cualquier aportación es importante, desde 1 euro hasta lo que quieras dar. Contamos contigo para dar a Samu una felicidad que no conoce.

En caso de que no consigamos recaudar todos los fondos, existen dos alternativas:

  • Puedo devolveros el dinero si me mandais un mail con la aportación que habeis hecho y vuestro nombre.
  • Puedo donarlo a una de las asociaciones con las que Samu trabaja, el Gato de Cinco Patas: una asociacion de discapacitados que hace una inmensa labor.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar


Si no puedes ayudar económicamente no siquiera con 1 o 2 euros, aún puedes ayudarnos compartiendo este crowdfunding por las redes sociales y a todos tus amigos.

¡Eres fundamental para nosotros!

Cualquier duda que tengas no dudes en contactarnos a este mail: marionun@hotmail.es

Muchisimas gracias de parte de todas las personas que queremos lo mejor para Samu.
Un beso y un abrazo enorme.

Página de la empresa


http://enchroma.com/test/instructions/


Vídeos de algunas reacciones


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ea_xOqNvntA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fTpCTDwjHZQ

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=orx4AQ64OW4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8KbalCkzaWs

story:
English explanation follows after Japanese explanation.

How to use Indiegogo

There is a lot to learn from your dog, but a dogs life is short.
INUPATHY is your chance to learn more from your dog, in depth.

How can we learn more from our dogs?
The idea is to LOOK INSIDE DOGS BODY.

INUPATHY senses the small changes in your dogs
heart rate, and visualize it in real time.

INUPATHY is the worlds first attempt to
visualize dogs mental condition, from heart rate analysis.

The INUPATHY cloud service will take care of dogs heart rate data.
Long term analysis of the dogs condition will be done at the cloud service.

The INUPATHY system consits of three components.
Hardware, application, and cloud service.

As our future vision, we will implement device connectivity.
Via smartphones or other relay device,
INUPATHY will be able to send emotion
data to various devices. Imagine what will happen!

A toy reacting to your dogs' attention!
A camera that catches your dogs' happiest moment!
A food bowl that can tell you how much you dog likes his meal!

*Some of the App features shown above are stretch goals.

INUPATHY is designed like a harness.
Sensor will be attached to the chest belt.
The broad white area of the device is the LED display.

INUPATHY will be a perfect gift for your families dog,
or your friends dog!

Hi, I am Joji Yamaguchi, inventor of INUPATHY.

I am a software hardware engineer living in Japan.
I am a father of a dog (was two), and two human children.

I was a biology researcher before I started my career as an engineer.
My main interest was in animal behavior. When I was 27, I got married. My wife brought her dog, Midori, with her, and I became a father of a dog.

Soon after our marriage, we invited a second dog to our family.
His name is Akane, and he is the very reason why I invented INUPATHY.
When he was young, Akane seemed to be always afraid of something.

I wanted to know him better. I wanted to know what made him stressed,
and how I can make him more relaxed.

When I touch his chest, I could feel his little heart beating, sometimes fast, and some times slow. I wanted to be able to sense this any time. And so, I came up with the idea of visualizing dogs heart rate.

To do this, I had to invent a sensor that can sense heart beat over thick fur, gently, with no pain.

I stepped in further to analyze heart rate. I modified HRV analysis,
which analyzes the fluctuation of heart beat rhythm,
so that it becomes suitable for dogs.
After carefully observing dogs' behavior and the HRV pattern,
I found patterns that appears typically when the dog is happy, and when the dog is concentrated.

INUPATHY gave me many insight about Akane.
For example, when he is afraid,
he can't be calm by talking to him gently.
I have to give him a gentle touch.

My belief is, that technology is not for human only.
Since our technology uses resource on earth,
we have to share it with other members on earth.

INUPATHY is also my first step to make a better
relationship with other species on Earth.
This is a dream far too big for one man. Please help me.
Become a part of the change we need to make.

During our user test, we have tried INUPATHY on more than 40 dogs.
It seemed to be working well,
but we must admit that there can be exceptions.
We also still have a lot to do to optimize our design,
to make it as comfortable for dogs as possible.
Therefore, please note that there could be design changes.

We aim to be certified for FCC, CE, and TELEC.
When shipping to areas where our wireless module is not certified,
we may have to disable the wireless connectivity of INUPATHY
(Heart rate analysis and LED display will be supported,
but will not be able to connect to other devices, such as iOS devices).

When we fail to meet our $30,000 goal,
we will give up making steel mold,
but will produce and ship the product,
with 3D print. In this case,
the device will not be flexible, and will not be drip-proof.

Battery life is currently approximately 5 hours
(this depends on the average heart rate).
We will try our best to make it last longer.

When we meet our $30,000 the majority of the money
will be spent on steel mold.
Remaining will be used on safety tests and authentications
(FCC, CE, TELEC).

Please feel free to contact us from our web site.
Tell us what you think about INUPATHY,
and our vision. Please become a part of the team.

AND PLEASE SHARE! Tell your friend our story.

with 3D print. In this case, 
the device will not be flexible, and will not be drip-proof.

(this depends on the average heart rate).
