story:
Hey everyone!

This is my first campaign aimed at raising funds for my first book in Russian that will help Russian-speaking people to learn languages in a more efficient way.

This book is linked to my course for self-studying on a famous portal 4Brain.ru

This book unites my experience from academia, travelling and teaching during the past 8 years. This book will help people to save their time and nerves while learning a language on their own or with a tutor. 

I am currently working on another book in English that is a spin-off of my academic research on the theory of secondary linguistic personality. And this book is linked to my TEDx talk. 

I would appreciate your support for my projects as we all have our dreams that we want to realise. 

Now in Russian:

Дорогие друзья, книга "Полиглот по собственному желанию. Уникальный метод Amolingua" наконец родилась. Данная книга собрала воедино мои теории и практики изучения иностранных языков непосредственно для русскоговорящей публики. Мои года академии, странствий и преподавания не прошли даром. 

Данная книга была написана во время работы над курсом для самостоятельного изучения языков на портале 4Brain.ru. Курс также скоро появится в свободном доступе в сети. 

Книга предназначена для людей, желающих наконец заговорить на иностранном языке. Она включает в себя практические советы по постановке целей, мотивации, подготовке к процессу изучения и осуществлению самой мечты общения на иностранном языке. Также она подойдет и тем, кто хочет изучает несколько языков самостоятельно.

Советы соединяют мои реальные истории из жизни и академические практики, поэтому скучно точно не будет.

Первые страницы книги можно найти здесь:  

https://vk.com/matveevaev?w=wall88909888_3189%2Fall

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10208551996019619&set=pcb.10208551999899716&type=3&theater

На что нужны средства:

На данном этапе книга требует профессионального редакторского пера, верстки, приобретения иллюстраций и создания обложки. Книга будет протестирована в различных форматах для чтения на электронных устройствах. 

При сотрудничестве с профессиональным агенством редактура и верстка уже встает в $320 + покупка официальных изображений на стокмаркете обходится в сумму от $60, а остальное уходит на содержание краудфандинговой платформы. 

На данном этапе книга дописана и ждет последних штрихов для публикации.  Выпускаю в электронном формате, ибо также собрано масса полезных ссылок на ресурсы.

Если книга будет интересна большому кругу читателей, то сможем запустить и печатный вариант в течение лета.

А пока, электронную книгу смогу прислать всем уже к концу апреля - начале мая после моего выступления на TEDx.  И конечно, мы будем рады видеть всех на наших занятиях. 

Спасибо всем за поддержку!

story:
A terv

Izgalmas kötettel jelentkezik a Változó Világ az Ünnepi Könyvhétre.

A formabontó újdonság címe: MOST, VALAMIKOR, és a sorozat alapítójának és egyben f?szerkeszt?jének m?veib?l közöl válogatást. Található ebben haiku, novella, esszé, könyvrészlet, emlékezés, nagyrészt eddig nyomtatásban nem publikált munkák.

A terv  célja, hogy a kötet segítségével lépjünk ki a hagyományos és online ismeretterjesztés csendes világából, és induljunk el egy eleven közösség építésének útján. Ezért a terv sokkal több, mint egy egyszer? könyvkiadás, inkább egy közösségszervez? kampány.


A kötet

A kötet Változó Világ Extra besorolást kapott, mégis fegyelmezetten követi az alapsorozatra érvényes szabványt:  kényelmes zsebformátum, 128 oldal, hét fejezet...

Mint a többi kötetnek, ennek is 1600 forint lesz az ára.

Az Ünnepi Könyvhét hivatalos pavilonjaiban egységesen 10% kedvezménnyel lesz kapható (2016. június 9 és 13 között).

Ezt követ?en a kiadó weboldalán lesz megrendelhet?.


Nincsen új a Nap alatt, csak a változó világ...

Szimeonov Todor aforizmái


A terv motorja

Szimeonov Todor 1947-ben Várnában született. 1966 óta él Magyarországon. 1973-ban diplomát szerez az ELTE-n elméleti matematikából, ugyanott 1982-ben doktorál filozófiából. 1991-ig állami intézményeknél kutatásokkal és elemzésekkel foglalkozik, ezt követ?en könyvkiadó és szerkeszt?. Több könyv, cikk és blog szerz?je.

Eddigi f? m?vének a 2014-ben megjelent A civilizáció cím? munkáját tartja.


Merj tudni! A te tudásod a te hatalmad!

Szimeonov Todor aforizmái


A várt hatás

„A megértés olyan, mint az orgazmus: sokan csak színlelik.” (Sz. T.)

De a megértés nem mindig a szellemi képességeken múlik, hanem a megfelel? ráhangolódáson, a felizgatott érdekl?désen, a fiatalos kíváncsiságon… Ezért segít az „irodalmi el?játék”, ami valójában ez a rendhagyó kötet.


Kockázatok és kihívások

Komoly kockázat, hogy kiürülnek az utcák, mindenki otthon olvassa a „Most, valamikor”-t, másnap pedig minden jobb lesz bennünk, és a világon.

Hogyan tudsz segíteni?

Legyen az els? lépés, hogy kiválasztod a neked legszimpatikusabb „perká”-t (amit ellenszolgáltatásként kapsz, „cafeteria”).

A fizetést nagy biztonsággal elvégezheted a PayPal segítségével, amihez nem kell PayPal-számla, regisztráció sem, elég egy bankkártya.

A rendszer euróban számol, de neked nem kell euró a kártyán a fizetéshez, teljesen megfelel? a forint is. Az átszámolás sem lehet nehéz. (Mostanában egy euró 310 forint körül van.)

A támogatás nem kell feltétlenül „perká”-hoz kötni, bármilyen összeget is befizethetsz. Az arányos ellenszolgáltatásokat mindenképpen biztosítjuk

Akárhogy is teszed, köszönjük.


Hogyan tudsz másképpen is segíteni?

Például azzal is sokat tudnál segíteni, ha szólsz err?l a tervr?l barátaidnak.

De a dönt? lépés: elolvasni a kötetet. Utána magad is tudni fogod: mit érdemes, mit fontos tenned.

Mindenhez nyúlok…
Megérintem, az megfog…
Mindenség lettem!

Szimeonov Todor haikui

tudni fogod: mit érdemes, mit fontos tenned.


Mindenhez nyúlok…
Megérintem, az megfog…
Mindenség lettem!



Szimeonov Todor haikui

story:
Introducción ¿Que es Positiv?

Un gran equipo humano lleva más de un año desarrollando un importante proyecto social destinado a hacer felices a millones de personas. 

Positiv World Foundation es la primera red social sin ánimo de lucro que destinará todos los beneficios generados por publicidad y otros servicios a los proyectos sociales que más interesen a los usuarios, sin que éstos tengan que pagar nada por ello.

Ser generoso con los demás produce altas dosis de felicidad a ambas partes, tanto al que da como al que recibe... ;-)


POSITIV WORLD: RED SOCIAL + PLATAFORMA PROYECTOS SOCIALES

Red Social Positiv:
La red social será un espacio lleno de sorpresas donde podrás divertirte, hacer nuevos amigos, compartir fotos, estar informado de las ultimas novedades y muchas cosas más... Además desarrollaremos funcionalidades nuevas que os engancharan y que conoceréis en el lanzamiento oficial. ;-)

Tipos de Proyectos a los que podrás destinar tu saldo:
Pobreza Mundial y Educación Infantil
Enfermedades
Múltiple (Animales, Medio Ambiente, Cultura y otros muchos)
Personas con necesidades concretas
Emergencias

Sin vosotros este proyecto no saldría adelante. Las redes sociales del futuro pertenecerán a los usuarios y a la sociedad y por ello queremos que nos ayudéis a poner el primer ladrillo.


* Diseño de las pantallas de la aplicación móvil. Parte Derecha: Diseño de POSITIV. Parte Izquierda: Diseño de LOVE.


¿Que necesitamos y que obtienes?

Cuanto más recaudemos, mejor será la aplicación móvil de POSITIV y mejor comunicaremos el proyecto. Otras redes sociales recaudaron de diversos inversores millones de euros; nosotros necesitamos mucho menos para poder funcionar y hacer una maravillosa red social (POSITIV) y una plataforma de proyectos sociales (LOVE).

Para poder terminar el desarrollo Beta de nuestra aplicación móvil, POSITIV necesita cerca de 100.000 euros que irán destinados íntegramente a pagar a los servicios de desarrollo, tecnología, diseño y comunicación.

A través de las recompensas puedes ser FUNDADOR de POSITIV y obtener muchas ventajas como usuario. Si nos ayudas ahora serás recordado para siempre!!!

Si no obtenemos los fondos necesarios para empezar el desarrollo, devolveremos los fondos a los usuarios que hayan patrocinado. Si hubiese un sobrante, lo usaremos para continuar con las labores de búsqueda de financiación a través de otras estrategias. Cualquier ayuda que obtengamos nos acercará aún más a nuestro objetivo final: crear un mundo responsable y positivo ;-)


Impacto Social

Tenemos la idea, el proyecto y la web. También un gran embajador como es David Casinos, atleta español que se ha proclamado cuatro veces campeón paralímpico y del mundo en lanzamiento de disco y de peso, y por ultimo tenemos un primer patrocinador. Tenemos un equipo de desarrollo que sólo necesita un pequeño empujón para ponerse en marcha. Y, sobre todo, tenemos muchísima ilusión por hacer algo grande y diferente... ¿no es increíble?

¿Sabes cuánto dinero generas en otras redes sociales? La media en Europa está en torno a 3 dólares por usuario, mientras que en Estados Unidos es de 10 dólares.

En POSITIV prometemos tener un gran impacto positivo sobre la sociedad, ayudando a mejorar nuestro mundo y poniendo los beneficios de las redes sociales al servicio de las personas. Las redes sociales más importantes del mundo generan beneficios mayores a lo recaudado por las mayores ONG mundiales, como por ejemplo UNICEF.  

Sólo necesitamos vuestro apoyo con cualquier patrocinio para empezar juntos este bonito proyecto que esperamos llegue muy lejos ;-)

Ayúdanos ahora y entre todos podremos crear un mundo mejor.

De la parte del equipo de POSITIV, muchas gracias. 


Apoyos

Nuestro amigo y embajador David Casinos Sierra. David tambien es Patrono de la Fundación Positiv World.

www.davidcasinos.es


Riesgos y desafíos

Los mayores riesgos de una red social nueva son la aceptación y difusión por parte de los usuarios; en nuestro caso eso no será un problema.

Respecto a la aceptación, hemos diseñado una red social muy atractiva que gustará desde el primer momento y con un gran elemento diferenciador: que la gente va a sentir y ver cómo se ayuda a que salgan adelante diferentes proyectos sociales.

En cuanto a la difusión, se trata de un problema que ya tenemos enfocado y cuya solución pasa en gran parte por la ayuda de nuestros Embajadores, personas influyentes de nuestra sociedad a las que les hemos presentado el proyecto (y seguiremos haciéndolo). Es un concepto que les ha encantado y por ella están comprometidas a ayudarnos prestando su imagen para dar publicidad y alcance a POSITIV.


    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
    Simplemente difundiendo la campaña entre tus amigos y familiares estarás apoyando el proyecto, cosa que te agradecemos enormemente.
    Podéis usar los botones y herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.


    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    ENGLISH:

    Introduction. What is Positiv?

    For over a year, our team has been developing a social project to bring happiness to the lives of many people.

    The Positiv World Foundation will be the first non-profit social network to contribute all profits earned from publicity and other services to social projects that users are most interested in. Therefore, users can support social projects without having to pay anything. 

    Being generous towards others creates high levels of happiness, whether it is giving or receiving… ;-)

    POSITIV: SOCIAL NETWORK + SOCIAL PROJECTS PLATFORM

    Types of projects:

    Global Poverty and Children’s Education

    Illness

    Multiple (Animals, Environment, Culture and many others)

    People with specific needs

    Emergencies

    Without you, this Project would not be able to go ahead. Future social networks will belong to the users and to society, and this is why now we want to take the first step.


    *Screen design for mobile application. Right side: POSITIV logo. Left side: LOVE logo.


    What we need and what you get

    The more money we raise, the better the POSITIV mobile application and project awareness will be. Other social networks collect thousands of euros through various investors. We need much less to be able to operate and create the fantastic social network “POSITIV” and Social Project Platform “LOVE”.

    We currently receive certain funding, but to complete the Beta development of the mobile application, we need approximately €100,000 to continue paying for development, technology, design and communication services.

    Through the rewards, you can be a FOUNDER of POSITIV and receive many user benefits. If you help us now, you’ll be remembered forever!!!

    If we do not receive the necessary funds to begin with the development, we will return the funds to the users who have sponsored us. In the case of a surplus, we will use it to continue with the search for funding through other strategies. Any help we receive gets us closer to our final goal, a more responsible and positive world ;-)


    The impact

    We have the idea, the project, the website, our great ambassador and first sponsor David Casinos, a development team ready to get started and above all, we really hope to create something different that will serve many different purposes… Wouldn’t that be amazing?

    Do you know how much money is generated by other social networks? In Europe, the average is approximately 3 USD per user, and in the United States 10 USD.

    If we develop POSITIV, we promise to have a great positive impact on society, helping to improve our world and contributing profits through social networks to use for society. The most significant social networks in the world generate larger profits than the money raised by the largest NGO’s, such as UNICEF.

    We need your support, however small the donation may be, to be able to start on this project that we hope will go far ;-)

    Help us now, and we will all help each other to make the world a better place.

    On behalf of the team at POSITIV, thank you.


    Support

    Our friend and ambassador David Casinos Sierra. David is also the patron of the Positiv World Foundation.


    Risks and challenges

    The potential risks for a social network are user awareness and acceptation, but in our case this shouldn’t be a problem.

    We have designed an appealing social network which will be supported by our Ambassadors and influential people in society. Those who we have introduced to the project (and we will continue to do this in the future) have loved the idea, therefore they have committed to helping us by using their image to publicise POSITIV.


    Other ways you can help

    Simply by raising awareness of the campaign amongst your friends and family, you will be supporting the project and we are extremely grateful.

    You can use the buttons and tools to share on Indiegogo.

story:
Demon possession has swept through Glace's neighboring kingdom, turning humans into hellhounds. These great, fanged wolves are wild, desperate, and hungry. Only the sworn Hunters have kept them back for five long, bloody years. 

At the young age of fifteen, Belle LeClair became a Hunter. She no longer remembers how many hounds she's killed, or how many friends she's buried. Still, Belle leads the hunt till a tragedy forces her deep into the dark kingdom. Her heart will be turned, her loyalty tested— and fate will intervene. 

Amid a backdrop of Steampunk inventions and a harsh winter landscape, The Beast is a re-imagining of the infamous love between a beauty and a beast.

Sample The Beast (Book 1)

Chapters 1-2: Pay with a share!

*Caution: Book One Spoilers* 

In book two we get to move beyond the fairy tale.  Now that Castle Vakre Fjell has "re-entered the world", several things remain uncertain. What is to be done about the roaming hellhounds? The norn, Skuld, is dead but does that mean the wolf-god Fenrir is finished as well? For Belle, she wonders how long her relationship with Aleksander can last when she isn't noble born? 

In The Beauty, surprises abound and life quickly goes from simple to a whirlwind. Look forward to new steampunk inventions, new characters, and exciting new travels.

Sample The Beauty (Book 2)

Chapters 1-2: Pay with a share!


I need around $800 to cover the following:

  • Digital Cover - $200.00 FUNDED!

  • Paperback Cover - $75.00  FUNDED!

  • Map Alteration - $50.00 FUNDED!

  • Title Page - $75.00 FUNDED!

  • Teaser Book 3 Title Graphic - $75.00  FUNDED!

  • Paperback Formatting - $150.00 

  • Ebook Formatting - $180.00 FUNDED!

---Total: $805.00

The publishing industry is changing. Thanks to the digital age, authors can now bypass the publishers and go straight to the readers. The great thing about this is that I can keep full control over my work and publish as quickly as I'm ready. If I chose traditional publishing instead, I would have to give up my rights to my own novel and it would be a few years before it was in the public's hands.

Unfortunately, without a publisher backing me, I am left to cover all of the costs on my own. Even with the advances in digital publishing these days, the costs still begin to add up. At this point, I could clean out my bank account and still not have enough to cover the publishing of one novel.


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Make some noise! Share! Share! Share! Make sure your friends and family know that this campaign exists.
  • Follow my YouTube channels and other social sites like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and my blog!

And know that I am truly grateful.

Follow my YouTube channels and other social sites like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and my blog!

And know that I am truly grateful.

story:
ABOUT THE BOOK

This 300 pages Tears of Resilience tells real stories from Female Genital Mutilation survivors, focuses very firmly on the realities of Female Genital Mutilation  and tells extraordinary stories of women struggling to reclaim their female bodies as a source of power and significance. 

"We are living through the endtimes of the civilizing mission.  We loose moral authority to condemn rights abuses if we can't eradicate Female Genital Mutilation. The ineffectual State and International Law is the latest piece of evidence not of transient misfortunes but of defects in protecting millions of girls under the threat of Genital Mutilation.

Whether it is the increase in Female Genital Mutilation, the torture and 'disappearing' of infants or the flouting of international law by states, the prospect of  rights for all is receding. What seemed like a dawn is in fact a sunset. The foundations of universal human rights are crumbling." - from Tears of Resilience

The  book  is also  includes ‘stories’ of survivors and people opposed to Female Genital Mutilation. I have combined  famous African traditional story telling with modern writing and included tens of illustrations.

The 15cm X 22 cm book (e-Book and Softcover) is available in English, a free PDF version comes automatically for every contribution! 

Read the book's review on NOFGM website HERE


CONTRIBUTORS

  • You all know Hilary Burrage, dont you?  She's the Guardian Consultant on Female Genital Mutilation, a renowned author of two FGM books and Huffington Post & other media contributor. She helped write the Foreword for my book. (Click in her name above to connect with her) . 
  • The contributors come from a wide variety of backgrounds in terms of race, class, religion, sexual orientation, and age. They are victims of Female Genital Mutilation survivors, feminists, mothers, scholars, attorneys, poets, medical  health providers, all providing perspectives that are ignored,  vilified, or underrepresented in the popular media or have never been written about, but are important in discussions promoting legal and social protections for women and girls.

"... Somehow we have to get to grips with the predestined cruelties which are visited upon defenceless children, often just small girls, and we have to work out what can be done to stop this brutality.  Yes, Female Genital Mutilation is, by any decent measure anywhere, a senseless betrayal and an appalling destruction of young lives and well-being; but to stop it we must first try to understand it..." Hilary Burrage ( from Foreword, Tears of Resilience)

Author, Michael Ahabwe Mugerwa speaking at Northwestern University Conference on Human Rights ,Envanston, Illinois.

WHAT WE NEED

Shortly after writing over 70% of the book, it became clear to see Tears of Resilience through to the end, we would need funds beyond  $2000 that I had  saved. The story is written, all the illustrations are complete, our  goal is to raise at least $5,000 to  see the book through.

$5000 that I want to raise through this campaign is much lower that the total project cost, yet we can't try to raise hug amounts at once. Our campaign and morale might be affected if we try fundraising more than $5000 at once. That's why  I decided to keep our fundraising goal low, but  I am looking forward to launching stretch goals to cover the total project cost. $5000 is just the beginning.

We need for a second, third and fourth set of eyes to point out substantive changes, hint at grammatical fixes and provide proofreading.  Is anyone willing to volunteer and do this for me? This saves $3000 that we would pay to an editor.  Please leave a comment in the "comments box" above and I follow up within 8 hours


IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Your contributions will help get the book out and into the world!  Tears of Resilience is much more than a story, it’s a story to the world and for the world.   Every contribution will help us reach our goal!

When you back this campaign, you are indirectly  taking an active part in changing how women see themselves, and how they are seen by others.

WHAT'S IN THE BOOK?

This book is broken down into different topical sections including: 

  • The Women’s Republic

  • Re-Framing Reality and the Language of Violence

  • Personal Stories from the  African Crater
  • Power of a Woman
  • Dark Night Code ( In this chapter, you will read about my journeys tracking Genital Mutilators and child traffickers on the Uganda-Kenya boarder . Well, one cutter threatened to castrate me if I took their pictures.) Look out for lots of exciting stories!
  • How on Earth?

WHAT WE NEED TO SPEND ON

 Here are some of the stuff we must pay for to see our book through. The good news is that I have paid for some from personal savings!

  • Professional Copy Editing: $3000
  • Cover design and illustrations: $3000 (already paid $1000  from personal savings)
  • Interior book design, layout,  printing, permissions: $5,000
  • Web development $1000
  • Legal Fees: $3,500 (already paid $1000 from personal savings)

All costs are approximate and might be higher/lower depending on how many books are printed. The more we print, the lower the cost! We will share all actual costs with you as soon we have them confirmed. Updates will be provided regularly so you can be assured we'll deliver on our promise.


ABOUT ME

My name is Michael Ahabwe Mugerwa, and I'm  a Writer, Activist and Director an East Africa based nonprofit. Some of you may know me from my work in food sovereignty campaigns, you may have read my articles or contributions in publications or books about eradicating Female Genital Mutilation or you saw me lead our team to open the first solar-powered Obstetric Fistula Tracking center in East Africa. Join me to publish my book, Tears of Resilience this August.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Every contribution of any amount is deeply appreciated and will help us reach our goal.

  • Please tell a friend, or 25 friends, or even a 100 friends, acquaintances and co-workers, clients, about Tears of Resilience.
  • Spread the word about the book on your social media sites, email and blog if you have one! 
  • Post a message on your Facebook page and Twitter
  • Pre-order your copy (copies) through our partner, Wild Africa Explorers here http://wildafricaexplorers.com/tor_booking.html

2. Wild Africa Explorers
story_txt:
ABOUT THE BOOK 
 
This 300 pages Tears of Resilience tells real stories from Female Genital
Mutilation survivors, 
focuses very firmly on the realities of Female Genital Mutilation  and tells extraordinary stories of women struggling to reclaim their female bodies as a source
     of power and significance.  


"We are living through the
endtimes of the civilizing mission.  We loose
moral authority to condemn rights abuses if we can't eradicate Female Genital Mutilation. The ineffectual State and
International Law is the latest piece of evidence not of transient misfortunes
but of defects in protecting millions of girls under the threat of Genital
Mutilation. 

Whether it is the increase in Female Genital Mutilation,
the torture and 'disappearing' of infants or the flouting of international law
by states, the prospect of  rights
for all is receding. What seemed like a dawn is in fact a sunset. The
foundations of universal human rights are crumbling." - from Tears of Resilience

The  book  is also  includes ‘stories’ of survivors and
people opposed to Female Genital Mutilation. I have combined  famous African traditional story telling with modern writing and included tens of illustrations.

The 15cm X 22 cm book (e-Book and Softcover) is available in English, a free PDF version comes automatically for every contribution! 
Read the book's review on NOFGM website HERE


CONTRIBUTORS

  
You all know Hilary Burrage, dont you?  She's the Guardian Consultant on
     Female Genital Mutilation, a renowned author of two FGM books and Huffington
     Post & other media contributor. She helped write the Foreword for my book. (Click in her name above to connect with her) . 

The contributors come from a wide variety of
     backgrounds in terms of race, class, religion, sexual orientation, and
     age. They are victims of Female Genital Mutilation survivors, feminists, mothers, scholars, attorneys, poets, medical  health providers, all providing perspectives
     that are ignored,  vilified, or underrepresented in the popular
     media or have never been written about, but are important in discussions promoting legal and social
     protections for women and girls.
    
"... Somehow we have to get to grips with the predestined
cruelties which are visited upon defenceless children, often just small girls,
and we have to work out what can be done to stop this brutality.  Yes, Female Genital Mutilation is, by any decent measure anywhere,
a senseless betrayal and an appalling destruction of young lives and well-being;
but to stop it we must first try to understand it..." Hilary Burrage ( from Foreword, Tears of Resilience)


Author, Michael Ahabwe Mugerwa speaking at Northwestern University Conference on Human Rights ,Envanston, Illinois. 
WHAT WE NEED 
Shortly after writing over 70% of the
book, it became clear to see Tears of Resilience through to the end, we would
need funds beyond  $2000 that I had  saved. The story
is written, all the illustrations are complete, our  goal is to raise at least $5,000 to  see the book through.
$5000 that I want to raise through this campaign is much lower that the
 total project cost, yet we can't try to raise hug amounts at once. Our campaign and morale might be affected if we try fundraising more than $5000 at once. That's why  I decided to 
keep our fundraising goal low, but  I am 
looking forward to launching
stretch goals to cover the total project cost. $5000 is just the beginning.

We need for a second, third and fourth set of
eyes to point out substantive changes, hint at grammatical fixes and provide
proofreading.  Is anyone willing to volunteer and do this for me? This saves $3000 that we would pay to an editor.  Please leave a comment in the "comments box" above and I follow up within 8 hours


  
IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION



Your contributions will help get the book out and into the world! 
Tears of Resilience is much more than a story, it’s a story to the world
and for the world.   Every contribution will help us reach our goal!
When
you back this campaign, you are indirectly  taking an active part in changing how women see
themselves, and how they are seen by others.

WHAT'S IN THE BOOK?
 

This book is broken down into
different topical sections including: 
 The Women’s Republic

Re-Framing Reality and the Language
of Violence
Personal Stories from the  African Crater

Power of a Woman

Dark Night Code ( In this chapter, you will read about my journeys tracking Genital Mutilators and child traffickers on the Uganda-Kenya boarder . Well, one cutter threatened to castrate me if I took their pictures.) Look out for lots of exciting stories!

How on Earth?



   

WHAT WE NEED TO SPEND ON
 

 Here are some of the stuff we must pay for to see our book through. The good news is that I have paid for some from personal savings! 
 Professional Copy Editing: $3000
Cover design and illustrations: $3000 (already paid $1000  from personal savings)
Interior book design, layout,  printing,
     permissions: $5,000
Web development $1000 

Legal Fees: $3,500 (already paid $1000 from personal savings)

All costs are approximate and might be higher/lower depending on how
many books are printed. The more we print, the lower the cost! We will share all
actual costs with you as soon we have them confirmed. Updates will be provided regularly so you can be assured we'll deliver on
our promise. 


ABOUT ME
My name is Michael Ahabwe Mugerwa, and I'm  a Writer, Activist and Director an East Africa based nonprofit. Some of you may know me from my work in food sovereignty
campaigns, you may have read my articles or contributions in publications or books about eradicating Female
Genital Mutilation or you saw me lead our team to open the first solar-powered Obstetric Fistula Tracking
center in East Africa. Join me to publish my book, Tears of Resilience this August. 

   OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

Every contribution of any amount is
deeply appreciated and will help us reach our goal. 
 Please tell
     a friend, or 25 friends, or even a 100 friends, acquaintances and
     co-workers, clients, about Tears of Resilience. 

Spread the word about the book on your social media
     sites, email and blog if you have one! 
Post a message on your Facebook page
     and Twitter

Pre-order your copy (copies) through our partner, Wild Africa Explorers here http://wildafricaexplorers.com/tor_booking.html




 
SOME OF MY PREVIOUS ARTICLES AS SEEN IN...


ESPECIAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS TO ...
1. Hillary Burrage
2. Wild Africa Explorers

story:
Short Summary

Today, I am writing as an unwilling participant, an observer and an actor in a play of the unknown, with the purpose of letting the angels fall, revealing the hidden demons and warning the curious who, willingly or unwillingly, want to open the door that leads to darkness.

The stories I am about to recount are works of fiction, but their foundation lies in truth: real events and real people. In them you might find a character that resembles someone you know or someone like you from another time or place. As entertaining as the stories might be, they are about someone who at one time dared to open a door … to the Forbidden Realm.

Hi, I’m Eddy Mora. I am a writer and an artist. I have written a collection of supernatural stories and a full thriller-romantic novel. Now, I need a professional editor to help me bring them to light, and for this, I need your help. I would love to publish and share my art with the world. Would you consider helping me by becoming my patron or advocate?

I gave Dave, a friend of mine, a copy of my manuscript to read, to possibly help me with editing. He gave it back with a note that read: “The stories are quite good. Except that now I have to sleep with the lights on.” He doesn't know it yet, but he coined the subtitle for my short story book as he helped me with the initial editing. 

How did I come up with these stories? Some I experienced personally, and some I heard through my mom or other sources. Growing up, I had to sleep with the lights on, due to the stories she used to tell us before we went to bed and or the tales my relatives told around family gatherings. I have changed the stories a bit, both to protect the innocent and to make them more entertaining—but believe me, they are based on real events. It will be up to you to decide what is real and what is not, which ones I have lived or not.

Sounds interesting?

What I Need and What You Get

It has taken me 25 years to be able to finally sit down and write confidently in a language other than my own; family and work came first. Now, my first two manuscripts are finished, all the writing is done. I need your help in publishing both books.

I was trained as a graphic designer and a fine art painter and I have been an artist since childhood. My passion is creating, be it a wooden sculpture, a painting, or a written page—it is all art to me. I have been writing since I was a kid, but in Spanish, not English. Ever since coming to this country and learning the language, I’ve been yearning to put my ideas down for others to read. Now is the time. I want to share this passion with the world, and I need your help to make it happen.

“The Forbidden Realm” is a collection of supernatural horror stories drawn from personal experiences. Die to Live is a thriller/romance novel about a girl’s survival in the face of danger. The novel tells the story of a girl who, after witnessing a crime, has to change her identity to try to escape the people who want to kill her.

With both books done and ready for publishing, any proceeds from this campaign will go toward paying a professional editor and Amazon’s initial publishing and marketing fees. 

I plan to publish both books through Amazon as a self-publisher. Being a graphic designer myself, I will design and create the book format, cover, and any marketing art needed. So all the proceeds will go to editing and the marketing fees Amazon requires, such as an ISBN number, promotion, and the materials for producing the “perks” for contributor/backer rewards.
Stories Outline
The Seer
A woman seeks the help of a seer not knowing she brings home more than she bargained.
Sleepwalker
A woman sleepwalks after being healed of a cancer by a famous doctor dead already over 100 years earlier.
The Kiss
An 16th century legend comes alive after a boy desecrates the resting place of a beautiful girl.
The Visitor
A stranger knocks on the door and becomes instrument in releasing the hidden demons at the dinner party.
Angel
A man betrays his marriage vows at a great price after asking the universe for a chance for change.
The Beast
Obsessed with thinking something or someone is following, a man faces evil after calling the forces from hell.
The Witch of Calle Fallas
A man jumps at the  opportunity of life change when he meets a young girl at a bus not knowing that she is about to change him forever.
The river girl
A boy follows at night what he claims is the love of his life only to find a door to the forbidden realm
 

These are a few of the things I need and where the money from funding will go:

  1. Fund professional copy editing by Fran Fahey (an awesome editor) of my most ambitious writing project to date, “Die to Live.”
  2. A full, professional copy editing by editor Fran Fahey of “The Forbidden Realm” book.
  3. Create a website for both books.
  4. Pay ISBN and Amazon book and promotion fees toward the publication of both books.
  5. Perks materials and supplies.
  6. Printing and shipping of perks/backer rewards.
  7. Book promotion through Amazon to libraries and booksellers

What you will get:

I'm excited to offer you, in return for your generous contribution, unique art of my own creation. 

  • A signed, printed copy of “The Forbidden Realm”; see this mock-up of the cover.


  • Your name on the acknowledgements page of “The Forbidden Realm” or “Die to Live,” and your name on the website of the project as a contributor.
  • Book Box “Realm Guardian.” This book box is constructed in wood, felted on the inside, and hand-sculpted and painted by me. Each box is a unique work of art, a $400 value. I make the boxes in wood, sculpt over them with polymer clay, and paint with gold leaf and special metallic paints and powders.


The book is held inside, as shown:




  • This is the “Realm Gate” book box. Wood construction with hand-carved top and felted inside. A $400 value:





  • A canvas print of “The Forbidden Realm” cover, 20" x 24." A fine art print for your enjoyment.
  • Or, if you prefer, a canvas print (it looks just like the original ) of the “Die to Live” cover painting (without the word title). A fine art piece for your enjoyment.
The original painting for my upcoming novel “Die to Live,” 24" x 28." Acrylic on canvas. A $2,000 value. This is my original painting, used for the cover of the book.


  • A creative writing session: You could also get a two-hour one-on-one session on creative writing techniques to help you create, design, and write a book of any kind in three months or less. I will teach you the technology I have learned to allow you to organize your story, images, and thinking and put them into writing in the most efficient way. Your own writing will be ready for editing and publishing.
  • Or a combination or bundle, including adding your name to the project website and the acknowledgements page of the book.

Any funds received through this campaign, even if I don't reach the goal, will go toward paying the professional editor.

The Cultural Impact

Your contribution will be very valuable in bringing to people and future generations my stories and preserving cultural details of times past. The stories in “The Forbidden Realm,” based on real events, showcase the culture in which I grew up, in beautiful Costa Rica. Readers will feel in touch with the people in each story, even if they have never been there.

No Risks, but Challenges

Funds raised will help reduce the financial risk to self-publish. There are no risks to you. The books are written, and Amazon will publish on an as-needed basis, which means no inventory or piles of books in my basement. The art and design have been created by me, so there's no need to hire an artist or designer.

The real obstacle I face is that, having been raised in a religious environment, people who know me might not want to contribute to my project, thinking the book exalts the occult and horror for horror’s sake. In reality, I see the book more as a way to tell the stories and events I personally experienced as entertainment, and perhaps someone might see them as a warning about opening the “door to the unknown.” 

Help Me Make It Happen

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some ways:

  • Please tell your Facebook, LinkedIn, and other network friends about these offers. 
  • You may use also the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.
  • The more people who know about my fundraiser, the faster I could reach my goal. Even if you are not interested in the book or the perks, people telling people is already a great help to me. Send them a text or an email message with the link to my page.
Thank you for taking the time to read and contribute.

story:
Clan Destine Press

An independent Australian publisher specialising in genre fiction

www.clandestinepress.com.au


It is the prime objective of Clan Destine Press to uncover, foster and promote new Australian genre writers and to provide a home where already-published authors can move in and play in new worlds.
Clan Destine Press has published more than 100 books of inventive, clever and original works of page-turning genre fiction; riveting cross-genre stories; and books that are heroic, questy, feral, dark, funny, spine-tingly, fast-paced, serious, silly and sensible.
And Then... we had a great idea.
We invited some of our favourite Australian and New Zealand writers to showcase their talent in our first anthology,  
And so was born And Then... the great big book of awesome adventure tales.
The two-volume anthology features cliffhanging adventure stories with a distinctly antipodean flavour penned by 31 authors.
Each page-turning quest catapults our adventurers into perilous exploits in time and space - from the Victorian gold fields to planets far far away.

The And Then... authors are:

Cameron Ashley ~ Dogs Leave Home to Die

Evelyn Tsitas ~ Stealing Back the Relics

Peter M Ball~Deadbeats

Alan Baxter~Golden Fortune, Dragon Jade

Mary Borsellino~The Australian Gang

Lindy Cameron~The Medusa Stone

Kat Clay~In the Company of Rogues

Emilie Collyer~The Panther's Paw

Jack Dann~The Talking Sword

Sarah Evans~Plumbing the Depths

Jason Franks~Exli and the Dragon

Kelly Gardiner~Boots and the Bushranger

Sulari Gentill ~ The Stranding

Alison Goodman ~ The Benevolent Society of Ill-Mannered Ladies

David Greagg & Kerry Greenwood~Cruel Sister

Narrelle M Harris~Moran & Cato: Virgin Soil

James Hopwood ~The Lost Loot of Lima

Maria Lewis~The Bushwalker Butcher

Sophie Masson~The Romanov Opal

Keith McArdle~The Demon's Cave

Jason Nahrung~The Mermaid Club

Andrew Nette~Save a Last Kiss for Satan

Amanda Pillar~It

Michael Pryor~Cross Purposes

Dan Rabarts~Tipuna Tapu

Tansy Rayner Roberts~Death at the Dragon Circus

Fin J Ross~Genemesis 

Tor Roxburgh~The Boudicca Society

Lucy Sussex ~ Sabah

Amanda Wrangles~Come Now, Traveller



What we need

And Then... will be published regardless.

But how big, how awesome and how quickly depends on your support.

The more books we pre-sell, the quicker the anthology comes to fruition.

We don't expect people to fund  our excitement but by pre-ordering now you are guaranteed a 25% discount off the rrp, and your copies hot off the press.

There are also some extra perks that go with pre-ordering  - and not just our eternal gratitude.

There are bargains to be had like:

* the limited edition hardcover of And Then...

* eBook version volumes of And Then... 

* the chance to acquire every other Clan Destine Press eBook

There will be amazing OTHER things offered over the next off couple weeks.


Our authors

Alan Baxter

Alan lives among dairy paddocks on the beautiful south coast of NSW where he writes dark fantasy, horror and sci-fi, rides a motorcycle and loves his dog. 
He's the author of the Alex Caine series, Bound, Obsidian and Abduction. 
He also teaches Kung Fu.  www.warriorscribe.com.

Amanda Pillar

Amanda, an archaeologist by day, lives in Victoria with her husband, and cats Saxon and Lilith. She’s had several short stories published and has co-edited fiction anthologies. Her first novel, Graced, was published in 2015; and the sequel to her first solo anthology, Bloodstones, is due out shortly.

Amanda Wrangles

Amanda bakes cupcakes, writes book reviews and web content; and is currently writing a sci‑fi novel. Her short story 'Plotting Jasper' was published in Crime Factory's Hard Labour; and she won the 2009 Scarlet Stiletto Award with 
'Persia Bloom' (in CDP's The Second Cut). Her first novel – a fantastical and sexy comedy – Arrabella Candellarbra & the Questy Thing to End All Questy Things, 
was co‑written with Kylie Fox (as A.K. Wrox). 

Andrew Nette

Andrew is a Melbourne crime writer and journalist whose short fiction has appeared in print and on-line. His debut crime novel, Ghost Money, is set in mid-90s Cambodia. Andrew is co-editor of the upcoming Beat Girls, Love Tribes and Real Cool Cats: Pulp Fiction and Youth Culture, 1950 - 1980. www.pulpcurry.com

Dan Rabarts

Dan was the recipient of New Zealand’s 2013 Sir Julius Vogel Award 
for Best New Talent. With Lee Murray he co-edited the multi-award-winning 
flash horror anthology Baby Teeth – Bite-sized Tales of Terror; and his 
short stories have appeared in numerous anthologies, 
magazines, ezines and podcasts.www.danrabarts.com

James Hopwood

James Hopwood is the author of retro-spy thrillers, The Librio Defection and
 The Danakil Deception. His short fiction has appeared in several publications. As Jack Tunney, he’s also scribed the Fight Card series: King of the Outback, Rumble in the Jungle and The Iron Fists of Ned Kelly.


David Greagg & Kerry Greenwood  

Kerry and David are a gestalt entity who read each other’s minds and cover each other’s linguistic and musical omissions. She does romance languages while he does Germanic and weird tongues; and she sings soprano so he doesn’t have to.        She costumes and makes stuff, while he wears armour and hits people with sticks.  They were raised in the forest by benevolent wood-elves and are co-curators 
of a Found Cats’ Home. They both write, and finish each other’s sentences. 
 Kerry is the creator of the Phryne Fisher series; and for CDP is the author of the ancient history novels Out of the Black Land, and The Delphic Women trilogy: Medea, Cassandra and Electra. 
 David writes about Vikings; and gentlemen cats, Dougal’s Diary, 
When We Were Kittens, and Sanctuary.

Emilie Collyer

Emilie writes fiction, plays and poetry. She’s twice won the Cross Genre category in the Scarlet Stiletto crime writing awards; has stories in Allegory and Cosmic Vegetable; and has won awards for her sci-fi play The Good Girl. Emilie has two collections of short fiction, A Clean Job and Autopsy of a Comedian, published with the imprint Clan Destine Fictions. www.betweenthecracks.net.

Fin J Ross

Fin, journalist and creative writing teacher, also runs a cattery. She is the co-author of the true crime anthologies Killer in the Family and Murder in the Family. She’s the author of AKA Fudgepuddle, the ‘true-life’ adventures of a cat called Juno.  
Recently side-tracked into writing crime fiction, she won two prizes
 in the 2014 Scarlet Stiletto Awards.

Jack Dann

Jack is a multi-award winning author and editor of over 75 books, including the international bestsellers The Memory Cathedral and The Silent. Other collections include Promised Land, Timetipping, Visitations and The Fiction Factory. 
 He is co-editor, with Janeen Webb, of Dreaming Down-Under, which won the World Fantasy Award; and editor of its sequel Dreaming Again. Satalyte has just released a new edition of The Rebel. Jack lives on a farm overlooking the sea.www.jackdann.com


Jason Franks

Jason is the author of the occult rock'n'roll novel Bloody Waters, and writer of graphic novels and comic books, including The Sixsmiths and Left Hand Path. His short fiction has been published in Aurealis, Midnight Echo, After the World, and more. He’s twice been short-listed for an Aurealis Award.  www.jasonfranks.com

Jason Nahrung

Jason grew up on a Queensland cattle property but now lives in Ballarat with his author-wife Kirstyn McDermott. His passion for B-grade horror films is reflected
 in his gothic fiction, The Darkness Within and Salvage; and the outback vampire duology Blood and Dust and The Big Smoke (Clan Destine Press). 
www.jasonnahrung.com.

Kat Clay

Kat is a Melbourne writer and photographer whose non-fiction articles have appeared in numerous travel magazines and academic journals. 
In 2015, Kat was awarded a Melbourne UNESCO City of Literature Travel Grant, 
and also released her first crime novella Double Exposure.

Keith McArdle

Keith grew up reading action thrillers. As a former soldier in the Australian Army, he’s seen active service in the Iraq theatre of war, East Timor and Afghanistan. Keith’s the author of The Reckoning: The Day Australia Fell , 
The Forgotten Land, Assassin and Against the Odds.


Kelly Gardiner

Kelly’s Young Adult novels, Act of Faith and The Sultan’s Eyes, were shortlisted 
for the NSW Premier's Literary Awards. 
 Her books for young readers include the 'Swashbuckler' pirate adventures, 
and the picture book, Billabong Bill's Bushfire Christmas.
 Her latest novel, Goddess, is for adults and is based on the life of  17th century French swordswoman Mademoiselle de Maupin.

Lindy Cameron

Lindy is a National Co-Convenor of Sisters in Crime Australia 
and the Publisher of Clan Destine Press. 
 She's the author of the Kit O’Malley PI novels – Blood Guilt, Bleeding Hearts andThicker Than Water; the action thriller Redback; the mystery Golden Relic: and the sci-fi (15k  short story) Feedback.
 She also co-wrote the true crime anthologies Killer in the Family, 
Murder in the Family, and Women Who Kill. 
 She’s currently writing historical fiction featuring time travel, archaeology and Amazons.
 www.clandestinepress.com.au

Maria Lewis

Maria’s articles have appeared in the New York Post, The Daily Mail and more. 
She produced the Eff Yeah Film & Feminism podcast; and wrote and produced George Miller’s documentary Justice League Mortal. 
Her debut novel Who’s Afraid? is due for release in 2016.

Mary Borsellino

Mary lives in Melbourne, has lots of tattoos and writes dark YA and adult supernatural/fantasy. She’s author of the YA adventure Thrive, with Clan Destine Press; the five-book The Wolf House series; The Devil's Mixtape; 
and CDP's erotic stories Loveless, Min Min Lights, Vanilla and Table for Three.


Michael Pryor

Michael writes fantasy and science fiction, mostly for teenagers. With more than 30 novels and 50-something short stories published, he’s been shortlisted six times for the Aurealis Award, and seven of his books have been CBCA Notable books.  www.michaelpryor.com.au.

Narrelle M Harris

Narrelle is an award-winning Melbourne writer whose books include: The Opposite of Life and Walking Shadows; Fly by Night,Witch Honour, Witch Faith.
She's also written the Holmes/Watson romance, The Adventure of the Colonial Boy; and the CDP erotic romances Talbott and Burns:
Hammer and Tongue; and Secret Agents, Secret Lives.www.mortalwords.com.au

Sarah Evans

Sarah writes crime, romance, horror and fantasy. She’s published novels, short stories (some broadcast on ABC Radio), songs and poetry, and a lifestyle-recipe book. With CDP Fictions, she’s published Call of the Wild, Killing Kindness and 
New Blood. Sarah teaches creative writing and edits children’s books. 
Her latest crime novel (with CDP)  is Operation Paradise.

Sophie Masson

Sophie is an award-winning author of more than 60 books for children, young adults and adults. Her most recent novels are the adult thriller, Trinity: The False Prince, and 2015 YA fantasy Hunter's Moon.

Peter M. Ball

Peter is the author of Horn, Bleed, and the Flotsam novella series.
He's had short stories in Apex Magazine, Eclipse 4, and Daily Science Fiction.  
Peter is also seriously responsible for GenreCon – Australia's fabulous 
cross-genre convention.
 www.petermball.com

Tansy Rayner Roberts

Tansy, Australian sci-fi and fantasy author, and Hugo Award winning blogger 
and podcaster (Galactic Suburbia) also writes crime fiction as Livia Day. 
Her latest short fiction is Fake Geek Girl; and her serialised novel,
 Musketeer Space, is free on her blog. 
http://tansyrr.com

Tor Roxburgh

Tor currently writes speculative fiction. She’s written 15 books, including the epic fantasy, The Light Heart of Stone; and also 12 teen romances and two non‑fiction titles. When avoiding writing, Tor runs an arts-focused homewares business, Omnibus Art Gallery, where she sells up-cycled and re-upholstered furniture.


Alison Goodman

Alison is the author of bestselling fantasy duology, Eon and Eona; the crime novel, A New Kind of Death; and the Aurealis Award-winning Singing the Dogstar Blues (Best YA novel). Eon also won an Aurealis for Best Fantasy Novel. Alison has been having far too much fun researching 1812 England for her new trilogy beginning with Lady Helen and The Dark Days Club. www.darkdaysclub.com

 Sulari Gentill

Sulari is the author of the Hero Trilogy, a YA retelling of The Odyssey; and the awarding-winning Rowland Sinclair mystery series, of which the seventh novel, Give the Devil His Due, has just been released. Sulari lives in her pyjamas in the foothills of the Snowy Mountains where she refers to her writing as ‘work’ so that no one will suggest she get a real job.

Lucy Sussex

Lucy was born in New Zealand but now lives in Melbourne. She has published widely; edited five anthologies, written five short story collections, and the award-winning neo-Victorian novel, The Scarlet Rider. Her latest book. Blockbuster: Fergus Hume and the Mystery of a Hansom Cab, won the 2015 Victorian Community History Award.

Cameron Ashley

Cam is the chief editor of Crime Factory (thecrimefactory.com). His articles, interviews and fiction have appeared in numerous places both online and in print. He currently writes a weekly column for Eisner award winning retailer, All Star Comics and is at work on several fiction projects.

Dr Evelyn Tsitas

Evelyn is intrigued by hybrids, art theft, Greek culture, and ambiguity in crime fiction. She has a PhD in Creative Writing and a Sisters in Crime Scarlet Stiletto Award to prove she takes her speculative research, and writing, seriously. Everything she writes has its basis in truth. Honestly.
story_txt:
Clan Destine PressAn independent Australian publisher specialising in genre fiction
www.clandestinepress.com.auIt is the prime objective of Clan Destine Press to uncover, foster and promote new Australian genre writers and to provide a home where already-published authors can move in and play in new worlds.
Clan Destine Press has published more than 100 books of inventive, clever and original works of page-turning genre fiction; riveting cross-genre stories; and books that are heroic, questy, feral, dark, funny, spine-tingly, fast-paced, serious, silly and sensible.

And Then... we had a great idea.
We invited some of our favourite Australian and New Zealand writers to showcase their talent in our first anthology,  And so was born And Then... the great big book of awesome adventure tales.
The two-volume anthology features cliffhanging adventure stories with a distinctly antipodean flavour penned by 31 authors.Each page-turning quest catapults our adventurers into perilous exploits in time and space - from the Victorian gold fields to planets far far away.
The And Then... authors are:
Cameron
Ashley ~ Dogs Leave Home to Die
Evelyn
Tsitas ~ Stealing Back the Relics
Peter
M Ball~Deadbeats
Alan
Baxter~Golden
Fortune, Dragon Jade
Mary
Borsellino~The
Australian Gang
Lindy
Cameron~The Medusa Stone
Kat
Clay~In the
Company of Rogues
Emilie
Collyer~The
Panther's Paw
Jack
Dann~The Talking
Sword
Sarah
Evans~Plumbing the
Depths
Jason
Franks~Exli and the
Dragon
Kelly
Gardiner~Boots and
the Bushranger
Sulari Gentill ~ The Stranding
Alison Goodman ~ The Benevolent Society of Ill-Mannered Ladies
David
Greagg & Kerry Greenwood~Cruel Sister
Narrelle
M Harris~Moran &
Cato: Virgin Soil
James Hopwood ~The Lost Loot of Lima
Maria

Bushwalker Butcher
Sophie

Opal
Keith

Cave

Club

Nette~Save a Last
Kiss for Satan
Amanda

Michael

Rabarts~Tipuna Tapu
Tansy
Rayner Roberts~Death at the
Dragon Circus
Fin
J Ross~Genemesis 
Tor
Roxburgh~The Boudicca
Society
Lucy Sussex ~ Sabah
Amanda
Wrangles~Come Now,
Traveller



What we need

And Then... will be published regardless.
But how big, how awesome and how quickly depends on your support.
The more books we pre-sell, the quicker the anthology comes to fruition.
We don't expect people to fund  our excitement but by pre-ordering now you are guaranteed a 25% discount off the rrp, and your copies hot off the press.
There are also some extra perks that go with pre-ordering  - and not just our eternal gratitude.
There are bargains to be had like:
* the limited edition hardcover of And Then...
* eBook version volumes of And Then... 
* the chance to acquire every other Clan Destine Press eBook
There will be amazing OTHER things offered over the next off couple weeks.

Our authors
Alan Baxter
Alan lives among dairy paddocks on the beautiful south coast of NSW where he writes dark fantasy, horror and sci-fi, rides a motorcycle and loves his dog. He's the author of the Alex Caine series, Bound, Obsidian and Abduction. He also teaches Kung Fu.  www.warriorscribe.com.
Amanda Pillar
Amanda, an archaeologist by day, lives in Victoria with her husband, and cats Saxon and Lilith. She’s had several short stories published and has co-edited fiction anthologies. Her first novel, Graced, was published in 2015; and the sequel to her first solo anthology, Bloodstones, is due out shortly.
Amanda Wrangles
Amanda bakes cupcakes, writes book reviews and web content; and is currently writing a sci‑fi novel. Her short story 'Plotting Jasper' was published in Crime Factory's Hard Labour; and she won the 2009 Scarlet Stiletto Award with 'Persia Bloom' (in CDP's The Second Cut). Her first novel – a fantastical and sexy comedy – Arrabella Candellarbra & the Questy Thing to End All Questy Things, was co‑written with Kylie Fox (as A.K. Wrox). 
Andrew Nette
Andrew is a Melbourne crime writer and journalist whose short fiction has appeared in print and on-line. His debut crime novel, Ghost Money, is set in mid-90s Cambodia. Andrew is co-editor of the upcoming Beat Girls, Love Tribes and Real Cool Cats: Pulp Fiction and Youth Culture, 1950 - 1980. www.pulpcurry.com

Dan Rabarts
Dan was the recipient of New Zealand’s 2013 Sir Julius Vogel Award for Best New Talent. With Lee Murray he co-edited the multi-award-winning flash horror anthology Baby Teeth – Bite-sized Tales of Terror; and his short stories have appeared in numerous anthologies, magazines, ezines and podcasts.www.danrabarts.com
James Hopwood
James Hopwood is the author of retro-spy thrillers, The Librio Defection and The Danakil Deception. His short fiction has appeared in several publications. As Jack Tunney, he’s also scribed the Fight Card series: King of the Outback, Rumble in the Jungle and The Iron Fists of Ned Kelly.
David Greagg & Kerry Greenwood  
Kerry and David are a gestalt entity who read each other’s minds and cover each other’s linguistic and musical omissions. She does romance languages while he does Germanic and weird tongues; and she sings soprano so he doesn’t have to.        She costumes and makes stuff, while he wears armour and hits people with sticks.  They were raised in the forest by benevolent wood-elves and are co-curators of a Found Cats’ Home. They both write, and finish each other’s sentences.  Kerry is the creator of the Phryne Fisher series; and for CDP is the author of the ancient history novels Out of the Black Land, and The Delphic Women trilogy: Medea, Cassandra and Electra.  David writes about Vikings; and gentlemen cats, Dougal’s Diary, When We Were Kittens, and Sanctuary.

Emilie Collyer
Emilie writes fiction, plays and poetry. She’s twice won the Cross Genre category in the Scarlet Stiletto crime writing awards; has stories in Allegory and Cosmic Vegetable; and has won awards for her sci-fi play The Good Girl. Emilie has two collections of short fiction, A Clean Job and Autopsy of a Comedian, published with the imprint Clan Destine Fictions. www.betweenthecracks.net.
Fin J Ross
Fin, journalist and creative writing teacher, also runs a cattery. She is the co-author of the true crime anthologies Killer in the Family and Murder in the Family. She’s the author of AKA Fudgepuddle, the ‘true-life’ adventures of a cat called Juno.  Recently side-tracked into writing crime fiction, she won two prizes in the 2014 Scarlet Stiletto Awards.
Jack Dann
Jack is a multi-award winning author and editor of over 75 books, including the international bestsellers The Memory Cathedral and The Silent. Other collections include Promised Land, Timetipping, Visitations and The Fiction Factory.  He is co-editor, with Janeen Webb, of Dreaming Down-Under, which won the World Fantasy Award; and editor of its sequel Dreaming Again. Satalyte has just released a new edition of The Rebel. Jack lives on a farm overlooking the sea.www.jackdann.com

His short fiction has been published in Aurealis, Midnight Echo, After the World, and more. He’s twice been short-listed for an Aurealis Award.  www.jasonfranks.com

story:
Who We Are

Word Branch Publishing is comprised of authors, editors, and one very talented artist.  We have an abundance of skills that include more than just writing, and each person has much to contribute to the cooperative to insure its success.

The owner and founder, Catherine Rayburn-Trobaugh, has nearly a decade in the publishing business including working in marketing for a major publisher.  In addition, she has a master’s degree in English and writing, 20 years experience teaching writing at the college level, and has written and published five of her own books. In WBP’s five years, she has created a system of publishing that is both efficient and effective, and this experience will prove to be invaluable as the co-op grows.

We are passionate about this innovative idea, and we hope you are too.  Please feel free to get to know our authors and staff at our website and email us with your questions and comments: http://wordbranch.com

 

What We Need

Currently, Word Branch Publishing is a privately owned company, but the goal is to convert it to a not-for-profit, author-run cooperative.  We’ll need funding for both legal fees and a minimum of six months operating costs in addition to fundraising costs and unforeseen circumstances. 

 

You can keep up with the transformation at http://www.wordbranch.com/wbp-changes.html. 

 

What You Get

We want to show our gratitude for your gift by sharing with you some of the wares and services of our talented family of writers, editors, and our illustrator.  We are offering everything from original art, signed book copies to Skyping sessions, editing services and more.  Check out all the goodies we are giving away on the right side of the page.  You can also find out details at http://www.wordbranch.com/donation-perks.html

 

Our Impact

Currently authors have only three options for publishing: Traditional, self-publishing, and vanity publishing (pay to publish). 

  • Traditional publishing is extremely difficult to break into, and the industry tends to treat unproven authors badly. 
  • While some vanity presses are legitimate platforms for publishing, others border on predatory, and they can be very expensive with little personal attention.
  • Self-publishing has been an option for many, but the publishing industry is complex, and it is difficult for an individual to maneuver the procedures.  In addition, most bookstores won’t buy directly from self-published authors.

What the Word Branch Publishing Cooperative will do is fill the gaps and give authors back their power in the publishing and book selling community. Our goal is to pool the talents and interests of our team to create a community of teamwork, creativity, and success. We have a three-pronged plan to accomplish our goals:

  1. Utilize our current talent and published books to maintain the integrity of WBP and aid in the conversion of a private company to a not-for-profit cooperative.
  2. Recruit new authors and support to develop a solid foundation for growth.
  3. Maintain a high quality of book publishing that offers a haven for talented authors.

 

Risks & Challenges

We are confident that we have built a solid background to convert WBP into a successful cooperative; however, we also realize that unexpected challenges may arise. 

  • We don’t meet our fundraising goal: While we feel that we have set a reasonable and achievable goal, in the event that we don’t reach it, there is a contingency plan.           
    • If we reach an amount suitable for legal fees, we will continue with our plan but at a slower rate to gain the extra operating funds.
    • If we are not able to cover legal costs, we will use the remaining donations to create a one-time scholarship for a promising writer.
  • We find that after six months, we cannot sustain the co-op: After the first six months, we will assess the success and needs of WBP, and make adjustments accordingly.  We feel confident that we can overcome any adversity to find creative and realistic ways of keeping the co-op going. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think we have an awesome idea, but you can’t afford to contribute, you can still help us make the co-op a reality.

  • Tell your friends, family, co-workers—EVERYBODY!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share, share, share!
  • Buy our books at http://www.wordbranch.com/book-shop.html, Amazon, Barnes & Noble and other retail outlets.

story:
"Song of Riddles"  approaches Shir Hashirim in an entirely new way.  It demonstrates that Shir Hashirim is actually a part of what has been assumed by scholars to be a lost genre, the genre of riddles. The book delves into the fundamental difference between  metaphors and riddles.   

Geula Twersky has developed a revolutionary approach to understanding Song of Songs. New insights into the entire Tanach will be gained through this unique book. 

Geula's background in both Bible scholarship and as a Judaic fine artist served as the basis for her being able to look at the Song in a completely different way than it has ever been looked at before- more in line with the way in which one analyzes a painting than a literary text.

Geula is the first Orthodox Jewish woman to write an innovative work of Torah scholarship on the Song of Songs; making this a groundbreaking project.  Please be a part making "Song of Riddles" a reality.

 Geffen Publishing will be publishing the book, however, funding for first time authors must come largely from their own efforts.  Your contribution is an essential part of this important project.  You can help make it happen.

story:
“As It Is In Heaven – The Mystery of Harp Worship Restored” is a landmark book being written by Psalmist and international harp instructor, Michael-David. It's message is desperately needed by Christians today. The book will address a powerful dynamic in prayer as well as the spiritual significance of how God is restoring the harp in these End Times. The timely reality of this book touches the heart of the concept of the Restoration of the Tabernacle of David and the time clock of the Nation of Israel. The Jewish people hung up their harps when they were led captive in Babylon. The prophecy in Amos 9 says when Israel permanently returns to the Land, David's Tabernacle will be restored... and with that, the harp. You can help get this important message out by helping to publish this book.

Though this discussion about harps may seem a bit obscure and narrow in its subject matter, it is not. You will find that what seemed to be a narrow topic, encompasses a significant aspect of End Times prophecy. Because of the spiritually strategic time that we are living in, these truths will come alive when you read this book. You will be surprised at how universally relevant this topic is.  With over 20,000 Prayer Houses around the world with what they call “harp and bowl” intercession, this movement is responding to the current wave of interest in harp worship that is touching the destiny of nations right now. At present only a few are actually using harps. But this is changing as the revelation of the harp paradigm is more fully understood. God is restoring the use of the harp to be used along with both traditional and contemporary worship instruments.

Michael-David is perhaps the world’s leading expert in the field of harp worship. He brings a unique perspective as he answers the questions “Why the Harp”, “Why Now?”,  and “What Does this Mean to You – Even if you Don’t Play the Harp”. This book is essential for Church leaders, musicians, worshippers and intercessors who will enhance the effectiveness of their prayers when they are impacted by a fresh understanding of this new paradigm. In fact, Christians everywhere will find this book relevant, captivating and a must read for these last days.

In Jeremiah 6:16 we are told to “stand at the crossroads and ask for the ancient path, for there you will find rest for your soul”. A clear understanding of this shift in spiritual climate is needed to tap into the benefits of ancient truths that King David, the greatest harpist of all, left as a prophetic legacy that is now being fulfilled in these end times. Topics include: How our prayers manifest before the Throne of God, How to increase the effectiveness of our prayers, How to create an atmosphere inviting the presence of God, and stories of the miraculous that have taken place with the ministry of the harp.

The resurgence of the harp as shown in the recent unprecedented popularity of the harp has spawned unexpected demand for harps. Manufacturers like Rees Harps Inc. with their popular line of Harpsicle Harps and family-run workshops making custom handcrafted harps, like Marini Made Harps, have difficulties keeping up with orders due to this phenomena. This inspiring book will explain the spiritual significance of this grassroots movement and why this is relevant to you.

You have an elder playing a harp over your prayers in heaven right now! Most people do not understand what is happening or why. That is why we need your help to publish this book NOW!

Introduction to Our Ministry

 

 

More About the Perks

We are grateful for your support and are delighted to offer these thank you gifts. Many of these gifts have more information available to you in the form of sample video links as shown below. Please take some time and view  as you consider your level of donation. Feel free to make multiple donations and receive any number of gifts as you would like. Don't forget that all books given as thank you gifts will be personally autographed by the author.

Thanks so much for your help in getting this important message out!

 

For Your Gift of $25 - USD

"As It Is In Heaven - The Mystery of Harp Worship Restored"

Receive an autographed copy of the book

 

For Your Gift of $45 USD

- Receive an Autographed Book and CD "A Prophetic Harp and a  Golden Bowl"

Click on the link below to view video

 

Endorsement from David Van Koevering 

MICHAEL-DAVID – THE MAN AND HIS MUSIC

Ray Hughes, my close friend and often co-speaker, called me a while back and shared his experience with harpist Michael-David. Ray has the unique consciousness of true worship and spiritual position for psalmists creating the sounds and music that God inhabits!

When we met, all that Ray Hughes had said and much more regarding Michael-David’s music and ministry was so clearly evident.

I have heard world class harpists from all across the land and several from around the world. Michael-David’s music and spirit are so filled with the authority of God that Becky and I, including our Executive Staff, Rev. Stan and Nancy Patterson, were deeply moved.

Most of you reading this know who I am and know something about what Ray Hughes and I teach. I endorse this CD, the ministry, and the man behind this music totally! You will experience from Michael’s CD a live and spirit changing level of higher bandwidth and God consciousness. Go there...  Get this powerful CD now...  This will change your home and your future.   

David Van Koevering, Elsewhen Research, Inc.

- Receive the Autographed Book and 2 CDs

1. CD - A Prophetic Harp and a Golden Bowl

2. CD - A Prophetic Harp on a Musical Journey Through Israel

For Your Gift of $10,000

in addition to the autographed book and all the CDs/DVDs offered as perks we will also be pleased to give you a Harpella!

Click on the video below to see and hear the Harpella.

The Harpella requires a musical instrument amplifier or can be plugged into any sound system. First shipment of Harpellas are expect in 2017. When available you will receive a numbered and signed special edition. The first people will receive the lowest numbers on this signed edition. Be one of the first to possess this revolutionary instrument.

story:
Dragon’s Keep

The Ciardha Deamhan have returned. They are moving north, destroying everything in their path.

First born son and heir to Dragon’s Keep, Thomas Arach wants desperately to earn his father’s respect and that of the other squires training in the craft of war. Frail at birth and kept away from danger, he’s bitterly sure he’ll never be allowed to learn how to fight.

Traitors lurk among the squires surrounding Thomas and within the ranks of servants whom he’s know all his life. His father, mother, aunt and uncle are sabotaged on their way to the capitol and disappear. His brother and sister and two cousins must learn how to fight as they are forced to take on the defense of Dragon’s Keep or face the agonizing death planned for them at the hands of the High Draiolc and deamhan hordes.

Unknown to them, Swords of Light lie dormant in the Keep, waiting to be called to fight against those hordes. An ancient talisman, part of a powerful amulet, lies hidden within the Keep. A long lost ally waits for extreme danger to take up the mantle of greatness once again. 

Genesis of The Dragon’s Children

Hi! I’m Natli VanDerWerken. I’d really appreciate your help publishing my first book, Dragon’s Keep. I’m planning on distributing it as both an ebook and a print on demand book.

I’ve written and edited newsletters, written articles for newspapers and designed, written content for, and published websites for non-profits, candidates and businesses using all kinds of platforms. I was a meteorologist in the Navy where I wrote training manuals for members of the Navy Reserve.

Dragon’s Keep literally came into being as a story that I told my children and grandchildren on Christmas Eve. The grandchildren were tired and grumpy after opening presents and getting ready to leave. I sat in a chair in the living room and told them that I had a story for them. I began with the Keep and told them of the dragon pressed into service as a babysitter while their parents went to the capitol to help the King. The demons attack the Keep and the children must find the magic swords and defend their home. As the story unfolded, the children came closer and closer until they were sitting in a circle at my feet. I glanced up and saw their parents sitting down and listening intently. I knew then, I had to write the story.

I’m still surprised that I’ve written it. The chapters flew out of my mind onto the page. I could hear the characters talking and watched what they did and then wrote what I heard and saw. It was amazing. Editing, adding and subtracting, has been just as surprising. The next book is The Windward Range (already started) followed by Ard Ri. The last two in the series are Falcon’s Spire and ShapeShifter.

Please join me in bringing this story to the world. I can’t tell you how excited I am to get this done!

What I Need

My goal is to publish in March 2017. Professional editing, book cover, interior design and publication are essential to make this the best novel possible. I need to hire a professional content editor for $1400, interior designer (yes, books need to be designed so that chapters fall in the right place, page numbering is correct, borders take into account the binding, etc., etc.) for $1500, professional cover design for $800, ISBN numbers: 10 @ $35 ea = $350, professional publication and distribution $500. That comes to $4550.00. I’ve already invested $650 for my website, professional photos and the video you can see above.

& What You Get

Funding Levels:

$5   – name listed as contributor on my website.

$10 – a certificate of appreciation and name listed on my website.

$25 – echapter of Dragon’s Keep, certificate of appreciation and name listed on my website.

$75 - ebook of Dragon’s Keep, certificate of appreciation and name listed on my website.

$100 – signed paperback copy of Dragon’s Keep, a free ebook copy of Dragon’s Keep, certificate of appreciation and name listed on my website.

$200 & above - signed hardback copy of Dragon’s Keep, paperback and ebook copy of Dragon’s Keep, certificate of appreciation and name listed on my website.

If I don’t reach my goal, I’ll still use the funds to do as much as I can to finish the publication process. The book will be published!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help! Take a few minutes and share this with your friends and people you think might like the book. Every email, post and tweet will really help! It’s easy when you use the Indiegogo share tools!
