story:
The Little Cloud that Follows Me Around is a heartfelt story about a child, who wants to have fun and live a joyful life like the other children, but his insecurities and anxiety are often in the way. Through games and play, the child accepts who he is and learns to manage his emotions better, opening the door to a happy childhood. 

The book is written by Ornella Kotupanova - Sole, a single mom with terminal cancer. Knowing that she might not live long enough to guide her son through life’s hard moments and help him understand his emotions, she wanted to leave a living legacy in the form of a book.

Ornella recalls battling with depression and bullying in her school years and she realised many other children are going through the same thing. Mental health at a young age is extremely important, yet there’s a lack of supporting materials and tools to help children cope with things they often can’t explain, spell out or make sense of. This book is a solution that could even be implemented in our school system, as suggested by a social worker who read the story. 

Ornella found a handful of incredible creatives and professionals who were happy to work tirelessly and bring this project to life. They formed a company, called Wizards of Fables and produced 3 amazing packs with a great educational and interactive value for children of different ages. 

 

The book comes in three packs Mage, Sorcerer and Wizard pack.

  • MAGE pack is our basic package which includes one copy of our book 'The Little Cloud That Follows Me Around' printed on fine recycled paper packed with love in our branded gift packaging.

  • SORCERER pack is our middle package which includes one copy of our book 'The Little Cloud That Follows Me Around' printed on fine recycled paper and one refillable interactive journal. The journal includes calendar pages, inspirational and motivational quotes, project planner, colouring, drawing and writing pages as well as tested children's therapeutic games created with the help of top experienced family and children psychiatrist. All of the above comes in our branded gift packaging.

  • WIZARD pack is our luxurious package which includes one copy of our book 'The Little Cloud That Follows Me Around' printed on fine recycled paper, one refillable interactive journal, a mood meter flashcard and parent manual. The journal includes calendar pages, inspirational and motivational quotes, project planner, colouring, drawing and writing pages as well as tested children's therapeutic games created with the help of top experienced family and children psychiatrist. The flashcards and the parent manual are the perfect tools for improving the communication between the child and the parent as well as getting a better understanding of the child mental and emotional state. All of the above comes in our branded gift packaging.

You will be able to completely personalise your child's character by picking the skin, eye and hair colour in addition to the sex.

GIRL CHARACTER EXAMPLE:

BOY CHARACTER EXAMPLE:

PHOTO AND DEDICATION PAGE:

PAPER: Mohawk Options 100% PC is an uncoated paper made using wind power, with 100% post-consumer waste. It is an environmental sheet that bridges the gap between the qualities of text and cover papers and the printability of coated papers. 

Cyclus Offset is a renowned 100% recycled offset paper in a natural white shade. Cyclus Offset has quality paper properties such as rigidity, stability, opacity, tear strength and foldability. The quality now meets the environment. 

SUSTAINABILITY AND FINISH: To ensure durability we have applied satin non-scratch finish to the cover of the book and to be sure our product is 100% child-friendly we have rounded the paper edges of the book.

  • Inspired by Life
  • Premium Recycled Paper
  • Supreme Print Quality
  • High-End Print Effects
  • Luxury Packaging
  • 100% Child-Friendly
  •  Eco-Friendly
  • Interactive, Inspirational & Therapeutic Pages 
  • Personalised
  • Free Dedication 
  • Approved by Psychologists
  • Great Value for Money
  • Compact & Practical
  • Available in Braille and Large Print
  • Book with a CAUSE

We have refined and combined all our competitor's strong suit and elevated our product by adding interactive and educational part topped with a great cause and realness - which makes our product unique and innovative.

“The little child has no prejudices and accepts differences with curiosity, not fear. The idea that the cloud accompanies the child and transforms him from sad and isolated to a friend that helps you not be lonely is very accurate. When a person has the opportunity in his childhood to find the right words for his differences, emotions and thoughts (that the cloud metaphorically symbolizes) and to befriend it, he becomes accepting of others’ differences and gains better understanding. When you don’t have the words or description for what makes you sad and lonely, this can turn into fear and become anger and hatred towards others who are different.

If this little book comes to a child at the right time, it can make the world a cosier and better place, in which differences, emotions and thoughts of others don’t scare them or cause racism and segregation.

Parents can use the book to speak with their child about emotions and their meanings. The book presents an opportunity for the child to put their emotions and feelings into words, so as to learn to distinguish and understands them.”  - TOLK Family and Children Psychoanalytic Insititute (B.Banova & V.Banova) 

Now, Ornella and Wizards of Fables need your help to get this remarkable book in the hands of more children, parents and people struggling with depression, anxiety, loss or bullying. Do you want to help us deliver that reassuring and comforting message?​


Unfortunately, publishing a book of this quality, with all educational and interactive materials that come in the various packs, is very expensive. As a terminally-ill cancer patient, Ornella simply doesn’t have the financial means, nor the strength to cover the cost of publishing, printing and distributing. Her team is sacrificing a great deal of their personal time to make sure this book becomes a reality. Yet, without your donations, The Little Cloud that Follows me Around will only remain a dream. A small keepsake one mom leaves her son. Together, however, we can make Ornella’s legacy live forever, and more importantly, help many children who are missing on a great, joyful and carefree childhood, find the sparkle that makes them smile. 

Thank you! 

Ornella and Wizards of Fables

YOUR HELP MEANS THE WORLD TO US
story_txt:
The Little Cloud that Follows Me Around is a heartfelt story about a child, who wants to have fun and live a joyful life like the other children, but his insecurities and anxiety are often in the way. Through games and play, the child accepts who he is and learns to manage his emotions better, opening the door to a happy childhood. The book is written by Ornella Kotupanova - Sole, a single mom with terminal cancer. Knowing that she might not live long enough to guide her son through life’s hard moments and help him understand his emotions, she wanted to leave a living legacy in the form of a book.Ornella recalls battling with depression and bullying in her school years and she realised many other children are going through the same thing. Mental health at a young age is extremely important, yet there’s a lack of supporting materials and tools to help children cope with things they often can’t explain, spell out or make sense of. This book is a solution that could even be implemented in our school system, as suggested by a social worker who read the story. Ornella found a handful of incredible creatives and professionals who were happy to work tirelessly and bring this project to life. They formed a company, called Wizards of Fables and produced 3 amazing packs with a great educational and interactive value for children of different ages.  The book comes in three packs Mage, Sorcerer and Wizard pack.MAGE pack is our basic package which includes one copy of our book 'The Little Cloud That Follows Me Around' printed on fine recycled paper packed with love in our branded gift packaging.SORCERER pack is our middle package which includes one copy of our book 'The Little Cloud That Follows Me Around' printed on fine recycled paper and one refillable interactive journal. The journal includes calendar pages, inspirational and motivational quotes, project planner, colouring, drawing and writing pages as well as tested children's therapeutic games created with the help of top experienced family and children psychiatrist. All of the above comes in our branded gift packaging.WIZARD pack is our luxurious package which includes one copy of our book 'The Little Cloud That Follows Me Around' printed on fine recycled paper, one refillable interactive journal, a mood meter flashcard and parent manual. The journal includes calendar pages, inspirational and motivational quotes, project planner, colouring, drawing and writing pages as well as tested children's therapeutic games created with the help of top experienced family and children psychiatrist. The flashcards and the parent manual are the perfect tools for improving the communication between the child and the parent as well as getting a better understanding of the child mental and emotional state. All of the above comes in our branded gift packaging.You will be able to completely personalise your child's character by picking the skin, eye and hair colour in addition to the sex.GIRL CHARACTER EXAMPLE:BOY CHARACTER EXAMPLE:PHOTO AND DEDICATION PAGE:PAPER: Mohawk Options 100% PC is an uncoated paper made using wind power, with 100% post-consumer waste. It is an environmental sheet that bridges the gap between the qualities of text and cover papers and the printability of coated papers. Cyclus Offset is a renowned 100% recycled offset paper in a natural white shade. Cyclus Offset has quality paper properties such as rigidity, stability, opacity, tear strength and foldability. The quality now meets the environment. SUSTAINABILITY AND FINISH: To ensure durability we have applied satin non-scratch finish to the cover of the book and to be sure our product is 100% child-friendly we have rounded the paper edges of the book.
Inspired by Life
Premium Recycled Paper
Supreme Print Quality
High-End Print Effects
Luxury Packaging
100% Child-Friendly
 Eco-Friendly
Interactive, Inspirational & Therapeutic Pages 
Personalised
Free Dedication 
Approved by Psychologists
Great Value for Money
Compact & Practical
Available in Braille and Large Print
Book with a CAUSE
We have refined and combined all our competitor's strong suit and elevated our product by adding interactive and educational part topped with a great cause and realness - which makes our product unique and innovative.“The little child has no prejudices and accepts differences with curiosity, not fear. The idea that the cloud accompanies the child and transforms him from sad and isolated to a friend that helps you not be lonely is very accurate. When a person has the opportunity in his childhood to find the right words for his differences, emotions and thoughts (that the cloud metaphorically symbolizes) and to befriend it, he becomes accepting of others’ differences and gains better understanding. When you don’t have the words or description for what makes you sad and lonely, this can turn into fear and become anger and hatred towards others who are different.If this little book comes to a child at the right time, it can make the world a cosier and better place, in which differences, emotions and thoughts of others don’t scare them or cause racism and segregation.Parents can use the book to speak with their child about emotions and their meanings. The book presents an opportunity for the child to put their emotions and feelings into words, so as to learn to distinguish and understands them.”  - TOLK Family and Children Psychoanalytic Insititute (B.Banova & V.Banova) Now, Ornella and Wizards of Fables need your help to get this remarkable book in the hands of more children, parents and people struggling with depression, anxiety, loss or bullying. story:
The Problem

In December 2020, I finished an MFA program in 3D Animation and VFX. During this transition period, I was working with a delivery service to pay the bills every afternoon, and writing my science fiction series, Chronicles of a Planet's End, every morning. 

On January 15th, at 3:45 pm, as I was coming home, a speeding SUV came up behind me and hit my car while trying to change lanes. Right now, my car isn't drivable and is sitting at a wrecker service. I started a claim with his insurance and spoke to my insurance. It will be a few weeks before I have a car back.

As a result, I currently have no income. I have been working towards migrating to a different income stream, but it will take time. Because of the source of income, I don't qualify for unemployment. In order to survive this transition, I have to ask for outside help. I am aware we are all struggling right now because of the global pandemic, but, if you can assist, it will be appreciated.

I thought it would be great to make this fundraiser tied to the completion of my next book, making my book series the center of this campaign. 

Campaign Goals and Financial Breakdown

With the loss of my car, I am looking at a rather dark next few weeks. 

The Ask

$3000.00

The Breakdown

$740 Rent
$184 Health Insurance
$500.00 Utilities, Telephone, Internet, etc.
$150.00 Food
$500.00 Insurance Deductible if the other guy's insurance won't cover it and my insurance will. 
$200.00 Money I owe from expenses this last weekend
$100.00 Car Insurance
$100,00 Transporation costs to deal with the car
$426.00 Books to give out exchanges for donations
$100.00 IndieGoGo Fee

What Will Happen During This Time

During this time, I will focus on developing other sources of income and finish the sixth book in the Chronicles of a Planet's End. 

At the moment, I have almost finished the rough draft of the sixth book. It should be published in March.

What are Chronicles of a Planet's End?

Chronicles of a Planet's End follows a set of characters as they face the inevitable end of the world across four distinct subseries. It is written under my pen name Elena Sierra and is science fiction with elements of fantasy. I wanted to take a group of individuals facing a radical end and the possibilities of interstellar travel and walk them through an impossible future. It is an adventure told from different perspectives, but it is also looking at bigger issues within the interstellar adventure. How do we create belief? How can people live the exact same future and have a totally different relationship to it? What does family mean? What is friendship or community? What is the danger of the cult or charismatic leader? How do we as people deal with realities that are horrid or simply beyond our comprehension? 

It is an adult science fiction book series, even though the first three books of The Alexander Chronicles could be appropriate for a young adult audience. All the books contain some degree of violence, sexuality, and adult language.

HTTP://www.elenasierra.net

The story starts with The Alexander Chronicles.  It is about a family immersed in a tradition of interstellar travel, starting when the children are teenagers, and taking them into adulthood. This series is currently at Book Three.

The story continues with The Belief Chronicles. This is a series told from two perspectives. It is told from the perspective of a woman who becomes the most powerful being on Earth and doesn't really want either the path or the responsibility. It is also told from the perspective of a man whose craving for power is such that he is willing to do whatever it takes to be worshipped, valued, and adored.

The third series is The Celluloid Chronicles, which is set in the world of media. It follows the perspective of people living ordinary lives within Los Angeles that are suddenly faced with a reality beyond the movies. The book I am currently writing is the first of this series. 

The fourth series is still under development.

The books can be read by subseries or chronologically. 

The Chronological Order is:

The Alexander Chronicles Book One 
The Alexander Chronicles Book Two
The Belief Chronicles Book One
The Alexander Chronicles Book Three
The Belief Chronicles Book Two
The Celluloid Chronicles Book One

The Gift of Books

I will be sending my books as a thank you gift for your help. I am aware it is possible to buy the books for less on Amazon. This isn't so much about selling the books, but rather to thank you for your help during this difficult time. 

If you give $100, I will send you the physical book version of all five current books and the sixth book once it is done.

If you give $50, I will send you the physical book versions of The Alexander Chronicles or you can have the six books in Kindle format.

If you give $40, I will send you the physical book versions of The Belief Chronicles.

If you give $30, I will send you the Kindle versions of The Alexander Chronicles.

If you give $20, I will send you the Kindle versions of The Belief Chronicles or anyone physical copy of one of the books.

If you give $10, I will send you any one Kindle copy of one of my books.

I will write a small thank you note in all paperback editions before sending them out. In order not to break the KDP guidelines, I will be buying all the Kindle books and sending them to you as gifts. You will receive an email from Amazon for you to download. It will also be easier this way for you to get them into your Kindle.

What happens if more than $3000 is fundraised?

I will put any excess money directly into writing more books, kindle advertising and promotions, and expanding the success of this series. I would also love to invest in the future in professional publishing services to increase the distribution and quality of the artwork and the books. 

The Impact

The campaign is both a lifesaver and a support my life long creative endeavor.

For me, writing is my lifeline. It is what makes me wake up in the morning. I want to create an incredible story world that expands beyond novels and really looks at what it means to be human. 

That being said, the support of this campaign will also guarantee that I have a roof over my head and food to eat for at least long enough to sort of the mess with the car. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I really appreciate all of your support, and if you can't contribute financially at this time, then I would love it if you would spread the word about the campaign. The campaign is only 17 days long because I need it done with enough time to pay rent. I do appreciate all of your support in this insane endeavor. If you have read my books, reviews on Amazon or Goodreads are always awesome.

story:
Hey there! 

I'm John G. Hartness, and I write the Bubba the Monster Hunter series of short stories and novellas. Think of it if Ash from The Evil Dead and Larry the Cable Guy had a baby, it would turn out a lot like Bubba. He's a giant redneck from the mountains of Georgia, and he's been hunting monsters and kicking ass since 2012! 

I've put out four collections of Bubba Stories - Scattered, Smothered, & Chunked; Grits, Guns, & Glory; Wine, Women, & Song; and Monsters, Magic, & Mayhem. All of these are available in ebook, print, and audiobook. I'm currently in the middle of Season 5, with two of the four novellas released - Born to Be Wild and Swamp Music. They're available in print and ebook format currently. 

I've also released a short story collection about Bubba's Great-Grandpappy Beauregard entitled Shinepunk, which is what you get if you mix moonshine, steampunk, monsters, and rednecks. Shinepunk is available in print & ebook. 

So what's this whole thing for? 

We're producing the audiobooks for Shinepunk, Born to Be Wild, and Swamp Music. John Solo, who has narrated Seasons 2-4, is gearing up to start recording soon, and we can't wait to get these into your hands. 

That's what this whole thing is for. By pre-ordering the audiobooks through this campaign, you'll get them a whole lot faster than if you wait for normal distribution. After an audiobook is produced, it can take as much as six weeks for it to go through all the computerized rigamarole to get it out there for you to listen to. This way, you get it as soon as we perfect the product (and I don't have to give 60% of the money to the distributor. 

Yeah, 60% of the money you spend on an audiobook goes to the distributor. Or 75% in some cases. This way, you support the creator (me) directly, and you get your audiobook faster! 

We're making these audiobooks regardless of whether we hit our goal or not. The budget is approved, and the studio time is scheduled. So it's not a question of whether or not they'll get made, it's just a matter of how quickly they get through post-production and become available, and how many awesome Bubba short stories I get to narrate for you! 

Wait, what?

Yeah, that's right. Everyone who backs the project, at any level, will get a free Bubba the Monster Hunter short story narrated by yours truly. I'm an actor with over three decades of experience, and you can check out the Falstaff Books YouTube channel to see some of my readings from conventions. I'm pretty good, if not very modest. :) 

And for every $500 over the goal we get, I'll record another short story to go out to every single backer of the project! These short stories will be available exclusively to our supporters here for six months, then we'll put them on sale other places. But you fine folx get to decide how many we're gonna do, so spread the word and get all your friends to pitch in and get me behind the microphone! 

Risks

There are always risks. We could all get hit by an asteroid tomorrow. But I think with the sheer number of Bubba projects John Solo and I have done together over the years, this one is about as guaranteed as we can make it. I expect the books to be recorded over the course of the Spring, and we'll release them one at a time as they get through quality control. Quality Control's name is Theresa. Some of y'all have met her. She's awesome, and she proofs my audio for me. Like I said, the studio time is booked, and the money is already set aside. These things are getting made, it's just a question of how fast do you want 'em, and how many short stories do you want me to read? 

But I'm Broke, how can I help?

Dude, I feel ya. If you can chuck in $2, you'll get any and all short stories just as a way of saying thanks. But if you just want to lend your voice, use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word on all the social media sites, because the more people hear how awesome it's gonna be, the more awesome it'll be!

story:
Short Summary

Greetings! My name is Ponce Ferguson. I'm a freelance journalist and language teacher. I also worked as a Language Access Assistant for the Judiciary in the State of Virginia. We've all heard many things about Africa and it's people.  The good the bad, and the ugly, even. For the most part, however, the bad things and the ugly stories are usually what get stuck in our minds. I hope that with this project I can begin to show the positive side of Africa, its people and its culture. ABENA: Princess of Africa is based on true facts. It's the story of several people I encountered on my first trip to Ghana. The story is centered around Abena, a young Ghanaian girl who is committed and devoted in getting out of her small little town, meet her prince charming and make it big in the bigger city. Along the way, she meets interesting people. Men who will stop at nothing to get their way and "aunties" who will lend a helping hand and support in her quest. More than anything else, Abena, Princess of Africa, is a love story between a beautiful young lady, and a much older man. The story will bring forth the sensitivity, the sex, the romance and kindness of good hearted  people. This is the side of Africa that is never told, the good side of humanity.

Your contributions will help bring to the forefront the side of Africa that is almost never spoken of. Africa is more that poverty and famine; it's more than corrupt politicians. Africa, is smiles in times of trouble and adversities. It's caring for one another and above all, Africa is love. Please help me show the world the goodness of a wonderful land and its people.

What We Need & What You Get

The total production of this book is estimated at $13,000. 

**Please keep in mind that all donations are welcome. From $1 to your heart's content. Thank you so very much.

  • These funds will be used to finish the research and information gathering from Abena and other sources, for which I will be traveling back to Ghana. A great part of the funds will be used for publishing, which includes: typesetting/formatting, proofing, editing, final design and print. Finally, your donations will help cover distribution and marketing of the book.
  • There is nothing like making a contribution to a campaign and being part of that event. Your contributions will get you the following and make you a part of this production: 
  • $25 - A paper back copy. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
  • $35 - Signed copy of the book and a poster of Abena. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
  • $100 - The above plus your name written in the book. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
  • &150 - The above plus your pic in the book. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
  • If per chance I don't meet my goal, all the funds will be dedicated to publishing and distribution.

The Impact

  • It's very simple. I really want the world to know that there is more that the negativity we hear about Africa. Africans are people. They are human beings who only ask for a chance to show that they are worthy, that they too can contribute to our society as a whole. They are kind hearted people who are willing to share with us whatever little they have. 

    All i want is for the world to know that we don't have to treat Africa and African as if they were extraterrestrials living on this Earth. There is another beautiful side to Africa. A side of compassionate love, fun and diversity. That's the side that you will help me bring to life in ABENA, Princess of Africa.

Risks & Challenges

In book writing, as you may know, the only risk is that no one reads your book. But far more concerning, and a big present challenge, is the fact that due to the current pandemic, the Ghanaian borders are closed and it is a bit difficult in trying to get a ticket booked to fly to Ghana, as I need to finish my research. I'm planning to leave for Ghana by mid August, but if the borders are not opened by then, that will set the plans behind. Please keep that in mind. NEVERTHELESS, I intend to use whatever means in order to finish the book

Other Ways You Can Help

It's completely understandable if you are not able to contribute financially, However, there are other ways you can help! The best way of which is to spread the word by sharing this link: https://youtu.be/2QR8twlBzKs  through social media and word of mouth! Thank you.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Greetings! My name is Ponce Ferguson. I'm a freelance journalist and language teacher. I also worked as a Language Access Assistant for the Judiciary in the State of Virginia. We've all heard many things about Africa and it's people.  The good the bad, and the ugly, even. For the most part, however, the bad things and the ugly stories are usually what get stuck in our minds. I hope that with this project I can begin to show the positive side of Africa, its people and its culture. ABENA: Princess of Africa is based on true facts. It's the story of several people I encountered on my first trip to Ghana. The story is centered around Abena, a young Ghanaian girl who is committed and devoted in getting out of her small little town, meet her prince charming and make it big in the bigger city. Along the way, she meets interesting people. Men who will stop at nothing to get their way and "aunties" who will lend a helping hand and support in her quest. More than anything else, Abena, Princess of Africa, is a love story between a beautiful young lady, and a much older man. The story will bring forth the sensitivity, the sex, the romance and kindness of good hearted  people. This is the side of Africa that is never told, the good side of humanity.
Your contributions will help bring to the forefront the side of Africa that is almost never spoken of. Africa is more that poverty and famine; it's more than corrupt politicians. Africa, is smiles in times of trouble and adversities. It's caring for one another and above all, Africa is love. Please help me show the world the goodness of a wonderful land and its people.

What We Need & What You Get
The total production of this book is estimated at $13,000. 
**Please keep in mind that all donations are welcome. From $1 to your heart's content. Thank you so very much.

These funds will be used to finish the research and information gathering from Abena and other sources, for which I will be traveling back to Ghana. A great part of the funds will be used for publishing, which includes: typesetting/formatting, proofing, editing, final design and print. Finally, your donations will help cover distribution and marketing of the book.
There is nothing like making a contribution to a campaign and being part of that event. Your contributions will get you the following and make you a part of this production: 
$25 - A paper back copy. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
$35 - Signed copy of the book and a poster of Abena. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
$100 - The above plus your name written in the book. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
&150 - The above plus your pic in the book. Estimated shipping, December 2020.
If per chance I don't meet my goal, all the funds will be dedicated to publishing and distribution.


The Impact

It's very simple. I really want the world to know that there is more that the negativity we hear about Africa. Africans are people. They are human beings who only ask for a chance to show that they are worthy, that they too can contribute to our society as a whole. They are kind hearted people who are willing to share with us whatever little they have. 
All i want is for the world to know that we don't have to treat Africa and African as if they were extraterrestrials living on this Earth. There is another beautiful side to Africa. A side of compassionate love, fun and diversity. That's the side that you will help me bring to life in ABENA, Princess of Africa.


Risks & Challenges
In book writing, as you may know, the only risk is that no one reads your book. But far more concerning, and a big present challenge, is the fact that due to the current pandemic, the Ghanaian borders are closed and it is a bit difficult in trying to get a ticket booked to fly to Ghana, as I need to finish my research. I'm planning to leave for Ghana by mid August, but if the borders are not opened by then, that will set the plans behind. Please keep that in mind. NEVERTHELESS, I intend to use whatever means in order to finish the book

Other Ways You Can Help
It's completely understandable if you are not able to contribute financially, However, there are other ways you can help! The best way of which is to spread the word by sharing this link: https://youtu.be/2QR8twlBzKs  through social media and word of mouth! Thank you.

story:
#RBG100th

In commemoration of the 100-year anniversary of the UNIA’s “First International Convention of the Negro Peoples of the World,” a collective of grassroots organizers and Pan Africanist organizations will host the RBG Centennial Conference. The virtual convention’s theme is “Garveyism and the renewed cry for Afrikan Nationhood.” The RBG Centennial Conference will feature 70+ speakers, representing more than 60 organizations from 20 countries. The conference will also feature 50+ workshops, including panel discussions, virtual performances, and vending. Organizers are using #RBG100th to educate and bring attention to the legacy of His Excellency, the Honorable Marcus Mosiah Garvey, and the work of the Universal Negro Improvement Association (U.N.I.A).

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $25k to be used to cover the cost of translation; to make the content from the conference (more than 100 hours of English speaking, lectures, panels, and workshops) available to audiences in Spanish, French, and Portuguese.
  • A "Centennial" by definition, is a once in a life time event.  The backers of this historic project, will have their names enshrined in history forever, and our future generations will be eternally grateful

The Significance

When the UNIA held this historic gathering, 100 years ago, it was headline news all around the world.  Unfortunately, for future generations, none of the lectures, workshops, or presentations from that historic event were captured, and preserved for posterity.  We don't want to make the same mistake twice.  If this campaign is successful, not only will it be preserved for future generations, they'll be able to view it in:

  • Spanish
  • French
  • Portuguese
  • and English

story:
About the Publication

‘The Direction I Rub One Matters’ is an exhibition publication for the homonymous group exhibition at Grey Projects, featuring textile works by Ian Tee, Moses Tan, Zarina Muhammad and Zulkhairi Zulkiflee. The publication contains a curatorial foreword by Jason Wee, conversations with and between the artists, as well as images and details of the works. Inspired by the exhibition’s focus on textiles as a medium, we will be launching a limited number of copies with special handmade fabric covers! The fabric covers will come in four unique styles, each made to represent one of the four exhibiting artists, who will be co-designing and making their covers with our team at Grey Projects. 

 

What We Need 

We need your support to help raise enough funds to cover the publishing and printing costs for this exhibition publication!

 

What You Get

 

5 USD – Karma and a Sense of Benevolence

Thank you kind soul, every bit counts in helping us make this publication happen!

 

15 USD – Just the Book

  • Pre-order of 1 basic book without fabric cover
  • Self-pickup / worldwide shipping (select appropriate perk)

 

18 USD  – Fully Clothed

  • Pre-order of 1 book with a fabric cover of your choice
  • Self-pickup / worldwide shipping (select appropriate perk)

 

30 USD  – Double Trouble

  • Pre-order of 2 books, with 2 fabric covers of your choice
  • Self-pickup / worldwide shipping (select appropriate perk)

 

48 USD – Grey Devotee

  • Pre-order of 4 basic books without fabric covers
  • Acknowledgement in book
  • Self-pickup / worldwide shipping (select appropriate perk)

 

60 USD  – Patron of the Arts

  • Pre-order of 4 books with all 4 fabric covers
  • Acknowledgement in book
  • Self-pickup / worldwide shipping (select appropriate perk)

 

++ If your order requires shipping, please select the appropriate perk.

++ Alternatively, we would love to thank you in person for your support, so feel free to pick up your local orders at our gallery space at 6B Kim Tian Road, Singapore 169246. Just email store@greyprojects.org beforehand to let us know you’re coming!

 

About the exhibition

 

‘The Direction I Rub One Matters’ highlights how tactility possesses its own affect; it offers intimacy, comfort, security, and melancholy, to mention a few among the wide and varied ways these affects can manifest with our tactile contacts. The intensities provoked by cloth closely held against skin bring to the fore of our consciousness our desire for and fears of mutuality, shelter, protection, and isolation, desires that form up and direct our fragile embodiments and socialities, which are confronted with alarming force of late by ideologies of salvational transcendence and technological singularities.

The four artists, Ian Tee, Moses Tan, Zarina Muhammad and Zulkhairi Zulkiflee, work the suppleness of their various textiles – canvas, polyester, cotton blend, and calico, among others – into a critical syntax for describing their specific visualities as well as the textures of these affects. 

 

About the Artists

Ian Tee

Ian Tee’s (b. 1994) practice investigates the social space of abstraction through questioning surfaces and form. Conflating visual language from art history to youth subcultures, he is interested in how aesthetic narratives can be reworked and recontextualised. His work manifests in a variety of media - destroyed metal paintings, bleached and dyed textiles, collage, and modified clothes.

Ian Tee completed his BA Fine Arts at LASALLE College of the Arts, Singapore in 2018. He is a recipient of the Ngee Ann Kongsi scholarship and winner of the 2017 Cliftons Art Prize for Singapore. He is also a contributing writer for Art Republik magazine.


Moses Tan

Moses Tan (b. 1986) is an artist based in Singapore. He is interested in research surrounding queer melancholia, resistance through poetic forms and history. Employing drawing, video, sound and materials, he is interested in creating experiences.

He graduated from LASALLE College of the Arts with a BA (Hons) in Fine Arts and a BA (Hons) in Chemistry and Biological Chemistry from Nanyang Technological University.
 

Zarina Muhammad

Zarina Muhammad (b. 1982) is an artist, educator and writer whose practice is deeply entwined with her decade-long multidisciplinary research on the shapeshifting forms and cultural translations pertaining to Southeast Asian ritual magic, sacred sites, forgotten spirits and the tracing of mythological roots of the feared, desired and revered (supernatural) body across the region.

Her series of often collaborative and performance-based works deconstruct and aim to confront histories, texts, definitions, and (mis)representations associated with these bodies of knowledge and polycosmologies. In the various incarnations of her work, she is particularly interested in the broader contexts of myth-making, gender-based archetypes and the region’s tenuous and tentative relationship to mysticism and the immaterial against the dynamics of global modernity.

In 2019, she will begin a research residency at extantation – an experimental performance/art space in Chiang Mai where she intends to look into the ghost/spirit dance traditions in Northern Thailand as part of a broader study on comparative embodied performances in Asia. She has presented her work in Indonesia, Cambodia, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand and Australia.

 

Zulkhairi Zulkiflee

Zulkhairi Zulkiflee (b. 1991) is a visual artist, educator, and exhibition-maker based in Singapore. His practice explores the notion of Malayness in relation to knowledge production, social agency and distinction/ taste.

Zulkhairi has exhibited in group exhibitions such as the Young Talent Programme (2017) by the Affordable Art Fair Singapore and ION Art, CICA Contemporary Photography Exhibition Summer 2017 at the CICA Museum, South Korea, as well as Untapped Discovery (presented by Visual Arts Development Association) (2016) at SHOPHOUSE 5, Singapore. His art zine, Pisau & Timun (Knife & Cucumber), has also been acquired by the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC), catalogued under the Joan Flasch Artists’ Book Collection and shown at The New York Art Book Fair (NYABF) 2016, MoMA PS1, New York. Zulkhairi has organised alternative group exhibitions like LUCKY show (2018), RAID (2018), RUANG (2017) and Dancing on the Spot (2016).

 

Reviews and Features

Here are some cool articles that we have been featured in! 

938Now (The Direction I Rub One Matters)

ARTFORUM (The Direction I Rub One Matters)

RCGNTN (Humming donkey songs with Grey Projects)

 

About Grey Projects

Grey Projects is a non-profit art space based in Singapore. We produce publications, and generate curatorial and exchange activities. This usually means we hold exhibitions, talks, residencies, reading groups, and workshops. We have a library, a residency apartment, a studio, and two galleries. We are interested in new design practices, writing, curatorial research, and art propositions.

story:
Benefit Books Publishing is a socially conscious publishing house, focused on creating quality children’s books that not only convey impactful messages but also give back generously. This is not another one-for-one model, but rather it is a new approach on creativity, learning, and giving. Our business model is to partner together with local and national charities to make a difference through book publishing. Every season, or as we call it, Benefit Season, will feature a newly released children’s book as well as a new charity to partner with. Each season lasts 3 months. Throughout that season, a portion of the proceeds will be donated to the respective charity. This allows us to not only make an impact in one organization but tens to eventually thousands of charitable organizations. As we grow our reach, our vision is to allow for organizations to apply for fund-raising throughout the Benefit Season to create long-lasting relationships, impact, and offer exclusive giveaway content. Bringing on other writers and illustrators to create a community of world-changing writers is a near-future goal as well.

It was the late and great Whitney Houston that once sang, “I believe that children are the future,” and we could not agree more. That is why we have made it our mission to partner with charities that are primarily children-focused. The inspiration for this project stemmed from receiving news that, after 16 months of trying to conceive, my wife and I were finally expecting our first child. What will we teach him or her? How can we instill creativity and generosity into his or her heart. Combining my passion/experience as a writer (doing freelance work and self-publishing a novel), and  desire to help others made starting Benefit Books Publishing feel natural. I want to partner with parents and children to make a better world, not just for my child but for everyone. We believe that the messages in this first book and the others to follow will serve as a guiding light to creativity, learning, and generous giving. 

Benefit Books Publishing is seeking to launch into its first Benefit Season in 2020 with an original children’s book titled, Jackson Gets His Glasses. This a 32-page, soft cover, Children's book with a coloring section included. The story is about a boy named Jackson whose glasses break and he grows increasingly frustrated with being unable to see. He tries to find other ways to help improve his vision but, surprisingly to him, the help he needed comes from an unexpected source.

The funds raised will go primarily to distribution, creating a website for the company, and marketing. We are estimating an initial combined investment of $3,000 - $5,000. Of course, our main focus is to generate as much funds to give to our first charity, OneSight. The perks will break down how much is given to the organization with each monetary investment, as well as, what you get for contributing to the campaign.  The contribution amount will be 10% of all proceeds, with the exception of the "The Supporter" perk. There are other ways, besides monetary, that you could help make a huge difference in our effort. Please like, share, and repost the campaign in order to generate a buzz for an increase it’s potential to reach and do more.OneSight is an independent nonprofit with the solutions, people and resources to eradicate the vision care crisis for good. We believe that when the world sees better, the world lives better—and that with clear vision, we can take on humanity’s greatest challenges. Together with donors, volunteers, partners and sponsors, we bring eye exams, glasses and permanent vision centers to the individuals and places that need eye care the most. https://onesight.org/about-us

story:
Our Mission is to Light the Way to Literacy through Storytelling.

We go beyond being a book festival....We take the Page to the Stage!

Our mission is accomplished by providing access to books through enlivened spaces and entertainment.  This creative event features storytelling through books, art, and performance and will gather the community around this event for all ages.  

Our primary goals are to:

  • Encourage and support early literacy initiatives;
  • Support diverse, cross-cultural and family-friendly programming supported by storytelling in its many forms;
  • Create a destination of experience through arts programming.

Support for the Lit Story Fest goes to support the 1000 Books Before Kindergarten Reading Program sponsored by the DeKalb County Library System.  https://1000booksbeforekindergarten.org/

 

THE IMPACT

BUT WHY DO WE DO THIS WORK?  Here's why....

Exposure to early reading has proven to develop the reading abilities of 3rd-grade children at critical milestone testing level.  Children are more likely to read when they have easy access to books at home or at a library.  This is reinforced when they actually see themselves as significant with the story through self-identification.  Book availability and frequent reading have significant effects on future outcomes and can improve life-long success.

By bringing this festival to DeKalb County, it is our goal to make an impact by providing meaningful arts programming that supports a history of storytelling within the community. 

 

Your Support Makes A Difference

This is a free, community event, supported by people who care about the education.   We believe books and the sharing of stories can change the world.   

This fundraiser was started to offset the costs of arts programming for the event which includes, but is not limited, performances, awards, advertising and administration fees.

We appreciate donations in any amount.  All sponsorship donations received will go towards arts programming for the event, our supporters at the Friends of the Stonecrest Library, and 1000 Books Before Kindergarten.

The Biggest Perk - Books into Little Hands

When you support this community event, you are putting books into the hands of children through the 1000 Books Before Kindergarten program and library supported events.  But we don't want anyone to leave empty handed.  There are also perks for you!

Check out the perks available when you support the Lit Story Fest!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways to get involved with the Lit Story Fest! 

  • GET LIT AND SPREAD THE WORD! - Share this campaign and tell a friend about this work
  • JOIN US! - Participate as a sponsor, vendor, volunteer or audience member!  All are welcome!

story:
Kathy and Peter Creamer are passionate about Orangutan Conservation. This all began 25 years ago, whilst visiting and then working at the Singapore Zoological Gardens with the volunteer docent team. 

Peter spent a great deal of time photographing the orangutans, and especially liked to capture images of their interactions within the zoo’s social group, as orangutans tend to lead mostly solitary lives in the wild.

Kathy was inspired by the gentle and loving personality of Ah Meng, who was the Zoo’s icon and animal ambassador at that time. Kathy was eight months pregnant when she first met Ah Meng, who once allowed her to sit next to her, as was permitted in the early days of the zoo’s development. Ah Meng placed her hand on Kathy’s ‘baby bump’ and then looked knowingly into her eyes.

Kathy was astonished at Ah Meng’s intelligence, and by the emotional connection she demonstrated. After that, Kathy spent more time at the zoo observing Ah Meng’s relationship with visitors, with her keeper, Alagappasamy Chellaiyah, and with all the other orangutans within the zoo’s enclosure. With Peter’s orangutan photographs for reference, we created a children's picture book, which was supported by the Zoo, funded by HSBC, and all proceeds from the sale of the book being donated to the orangutan conservation work at the Singapore Zoological Gardens.

We would like to continue in our efforts to inform children about the alarming loss of orangutan habitat and the illegal pet market in baby orangutans, whilst at the same time raising much needed funds to support the significant conservation work of Orangutan Outreach. (Orangutan Outreach is a registered 501(c)(3) US charity. EIN: 26-0521285)

We have a story we would like to produce as a children's picture book, and it is one which highlights the alarming plight of orangutans today. Our story also introduces an unlikely relationship between a sumatran tiger and an orangutan, both desperate to survive the destruction of their rainforest home.

We believe that such a book will help children and their parents fully grasp the potential nightmarish future faced by endangered wildlife, and that there is still hope for their future if we make a stand. 

We will donate 100% of all net proceeds of this book to Orangutan Outreach (https://redapes.org/) in the USA, who are undertaking remarkable work in the fight to protect these gentle primates and their rainforest habitat.

We need Aus $15,000 to fund the entire printing of a high quality, hardback, full colour illustrated children's picture book. Should there be insufficient funding from this crowd funding initiative, we will seek other financial avenues to support this important project.

We will personally donate our time and resources to write, professionally edit, illustrate and design the book.

The book itself will sell for Aus $25.00 and will be available via Exisle Publishing (https://exislepublishing.com/) in Australia, New Zealand, USA, UK and online worldwide through Little Pink Dog Books (www.littlepinkdogbooks.com).

All net proceeds will be donated to Orangutan Outreach. 

The Impact

Current generations have had to watch helplessly as vast swathes of rich, fertile rainforest in south east Asia has been slashed, burned and turned over to the production of palm oil. This has been ruthless and made without conscience of the dramatic impact it has had on all wildlife, and in particular to orangutans and their habitat. There are about 13,400 Sumatran orangutans and less than 800 Tapanuli orangutans remaining in the wild. All three orangutan species are listed as Critically Endangered by the International Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN) in their Red List of Threatened Species.

It is therefore vital that up and coming generations realise this negative impact on the survival of these beautiful primates, and that they work to secure a viable future for orangutans and all wildlife. 

Our previously mentioned children’s picture book was ‘My Cousin, Ah Meng’. We were delighted that it sold in excess of 30,000 copies, and was extremely well received by children and their parents.

There is no doubt that a project such as this will make a helpful contribution in the fight for the protection of these gentle, intelligent and amazing primates, who really are just like us in so many ways.

Risks & Challenges

This project is already at an advanced stage of development, and in the next four months it will be ready for printing.

Prior to committing to print, we will be promoting the picture book to major book buyers and libraries here in Australia. With increasing numbers of books ordered, the unit costs will reduce considerably, and such savings will be ploughed into producing more copies. 

Any surplus campaign funding left at the end of production will be donated directly to Orangutan Outreach.

story:
Short Summary

The Whisperers of the Gods is a historical fantasy series set in the Bronze Age. It’s influenced by mythology and ancient cultures. It is set when the Bronze Age is waning. The great kingdoms are beginning to buckle under the weight of civil wars, hedonism, and corruption. Only the Gogepe, the Whisperers of the Gods, see the warnings.

In Orope - The White Snake, the Gogepe send out three messengers to the three great kingdoms. They must convince their rulers to honour the old ways, or be destroyed by a great flood.

Pekari – The Azure Fish begins where Orope ends. Some of the messengers are closer to finishing their mission than others, but around them the world grows more dangerous.

Orope was a runner-up at the 2018 London Book Festival, and Book of the Day (9/15/18) on OnlineBookClub.Org. Read chapter one of Orope here.

Watch the video to see:

  • What inspired me to write the Whisperers of the Gods. (0:00)
  • A summary of the story so far (no spoilers). (1:20)
  • An excerpt read by me from chapter one of Pekari. (3:40)

The Team

Like any great project, I couldn’t have published either novel without a lot of help. I wanted to introduce some of the people who helped me, and share their thoughts about me and Orope.

Lara Helmling, Editor

"As Guenevere's editor, I have had the remarkable honor of seeing her works come to life on the printed page. I can tell you, as an acquisitions editor I am one of the toughest critics of incoming manuscripts. I can tell you that I recommend Guenevere's books to anyone who loves literature. 

Guenevere Lee's books, Orope, The White Snake and Pekari, The Azure Fish, are two of the most fascinating and unique works of literature I've encountered. The setting in the Bronze Age comes alive through the eyes of four intriguing characters and their do-or-die mission to save their world. With nature, rulers, and entire communities working against them, their task is not for the faint-hearted, and the reader must wonder if their heroes will ever make it out alive - much less save their world. 

Her newest book, Pekari, The Azure Fish, is a thoroughly enjoyable read that is exciting and simultaneously soothes the soul on those nights when nothing sounds better than a book and a quiet cup of tea. It is on my list of must-haves for my personal library, and I would highly recommend it for you as well. "

Lara is dedicated to help authors be successful in the publishing world, check out the Bestselling Author Studio, which she runs! You can also find her on Facebook.

Sheharzad Arshad, Map Illustrator

“Getting to work on the maps for Orope, The White Snake and Pekari, The Azure Fish, was an amazing experience for me because the amount of detail and effort that Guenevere Lee has put into creating the world for her characters made me feel like that these were real places that I could visit. 

Having the maps alongside while following the journey of the different characters made the story very immersive and much more fun to read. It makes me want to learn more about the characters and their world. You will have a lot of fun diving into this world as you read these amazing novels.”

Sherharzad doesn't just do maps, he's an incredibly funny and talented artist. Please take a look at his Art Gallery and Instagram!

Darla Middlebrook, Audiobook Narrator and Producer

"I really enjoyed working on Guenevere Lee’s novel OROPE because I love ancient history.  This type of writing gives me a grand excuse to research history and linguistics.  That research is something that I enjoy because it keeps the brain cells firing.  (Stamp out those Alzheimer’s symptoms!!)  While I worked on the narration for Ms. Lee’s novel, I researched some of the information that archaeologists and historians have speculated about regarding the Bronze Age. Speculated, I say, because it is a lot of guess work on their part, so the stories in OROPE could have happened.  OROPE put the reader/listener there!  The use of story lines which reflected (possible) Mayan/Aztec, Egyptian, Celtic (?) cultures was fascinating and really required that I use different types of approaches to each of the voices needed for the narration.  The author – Guenevere Lee – wrote characters for OROPE who were believable and passionate.  I look forward to the next instalment of the characters’ stories and hope that I can be the voice for it."

Please check out some of Darla's amazing voice work on her website, or Facebook page (and here too!).

What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise $5,300. Because publishing today is such a ridiculously competitive market, publishers can't afford to send out hundreds of author copies. I use author copies for events, giveaways, and conventions.

For events:

  • Last year I went to over 20 bookstores around southern Ontario, meeting readers and promoting Orope.
  • This year I hope to visit stores in other provinces, and even the US. Travel and hotel costs are high, so the more author copies I have the more events I can hold.

For giveaways:

  • I’ve held multiple giveaways with Amazon, Goodreads, and the Online Book Club. I’ve given hundreds of free copies away to lucky readers. This is crucial in marketing a book from a fairly unknown author.
  • I intend to give away twice as many copies (because I have twice as many books published now, lol). A lot of these giveaways require me to mail out the copies, the funds raised from this campaign will cut that cost by half because I won’t need to purchase extra copies.

For conventions:

  • This is the big one! I’ve attended three conventions now, and had more success at each one. It’s the best way to get the word out about my series.
  • I plan to attend an average of one convention a month this year, and having copies provided by this campaign will allow me to achieve this goal.

The Impact

Fantasies set in the Bronze Age are a rare breed. And I strongly believe that this series can be so beneficial to students of history. In Orope and Pekari history comes alive and give us appreciation of our rich human history - both for anthropologists and historians. 

This campaign will help me take my series to the next level. Last year was a heck of a learning experience for me. Even with the help of my publishers, I made mistake after mistake. But as with any trial by fire, my experiences have helped me understand how to market my book.

This campaign is to help with the financial burden of marketing an indie novel. The success of this campaign will not only help me market my book properly, it will give me the chance to:

  • Hold book signings across Canada, and possibly in the US.
  • Create new merchandise for conventions.
  • Produce the audiobook.

Risks & Challenges

There aren’t any! Whether this campaign is successful or not, Pekari – The Azure Fish will be published. The manuscript has already been accepted by Morgan James Fiction. They will be doing the editing, design, layout, and distribution.

I promise that:

  • Pekari – The Azure Fish will be published.
  • All perks purchased through the campaign will be honoured and delivered.

Other Ways You Can Help

Have you fallen in love with the Whisperers of the Gods, but just don’t have the funds to contribute? No worries, you can still:

  • Tell you friends and family! Gets them as excited as you are. Word of mouth is crucial at this stage. And who knows, if they like it enough maybe they’ll get an extra copy for you!
  • Share this page on social medial using the Indiegogo share tools! Let the world know about this little historical fantasy novel.

Thank you to everyone who took the time to check out this campaign. Happy reading!

story:
What is #EXTRAOrdinary All About?

Our book was born just a little over year ago with a frustrated rant about hormones and a hopeful discussion about which essential oils might help us navigate our way through “The Change.”

What do we mean by "The Change?" The dreaded "personal summers.” A tiredness that comes from the very marrow of our bones. People looking right through us (or worse, talking about us) as if we aren’t sitting.right.there.in.front.of.them. The knowledge that we are no longer part of the younger generation so revered by the media and society in general. Sitting on the edge of the bed for a few extra minutes in the morning because everything hurts. Losing pieces of ourselves but not having time to find them because we have to take care of everyone else first. Yep—we're talking about aging, the troll that shoves our girlhoods aside like a bully taking cuts in the lunch line _on turkey gravy day_.

Our "we're mad as h*ll and aren't going to take it anymore" rant evolved into an exciting mission to write a book that would help Women in the Middle, like us, navigate the waves that come with this stage of life. What we realized is that while we’re all ordinary—meaning, we all have these collective, universal experiences—we are also all #EXTRA. This book is a tool for us all to reclaim our #EXTRA, remember who we are, and shout it out to the world.

 

Who Are We?

We are Lisa and Carleen—BFFs who share a brain and totally GET you. (Oh, sister, we TOTALLY get you…)

Our debut book is one part stories, one part self-help, and one part personal journal, all made with the collective journey of Women in the Middle in mind. The central structure of the text is based on a metaphor for life from Carleen's older brother, Cedric, who passed away when she was fifteen: Life is like water skiing, and there are four rules to keep in mind:

1. Don’t panic.

2. If you fall, fall gracefully.

3. When you fall, let go of the rope.

4. Get up and try again.

Each section starts with a letter to our readers, followed by stories from each of us, a series of helpful strategies to try, and space for readers to add to the collective Women in the Middle narrative. While it has a spirited tone, it also addresses serious topics such as loss, anxiety, and relationships. #EXTRAOrdinary is honest and authentic at its core, and its mission is remind women that they are loved and they matter—just the way they are.

With the help of a fantastic, local, women-owned publishing company, we have been fortunate to be able to organize, develop, and write the entire manuscript with very little coaching, design the cover, and co-create the interior aesthetic. We have a thriving social media presence and plans for several more projects—#EXTRAOrdinary is just the beginning!

The book is beautifully done in full color, featuring many personal photos, a Midcentury aesthetic (a loving tribute to our spunky mothers, aunts, grandmas, and neighbor ladies, all of whom were/are also both ORDINARY and #EXTRA), and WHOLE LOT of pixie dust.

 

So . . . What Are People Saying About #EXTRAOrdinary?

"MN Nice" makes it hard to toot your own horn (and ask for moola!), but here are a couple of nice reviews we've gotten:

"In an Insta World that sometimes makes us feel like there aren't enough filters in the day, Lisa and Carleen remind us that we aren't alone. Using a brilliant waterskiing analogy passed down from Carleen's big brother Cedric, these ladies remind us that we can fall gracefully, that sometimes we need to let go, and that always, at the end of the day, it's possible to grab that rope and give 'er another go. Weaving their life stories with doable steps to try when life hands you a face-full of lake water, Lisa and Carleen encourage finding your own voice, telling your own story (even if it's just quietly in your mind), and driving the boat full speed ahead into your own #EXTRAOrdinary!"

—Michelle Shaffner


"Through a series of deeply personal essays, Carleen and Lisa share their stories of mistakes and failures, loss, and deep pain, and how through perseverance, therapy, and the support of family and friends they are finding their way to healing, self-love, and joy.

Through writing prompts and self-care strategies, they invite us to share our stories and follow our intuition into practices that will gently guide us towards wholeness and help us find that special spark, that passion, that something #EXTRA, that's in all of us. Though it's written specifically for Waterskiing Women of a Certain Season, #EXTRAOrdinary is full of wisdom and encouragement for people of all genders and ages."

—Amy Larson

(Thank you, Loves. <3)

 

Perks 

Ok, now let us be perfectly clear: We are not just asking you to donate to the publishing costs of our book. We've got perks for you, because OF COURSE we do!

One of our Perks is a signed copy of the book (because OBviously, you need one).

Guess what? We also have FRIENDSHIP PINS! You remember those, right? YAAAASSSSS. We GenXers wore them all over our rad tennis shoes when we were young teens in the early ‘80s. Each pin was unique to the person who made it, and they became symbols of friendship and inclusiveness. Pins can be put on lanyards, backpacks, shoelaces—wherever!

Both of us felt strongly that it was time to bring these pins back as we all need friendship, inclusiveness, and sisterhood now more than ever. We need to come together more than ever, and we need to feel part of a team more than ever. We want to get pins in the hands of as many people as we can to remind them that they are loved, just as they are!

Finally, at the top end of the Perks is a bit o'bling to make your world more beautiful. The two of us create beautiful, unique "necklaces" that are designed NOT FOR PEOPLE but for mason jars, salt lamps, essential oil diffusers, or even figurines! 

To make our #EXTRAOrdinary pieces, we hand-select a variety of beads and charms, including up-cycled vintage beads, lava beads, semi-precious stones, and a variety of glass, metal, and wooden beads. Some are more simple, and some are ornate. Some are bright and boisterous, and some are more natural and subdued. Every piece is one-of-a-kind. Like them, every one of our sisters is unique and beautiful, just as she is. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us out!

  • We would be honored and forever grateful if you helped us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share, share, share!!!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU SO SO SOOOOOO MUCH!!!!!!!!

BFFs,

Lisa and Carleen <3

 

Pssst! Want some samples? Here you go!

We are Lisa and Carleen—BFFs who share a brain and totally GET you. (Oh, sister, we TOTALLY get you…)
Our debut book is one part stories, one part self-help, and one part personal journal, all made with the collective journey of Women in the Middle in mind. The central structure of the text is based on a metaphor for life from Carleen's older brother, Cedric, who passed away when she was fifteen: Life is like water skiing, and there are four rules to keep in mind:
1. Don’t panic.
2. If you fall, fall gracefully.
3. When you fall, let go of the rope.
4. Get up and try again.
Each section starts with a letter to our readers, followed by stories from each of us, a series of helpful strategies to try, and space for readers to add to the collective Women in the Middle narrative. While it has a spirited tone, it also addresses serious topics such as loss, anxiety, and relationships. #EXTRAOrdinary is honest and authentic at its core, and its mission is remind women that they are loved and they matter—just the way they are.
With the help of a fantastic, local, women-owned publishing company, we have been fortunate to be able to organize, develop, and write the entire manuscript with very little coaching, design the cover, and co-create the interior aesthetic. We have a thriving social media presence and plans for several more projects—#EXTRAOrdinary is just the beginning!
The book is beautifully done in full color, featuring many personal photos, a Midcentury aesthetic (a loving tribute to our spunky mothers, aunts, grandmas, and neighbor ladies, all of whom were/are also both ORDINARY and #EXTRA), and WHOLE LOT of pixie dust.
 
So . . . What Are People Saying About #EXTRAOrdinary?
"MN Nice" makes it hard to toot your own horn (and ask for moola!), but here are a couple of nice reviews we've gotten:
"In an Insta World that sometimes makes us feel like there aren't enough filters in the day, Lisa and Carleen remind us that we aren't alone. Using a brilliant waterskiing analogy passed down from Carleen's big brother Cedric, these ladies remind us that we can fall gracefully, that sometimes we need to let go, and that always, at the end of the day, it's possible to grab that rope and give 'er another go. Weaving their life stories with doable steps to try when life hands you a face-full of lake water, Lisa and Carleen encourage finding your own voice, telling your own story (even if it's just quietly in your mind), and driving the boat full speed ahead into your own #EXTRAOrdinary!"
—Michelle Shaffner
"Through a series of deeply personal essays, Carleen and Lisa share their stories of mistakes and failures, loss, and deep pain, and how through perseverance, therapy, and the support of family and friends they are finding their way to healing, self-love, and joy.
Through writing prompts and self-care strategies, they invite us to share our stories and follow our intuition into practices that will gently guide us towards wholeness and help us find that special spark, that passion, that something #EXTRA, that's in all of us. Though it's written specifically for Waterskiing Women of a Certain Season, #EXTRAOrdinary is full of wisdom and encouragement for people of all genders and ages."
—Amy Larson
(Thank you, Loves. <3)
 
Perks 
Ok, now let us be perfectly clear: We are not just asking you to donate to the publishing costs of our book. We've got perks for you, because OF COURSE we do!
One of our Perks is a signed copy of the book (because OBviously, you need one).
Guess what? We also have FRIENDSHIP PINS! You remember those, right? YAAAASSSSS. We GenXers wore them all over our rad tennis shoes when we were young teens in the early ‘80s. Each pin was unique to the person who made it, and they became symbols of friendship and inclusiveness. Pins can be put on lanyards, backpacks, shoelaces—wherever!
Both of us felt strongly that it was time to bring these pins back as we all need friendship, inclusiveness, and sisterhood now more than ever. We need to come together more than ever, and we need to feel part of a team more than ever. We want to get pins in the hands of as many people as we can to remind them that they are loved, just as they are!
Finally, at the top end of the Perks is a bit o'bling to make your world more beautiful. The two of us create beautiful, unique "necklaces" that are designed NOT FOR PEOPLE but for mason jars, salt lamps, essential oil diffusers, or even figurines! 
To make our #EXTRAOrdinary pieces, we hand-select a variety of beads and charms, including up-cycled vintage beads, lava beads, semi-precious stones, and a variety of glass, metal, and wooden beads. Some are more simple, and some are ornate. Some are bright and boisterous, and some are more natural and subdued. Every piece is one-of-a-kind. Like them, every one of our sisters is unique and beautiful, just as she is. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us out!

We would be honored and forever grateful if you helped us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share, share, share!!!
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU SO SO SOOOOOO MUCH!!!!!!!!BFFs,Lisa and Carleen <3 Pssst! Want some samples? Here you go!

story:
This Campaign is to bring Ajji and Mili Children's Book  to reality:

What Is this Campaign all about :

A connection to Nature is very important and the best way to have environmentally aware adults is to have children who are connected to nature. I have written and illustrated this book Ajji and Mili - Into The Forest as a way of introducing children to nature through stories and a bit of magic.

I also realised that there were not many children's books set in my native Karnataka in India, so want to bring in the local culture and relatable characters through this book.

If Fully funded I will be Donating 200 Books to School Libraries.

https://ajjiandmili.home.blog/

 

A Little About Me:

I am an artist, illustrator and writer. I have a degree in art history and fell in love with watercolours a long time ago when I first saw Beatrix Potter's books. I grew up reading Alexander Afanasyev's fairy tales and folk tales illustrated by Ivan Bilibin.

The love for illustrations started then and has never faded and has led me to believe that illustrated Children's books can help develop a child's imagination, cognition, memory and more.

The reason I started writing Ajji and Mili was because I grew up listening to my Grandmothers stories, one story led to another and another. Ajji means Grandmother in my Mother tongue Kannada.

I always loved nature but got more involved with environmental issues about 5 years ago and came to realize that the best way to conserve nature is to have the next generation be more aware and prone to conservation. For this to happen children need to be made aware. This book tries to do that with stories and with adventure, with magic and fun. This way children can find it entertaining and engaging as well as find a way of connecting to nature through stories and images.

I have been working with children taking art workshops for a few years now and have also taken many art workshops that help children connect with nature.

 

About the book : Ajji and Mili - Into the Forest

Ajji and Mili into the forest is the story of the adventures of Ajji and her granddaughter Mili who have to cross the Forest, where they meet Tako a funny , quirky fox as they walk through the forest, follow the river, climb up the mountain, meet a world traveling seed collecting Beaver and come across so many different plants and animals, trees and birds.

I decided on self publishing for many reasons, I wanted to be the one to write it and also illustrate it. Having had experience in writing for over a decade and illustrating and design experience for half a decade I am quite confident on putting the best foot forward.

  • The amount needed to bring this to life is 11,000 USD. This will help in the editing, proof reading and printing of the book. It will also aid in the creation of the colouring book and activity books that are to follow. It will aid in packing and shipping all the books and keeping an inventory.
  • There are loads of perks to choose from -Archival quality Art Prints of my original Watercolour illustrations, Stickers , Badges and Bookmarks with watercolour illustrations, Colouring book, Slipcase Gift Edition with Autographed books with spot laminated hardback covers and Limited Edition Gift Sets with some awesome goodies.

 

 

Meet the Characters

 

Design Layout Of The Book

Perks

 

 

 

.

    Where your money will go

    The most of the funds 70% will go into the printing of the books with high quality papers inside and spot laminated hardbacks for the special edition. 10% will go into packing and shipping costs.

    The rest of the fund will be distributed between the Indiegogo fees, proof reading and editing costs, production of Gift Sets Colouring book, activity book , stickers , bookmarks and badges.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    The most important hurdle to cross will be to get everything printed on time and packed and shipped to people.

    • If there are any issues with the book or any of the perks you receive please feel free to notify me immediately and I will do everything I can to replace the damaged product immediately.
    • I am available on my websites and many social media platforms if you would like to discuss anything please feel free to contact me https://parinithakonanur.wordpress.com/ https://ajjiandmili.home.blog/ https://www.instagram.com/ajjiandmili/  https://www.instagram.com/parinithakonanur/    https://www.facebook.com/pg/ajjiandmili/

    If you cant contribute please help spread the word

    If you cant contribute right away but liked my work please subscribe to my website and help spread the word.

    • Share on Facebook , instagram and do tweet about Ajji and Mili
    • Do use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank You

    For all the love and support

If you cant contribute please help spread the word
If you cant contribute right away but liked my work please subscribe to my website and help spread the word.

Share on Facebook , instagram and do tweet about Ajji and Mili
