story:
Short Summary

For over 10 years, Mocha Memoirs Press's mission has been to amplify marginalized voices in speculative fiction. Our stories are bold, fearless fiction. Stories traditionally kept in the margins are unleashed in this groundbreaking anthology.

Our next project, SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire, will continue our mission by producing an anthology of stories about vampires and hunters from the African diaspora.

These well-written stories that are diverse of the vampire mythos as well as introduce these tales to horror lovers, avid readers, and audiences hungry (no pun intended) for well-written and diverse stories.

Your support of this campaign allows Mocha Memoirs to not only publish these stories, ensures all of our authors are paid at a professional rate, the offered artwork is top notch, and a quality product is the result.  

With you, we can make it happen.

This anthology will be edited by Nicole Givens Kurtz. Nicole has over 20 years experience as a published author, over 40 short story publications and a series of novels in science fiction, fantasy, and horror genres. She's an award winning author and publisher.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $5500 USD with stretch goals beyond the initial request. Here's how those funds will be spent.

SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire will provide a groundbreaking collection of vampire stories from the African diaspora.  This is a unique collection and will become a must-have for vampire lovers all over the world. We already have award-winning anchor authors whose stories will appear in SLAY

  • Sheree Renee Thomas
  • Craig L. Gidney
  • Teri Clark
  • Jessica Cage
  • Michele Tracy Berger
  • Steven Van Patten

The Perks!

$1-Blood Donation-Help bring us to life with your $1 Blood donation tip jar.

$5 SLAYERS - Listed in the front of the anthology as those who helped us SLAY by contributing to our Indiegogo campaign.

$10 HUNTERS- Early backers will be listed along the SLAYERS and receive an e-book of SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire.

$15-BLOOD DRINKERS (10) - Viridian Tea Company has crafted a special tea blend (Vampire Noire Tea Blend) that SLAYS! Grab this along with an e-book version of SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire. Blood Drinkers are also listed in our Thank You roster in the anthology.

$25 STAKERS- Physical copy of SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire,, an e-book copy, and original print art by a local North Carolina artist.

$30 RAW DOG WERES (3)-Get a physical copy of SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire, one copy each of the following Raw Dog Press titles: a. Steel Victory by J.L. Gribble, b. The Blood Poetry by Leland Pitts-Gonzalez, and c. Fridge of the Damn magnet poetry.

$50 IN THE BLOODSTREAM BUNDLE (4)-Beef up your horror collection- Get a physical copy of SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire, and 4 horror anthologies from Mocha Memoirs Press (The Grotesquerie, Mocha’s Dark Brew, Black Magic Women and In the Bloodstream). 

$100 THE COFFIN (10)-You get a customized obituary that will be published in the anthology between stories. Get a physical copy of SLAY: Stories of the Vampire Noire.

Risks & Challenges

The challenges to the success of project are 1. ensuring we generate enough funding to pay the HWA professional rate to authors.

One of the ways we plan to overcome these challenges are as follows:

  • The official call for submissions ends 6 months prior to the anthology's release during October, Black Speculative Fiction Month. This will provide enough lead time to generate additional funds if the Indiegogo does not meet its goal.
  • The six month lead time also provides ample time to place advertisements, secure early reviews and generate online and offline buzz about the anthology's release.
  • Mocha Memoirs Press has an established team to assist with securing the resources required to publish the anthology. We've had other successful anthology releases.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us reach our goal and make this project a success by:

  • Spread the word!  Post about us in your newsletter, Tweet about us, Post about us and Share our posts about this project. Post our image on Instagram. Help us SLAY!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help you too!
  • Sign up for the Mocha Memoirs Newsletter and get a free ebook each month (https://mochamemoirspress.com/newsletter)
  • Follow us on Twitter and retweet at @mochamemoirs
  • Like our page on Facebook and share our posts! https://www.facebook.com/MochaMemoirsPress/

Thank you!

Spread the word!  Post about us in your newsletter, Tweet about us, Post about us and Share our posts about this project. Post our image on Instagram. Help us SLAY!

Sign up for the Mocha Memoirs Newsletter and get a free ebook each month (https://mochamemoirspress.com/newsletter)
Follow us on Twitter and retweet at @mochamemoirs

story:
When I was twenty, my idea of  identity and reality was turned upside down. But this book is not about me. It is about the world we construct through our beliefs.

Read a quick synopsis of the novel

I met a Himalayan sage on a high meadow in a remote Himalayan valley. For a month i remained with him. Barely speaking, he dissolved my concepts. Against my instinct, I left. Nothing of what followed would have happened without meeting him.

Not knowing his name, it took me thirty-two years to understand what he was and through that, finding him again. The quest he initiated in me, took me through the worlds outside and inside me. I became a student of philosophy, religion, and culture; a painter, a journalist, a writer, a designer, and an alternative medicine practitioner. I lived in Egypt, India, and Denmark and travelled the world.

Finally, I returned to the Himalayas to study consciousness with another Himalayan master. This is where I wrote this novel which, at its heart, is a fictional story about the ever changing world and the human search for peace and understanding. Writing this book took me back to the beginning of the story. The source.

Want to know about V.J. Sam?

 

Why is this campaign and its goal important to me and the world?

I wanted to write this book to inspire a discussion of what we think are up to. Who are we and what are we doing?

This epic story has been on my mind for a very long time, yet in its present form it came to me suddenly over breakfast by the local river.

After that followed several years of my total reclusive  absorption in this manuscript.

Now it would make me tremendously happy to be able to make this book available for the public, and for that I ask for your contribution and support. This campaign, which will run on Indiegogo, Facebook, and Instagram, has as its goal to raise funds for a professional edit, proofreading, formatting as e-book and print ready PDF, as well as publishing on platforms like Amazon.

Read  an excerpt of the book 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

My budget covers:

  • Editing
  • Proof-reading
  • Formatting as e-book
  • Print ready PDF
  • Design
  • Publishing as an e-book
  • Listings on e-book platforms like Amazon.
  • Total cost app: 5000 US$/ 4450 Euro/ 33000 danish kroner

    What in it for you? Well first of all the joy of bringing a book  with true depth to life. Also have a look at the many different perks for donating: You can get listed as backer in the book, have a part of the manuscript with notes, get a front cover print, get the book or even have dinner with the author!

    What if I don’t reach my goal?  Then I will go ahead with the project in a slower pace, and probably make one more campaign later.

    What if I get more than my goal? No problem :-) I'll use it for printing paper copies and PR.

    The Impact

    In supporting the publication, you support the message of unity and a story that shows our common humanness and the possibility for understanding. A message that I believe is needed in a world obsessed with borders, walls, and separation. Your support will be for something much larger than the budget is able explain and it might give me the chance to write the books I have in mind.

    Risks & Challenges

    I have been published in many forms before, but this is my debut novel.
    As I self publish in e-format and have a good team to help me, the risks are minimal. Since the book is finished, and the English and Danish manuscripts has been read, basic edited and praised by a handful of discerning readers it is very close to completion.. There is a small risk of a delay though, if less that sufficient funds are raised. If this happens, I will launch a second campaign on a different platform. The goal after self-publishing is to find a publisher in both languages.

    What else can I do to help?

    • You can easily spread the word about this campaign by using Indiegogo sharing tool.
    • You can share links to my WordPress blog( V.J Sam), my Facebook page( V.J.Sam Writer) and Instagram account (viktor_v.j.sam).

story:
PREFACE by Paul Lanner

Haunters Against Hate was formed in response to the most unpleasant of circumstances, including the Orlando Pulse killings and some extremely negative speech made by a haunt review team. Travis Boling of 7th Street Haunt (now American Horrorplex) in Louisville, Kentucky, took a stand and refused entry to the reviewers, demanding his haunt be removed from their website. That started a chain reaction that resulted in over 20 haunts endorsing an open letter, posted on Facebook, to the reviewers saying that hate is unacceptable and that they were not welcome at any of the venues.

I came on board with the group after being asked to design the logo, come up with a name and create a catchy tagline for the Facebook post. But as I thought about it, I realized I wanted Haunters Against Hate to be more than just a letter: I wanted it to be a movement within the haunt industry. So I set out to create a website and design T-shirts, bumper stickers, and pins to raise funds for LGBTQ organizations across the U.S. I figured, “Let’s turn something born out of such negativity into something positive.” Being a gay man, I felt personally affected, and I couldn’t let it go. I know there are a lot of LGBTQ actors in the haunt industry, and they needed a voice as well. But one thing that defines the haunt industry is acceptance. Haunters are like a big extended family who look out for each other and are there in times of need.

Taking a chance, I bought a booth at the TransWorld haunt convention to see if the support would be there. I reached out to artists, who donated pieces for an art raffle, had my T-shirts and bumper stickers, and hoped for the best. I was nervous and unsure but had to try. If it was a bust, it would be a lesson learned. To my surprise, it turned out to be a successful venture, with so many people coming by to pick up a T-shirt and offer kind words of support. But it was the last day of the convention that confirmed what I was doing was worth it.

It was Sunday morning around 10:30 a.m., and the convention floor was empty. I was sitting reading when a woman in a wheelchair came by the booth, looked and continued on. A few minutes later, she came back and looked again and just put her head down, appearing very upset. I asked her if she needed anything, and she said that her good friend, a young man of 19, had been following Haunters Against Hate since its inception and was so thrilled that something like that existed. He talked about it constantly. She proceeded to tell me that about a month prior, he was driving home and fell asleep at the wheel (from exhaustion), crashed and was killed. She was here at the booth to buy a shirt for herself and for the young man’s mother so that they could proudly wear them in his honor since he loved HAH so much.

We both had a good cry, I gave her the shirts, and she left. But it is something that I have never forgotten and never will. Even if the show had been a bust, that one moment would have been worth everything.

And that is why I need to create this book. By helping fund this, you will allow the proceeds of sales to go to LGBTQ groups (focusing on youth) as opposed to being eaten up by the cost of producing and publishing such a book.

story:
The Long-Awaited One

This 30 day devotional and Bible reading plan grew from a reading plan I developed for my children during the Advent season.  As a homeschool mom, I decided to create a list of scriptures to bring deeper meaning to our Christmas celebration.  So, I chose scriptures that prophesied the coming of the Messiah throughout the Old Testament and culminated in the reading of the Christmas story together as a family during the week of Christmas.

We loved the study!  Each day, the kids would open their Advent calendar and they would get some candy and a Bible reading for the day.  It truly did add deeper meaning to the season.  After a few years of using the plan, I began to share the reading plan with other families.  Everyone really enjoyed it.  So now I've taken the plan, reorganized it, and written daily devotionals to add to the experience.  We've also been working on some Christmas music to go along with the study.

We need your help

By getting behind this campaign, you will help us cover the many costs involved in publishing a book and recording the Christmas music.  Everyone who helps us out will get a copy of the book and the Christmas music.  Our prayer is that the study will truly bring deeper meaning and beauty to your Christmas.

Christmas - the coming of the Messiah

This study chronicles the prophecies of the Messiah and demonstrates how Jesus fulfilled these prophecies. The music highlights themes pulled from these scriptures and also includes some traditional Christmas favorites.

This will be my sixth studio music project and my first book.  The process has been a lot of fun and a great challenge as I put the study into a book format. I've thoroughly enjoyed researching and writing and I can't wait to get back in the studio.  We plan to work with Bobby Gentilo at Right Coast Recording Studio in Columbia, PA.  Bobby has done a fabulous job on my last two recording projects and it's always a pleasure to work with him.

We truly believe this study will be an encouragement to you and your family.  Thank you for reading, listening, and supporting us.  And if you can't support us financially right now, please pray for us throughout the process of editing, formatting and creating the resource tools, and as we head to the studio.  

And don't forget to share this campaign with family and friends that would find this resource useful.  Thank you!

story:
To the readers of the On Lyme blog*

This campaign is meant to fund the creation and publication of a new e-book called ‘A Matter of Dignity’. The main theme of this book is the tension between choices made in the governance of modern healthcare and our most fundamental human right: the right to dignity. Both ME and Lyme disease are used as cases to learn from. 

In the text below you can read more about the book, its aim, audiences and how to get it.

Takeaways

  • A practical-ethical angle on moral issues around disputed diseases such as Lyme disease and ME
  • Get the 200 page e-book with existing and new interviews (see the names in the FAQ section)
  • Containing eye-opening medical and historical information about Lyme and ME, provided by credible experts
  • Aimed to address broader concerns about the quality of global healthcare and its social implications

Aim

My aim is to publish the most important On Lyme interviews as a book. They have been read online by 500,000 people across the globe. The selected interviews will be framed within a narrative leading the reader to practical-ethical questions. By showing why these caretakers, doctors, scientists and legal professionals were interviewed over time, it enables the reader to discover the almost unimaginable social consequences of choices made in global healthcare.

New interviews with professionals taking a stand for the human rights of people with an ME diagnosis will be included in the book. From an ethical and social point of view, both Lyme and ME patient groups suffer the same fate. 

It’s been an honour to have worked with these medical, scientific and legal professionals in this arena for the past decade. I deeply believe they deserve a wider stage on which they can be heard. They are the giants on whose shoulders others should stand on, working towards real solutions and proper governance with ethics and human rights at its core. 

A book is a fitting way to do that. A book has more impact than online articles as it connects the different dots of a complex topic, making the whole more than the sum of its parts. A book can also be referenced by scholars, scientists and journalists. ‘A Matter of Dignity’ will include working links to hundreds of scientific PubMed articles.

Essence

‘A Matter of Dignity’ essentially documents unsettling questions asked by these experts. Is there a tendency to change definitions of diseases? To hide the actual numbers affected? To create international medical guidelines based on ‘evidence-biased’ science? To use inadequate diagnostic tests, while blocking the development of better ones? Is there an increasing tendency to profit from diseases while appointing blame onto those affected? The book shows clear examples of how this has led to devastating social, legal and financial consequences situation for countless people in many countries across the globe.  

In short, 'A Matter of Dignity' tells a story about indignity that will lead to indignation. The book will make the readers question the reliability of statistics, guidelines, priorities and public health information. It will also lead to urgent questions about governance and international treaties. What is the Helsinki Treaty on 'informed consent' worth without complete information? How can doctors now uphold their Hippocratic oath and their promise to first do no harm?

Audiences

If you are a patient with disputed diagnoses like ME or chronic Lyme disease - or a professional treating them - you will recognise the sheer unbelievable dynamics all too well from your own experience. The book will provide you with understandable information, told by credible and brave health professionals, to help you to better understand the situation you are in. Specifically to the who have already read the On Lyme interviews and know what explosive information they contain, this will be valuable to own.

The book may also be eye-opening to those who are actively working to create solutions for other patient groups such as Parkinson, Alzheimer, ALS / MND, Fibromyalgia or MS. The book will show that the current methods used to diagnose these groups are lacking in fundamental information. There are underlying, difficult-to-detect infections implicated in these neurological diseases, but a belief in, and reliance on, flawed testing for infections, embedded in medical practice and education, has led to a false belief that the origin of the diseases is non-microbial. Appropriate treatment is therefore not initiated.

The book is however primarily meant to open the eyes of those working in the healthcare system or those who operate at a policy level of all interconnecting systems: medicine, science, laboratories, psychiatry, psychology, insurances, child protection services and other government entities. The leading ethical questions and information provided by credible professionals may open the eyes of many people, who are in a position to change the narrative and choices made in global healthcare.*

Context

The On Lyme interviews with both patients and caretakers as well as with renowned doctors, psychiatrists, scientists and lawyers from different countries have been available as online articles for years. They have attracted the attention of Amnesty, Human Rights Watch and Children's Health Defense. 

The interviews are referenced in scientific articles and were also used as input for two reports to the World Health Organisation and the United Nations. The reports addressed the worldwide human rights violations of Lyme disease patients, parents, doctors and scientists. 

After my 2018 meeting with the second Special Rapporteur to the United Nations, the On Lyme Foundation ceased to exist as a non-profit entity due to lack of funding. Soon the interviews will no longer be available online, as the On Lyme website will be taken down. 

Request

My request to you is to help to create this book. To join in to preserve this historical information and to spread awareness for the future. 

In times of increasing public scrutiny on how our health system is operating and who benefits from it, awareness is key to opening the eyes of many. 

You can do so by pre-ordering ‘A Matter of Dignity’. In the ‘perks’ section on this page you can find different options to do so. 

Funding goal

When this campaign has reached its funding goal, I will be able to commit my time to create this book as a priority. If the campaign is successful, copies will be send to newspapers, government institutions and medical universities. 

If the goal is not fully met, I still intend to produce the book, although at a slower pace as I will need to focus on other sources of income.

If you want to see the names of those included in the book or other frequently given answers, you can visit the FAQ section.

Thank you for your support!

 

Huib Kraaijeveld, MA, social researcher and author of ‘Shifting the Lyme Paradigm’

* When this campaign has gained momentum, the text will be changed to interest a broader audience.

story:
The Outer Dark Symposium on the Greater Weird is the world's only conference focusing on contemporary Weird fiction, film and art. Our mission is to foster conversation and connect communities among a diverse slate of program participants who create in the umbrella of speculative fiction—inclusive, safe and welcoming to women, LBGTQ+, and writers of color. Hear all the readings and panels on The Outer Dark podcast, which airs on This Is Horror, reaching thousands of listeners who are readers of Weird and speculative fiction.

THE OUTER DARK SYMPOSIUM ON THE GREATER WEIRD 2020

NEW DATES! Friday August 14 & Saturday August 15, 10 a.m. – 10 p.m.

(DATE CHANGE DUE TO CORONAVIRUS International Crisis--See Our Updates for More Info)

Silver Scream FX Lab, 4215 Thurman Rd, Conley, Georgia 30288

Hotel Indigo-College Park, 1776 Harvard Ave, College Park, GA 30337

GUESTS/PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS: Mike Allen, Sara Amis, Natania Barron, Laura Blackwell, Gregory Norman Bossert, JS Breukelaar, Jesse Bullington, Chesya Burke, Benjamin Capps, Gerald Coleman, Nancy A. Collins, Jeanne D’Angelo, L.M. Davis, Milton Davis, Julie C. Day, Seb Doubinsky, Jeffrey Ford Chris Gavaler, Fiona Maeve Geist,  Larissa Glasser, Orrin Grey, Nick Gucker, Edward Austin Hall, Lynne Hansen, Brian Hauser, Alex Hofelich, Nicole Givens Kurtz, Matthew Jaffe, Valjeanne Jeffers, Gwendolyn Kiste, Carrie Laben, Tonya Liburd, Ian McDowell, Kyoko M, Violette L. Meier, Gabriela Damián Miravete,  Shane Morton, Hysop Mulero, Balogun Ojetade, Liv Rainey-Smith, Sarah Read, Sumiko Saulson, Eric Schaller, Jeff Strand, Brooke Warra, Kortney Watkins, Michael Wehunt, Lesley Wheeler, Gordon B. White, Robert S. Wilson, & teri.zin

ATTENDING PUBLISHERS: Mythic Delirium Press, Nightscape Press, PseudoPod

HOSTED BY:  Scott Nicolay & Anya Martin.

FOR MORE INFO: www.theouterdark.org, Facebook event page, follow us on Twitter and Instagram, and purchase attending memberships at Brown Paper Tickets.

Welcome to The Outer Dark on This Is Horror. I’m your host Scott Nicolay bringing you news and interviews with the creative talents who operate far beyond the edge of the firelight. There Are Weird Things Out Here, My Friends…

When we conceived The Outer Dark podcast in 2015, we never expected it to take off like it has and to mean so much to listeners. As the tendrils of the Weird spread further into speculative fiction, film, and TV, people kept asking me and Anya when we were going to do something more hands-on. Thus was born The Outer Dark Symposium on the Greater Weird.

At the inaugural The Outer Dark Symposium in 2017, we were humbled to assemble a blockbuster line-up of contemporary Weird writers, including members of the State of Black Science Fiction community. In 2018, we took the symposium West and dreamed bigger and spookier with the Winchester Mystery House, and in 2019, we brought it back to Atlanta to Silver Scream FX Lab, a location that’s all about the love of Weird monsters.

For the past three years, the symposium has been a labor of Weird love, only made possible through a combination of memberships, sponsorships, donations, and crowdsourcing. Our hope always has always been to simply break even and make this an annual event.

It takes a Weird Village to make Something Weird Happen.

THE OUTER DARK SYMPOSIUM happens because YOU supported us, allowing us to share these important conversations with YOU and the Whole Weird World on our host network This Is Horror. If you haven’t checked it out, you can find programming from all three past symposia, as well as interviews with our guests and other groundbreaking Weird Renaissance authors on The Outer Dark podcast. 

This year we’re thrilled to welcome our largest line-up yet, more than 50 of the most dynamic authors, editors, artists, publishers, and scholars in Weird fiction today. Yet our goal remains to keep the symposium immersive, intimate, and budget-responsible. Everyone attends all panels and readings and shares breakfast, lunch and dinner, as well as welcome and author signing receptions and social activities to continue the conversation into the night. While keeping the same feasible model that worked well for the previous two symposiums, this year we raised our attendance to 100 memberships so more people can participate, plus we  added an Educators Day on Friday including the inaugural Teaching Diversity in Weird and Speculative Fiction Roundtable, with a Friday-only deeply discounted ticket for educators and students.

We couldn’t assemble such an amazing line-up of program participants without waiving ticket fees and providing air and lodging support (approx. $7,000 or more than half our budget) to guests who needed support to participate, as well as covering meals, lodging, and gas for our hardworking volunteers. Other expenses include space rental, catering, audio equipment, badge printing/laminating, printing the program chapbook (offered to supporting members via this campaign), and other basic event expenses adding up to a total budget of about $13,500, even with every tactic of frugality that we can muster. By our calculations, calculating purchased memberships, sponsors and a few patrons that we have now, we need about $4,000 to break even. If by any unlikely chance, we do make any more than we need, that money will go straight back into seeding next year's symposium.

Therefore we are humbly reaching out to you again. Through this Indiegogo campaign, you can both help sustain The Outer Dark Symposium and receive cool rewards.

ALL supporters receive a The Outer Dark sticker and ALL $20 and up perks include a bonus ebook of For Mortal Things Unsung, Pseudopod's 10th anniversary anthology featuring stories by Orrin Grey, Damien Angelica Walters, Livia Llewellyn, Joe R. Lansdale & many more (a big thanks to Alex and Melissa Hofelich!). And every donation comes with the peace of mind that you helped make something Weird happen!

Here’s a taste of what’s available:

  • Support The Weird ($25). Can't attend but really want to make this happen? As a supporting member, you'll get our exclusive program chapbook, available otherwise only to attendees. This year’s book will be our biggest yet with approx. 140 pages of articles, fiction, and art by some of our guests and featuring a stunning original cover by Jeanne D’Angelo with lettering by Michael Bukowski. ALSO Supporting members’ copies will be signed by all attending contriburors. And we’ll throw in some stickers and other surprise symposium giveaways, so buy one for yourself and one for a Weird friend!
  • Stylish Weird ($20). This year we have 2 T-shirt designs! The Outer Dark podcast official T-shirt ($20) featuring our killer logo designed by “Nick the Hat” Gucker (men’s sizes S, M, L, XL; for 2XL, contact for availability). Plus 
  • Horror Movie Memorabilia! Three one-of-a-kind photos signed to The Outer Dark by Last-Universal-Monster-Swimming Ricou Browning (The Creature from the Black Lagoon), Lisa Loring (Wednesday Addams, The Addams Family TV series) and Scream Queen Linnea Quigley (“Trash,” Return of the Living Dead & more). Signatures happened at Days of the Dead Atlanta 2020, and we’d like to express our heartfelt thanks to Lisa, Ricou, and Linnea!   
  • Professional Editing Services! Robert S. Wilson of award-winning Nightscape Press is offering editorial services on your fiction up to 10,000 words.
  • BOOKS, BOOKS & MORE BOOKS! (various prices). All generously donated by our guests and by our publisher sponsors with the bonus that most will be SIGNED & PERSONALIZED. ALSO RARE COLLECTIBLE BOOKS, such as the ONLY existing publisher's uncorrected proof of Joel Lane's The Lost District generously donated by Undertow Publications! 

Keep checking back because we expect to add MANY MORE AMAZING BOOKS, ART and other WEIRD THINGS!

Finally, if you're a publisher or have a Weird-related product or service, sponsorship opportunities are another way to help. The Outer Dark thanks our 2020 sponsors: Argawarga Press, Broken Eye Books, Dark and Glow Press, Dim Shores, Eraserhead Press, Innsmouth Free Press, Kino Lorber, Mythic Delirium Press, Nightscape Press, Perpetual Motion Machine Publications, The Revelator, Signal Horizon, Skeleton Hat Podcast, Trepidatio Publishing, Undertow Publications, The Willows, Word Horde,  Grimscribe Press/Vastarien: A Literary Journal, and Tor Nightfire. Sponsorship opportunities are still available. Please drop a line to theouterdarkpodcast@gmail.com and we’ll be glad to provide you with cash and in-kind (we still welcome additional books and other items for this Indiegogo campaign!) options or to customize a plan that works for your promotional needs.

Don't you want to get Weird with us?

Whatever you can afford to help or even if you just share this campaign on social media, you have our deepest gratitude!

Warm, Weird regards,

 

Scott Nicolay & Anya Martin, Hosts/Producers

& The Outer Dark Collective

 

The Outer Dark Podcast & Symposium

www.theouterdark.org

THE OUTER DARK SYMPOSIUM ON THE GREATER WEIRD 2020
NEW DATES! Friday August 14 & Saturday August 15, 10 a.m. – 10 p.m.
(DATE CHANGE DUE TO CORONAVIRUS International Crisis--See Our Updates for More Info)
Silver Scream FX Lab, 4215 Thurman Rd, Conley, Georgia 30288
Hotel Indigo-College Park, 1776 Harvard Ave, College Park, GA 30337
GUESTS/PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS: Mike Allen, Sara Amis, Natania Barron, Laura Blackwell, Gregory Norman Bossert, JS Breukelaar, Jesse Bullington, Chesya Burke, Benjamin Capps, Gerald Coleman, Nancy A. Collins, Jeanne D’Angelo, L.M. Davis, Milton Davis, Julie C. Day, Seb Doubinsky, Jeffrey Ford Chris Gavaler, Fiona Maeve Geist,  Larissa Glasser, Orrin Grey, Nick Gucker, Edward Austin Hall, Lynne Hansen, Brian Hauser, Alex Hofelich, Nicole Givens Kurtz, Matthew Jaffe, Valjeanne Jeffers, Gwendolyn Kiste, Carrie Laben, Tonya Liburd, Ian McDowell, Kyoko M, Violette L. Meier, Gabriela Damián Miravete,  Shane Morton, Hysop Mulero, Balogun Ojetade, Liv Rainey-Smith, Sarah Read, Sumiko Saulson, Eric Schaller, Jeff Strand, Brooke Warra, Kortney Watkins, Michael Wehunt, Lesley Wheeler, Gordon B. White, Robert S. Wilson, & teri.zin
ATTENDING PUBLISHERS: Mythic Delirium Press, Nightscape Press, PseudoPod
HOSTED BY:  Scott Nicolay & Anya Martin.
FOR MORE INFO: www.theouterdark.org, Facebook event page, follow us on Twitter and Instagram, and purchase attending memberships at Brown Paper Tickets.
Welcome to The Outer Dark on This Is Horror. I’m your host Scott Nicolay bringing you news and interviews with the creative talents who operate far beyond the edge of the firelight. There Are Weird Things Out Here, My Friends…
When we conceived The Outer Dark podcast in 2015, we never expected it to take off like it has and to mean so much to listeners. As the tendrils of the Weird spread further into speculative fiction, film, and TV, people kept asking me and Anya when we were going to do something more hands-on. Thus was born The Outer Dark Symposium on the Greater Weird.
At the inaugural The Outer Dark Symposium in 2017, we were humbled to assemble a blockbuster line-up of contemporary Weird writers, including members of the State of Black Science Fiction community. In 2018, we took the symposium West and dreamed bigger and spookier with the Winchester Mystery House, and in 2019, we brought it back to Atlanta to Silver Scream FX Lab, a location that’s all about the love of Weird monsters.
For the past three years, the symposium has been a labor of Weird love, only made possible through a combination of memberships, sponsorships, donations, and crowdsourcing. Our hope always has always been to simply break even and make this an annual event.
It takes a Weird Village to make Something Weird Happen.
THE OUTER DARK SYMPOSIUM happens because YOU supported us, allowing us to share these important conversations with YOU and the Whole Weird World on our host network This Is Horror. If you haven’t checked it out, you can find programming from all three past symposia, as well as interviews with our guests and other groundbreaking Weird Renaissance authors on The Outer Dark podcast. 
This year we’re thrilled to welcome our largest line-up yet, more than 50 of the most dynamic authors, editors, artists, publishers, and scholars in Weird fiction today. Yet our goal remains to keep the symposium immersive, intimate, and budget-responsible. Everyone attends all panels and readings and shares breakfast, lunch and dinner, as well as welcome and author signing receptions and social activities to continue the conversation into the night. While keeping the same feasible model that worked well for the previous two symposiums, this year we raised our attendance to 100 memberships so more people can participate, plus we  added an Educators Day on Friday including the inaugural Teaching Diversity in Weird and Speculative Fiction Roundtable, with a Friday-only deeply discounted ticket for educators and students.
We couldn’t assemble such an amazing line-up of program participants without waiving ticket fees and providing air and lodging support (approx. $7,000 or more than half our budget) to guests who needed support to participate, as well as covering meals, lodging, and gas for our hardworking volunteers. Other expenses include space rental, catering, audio equipment, badge printing/laminating, printing the program chapbook (offered to supporting members via this campaign), and other basic event expenses adding up to a total budget of about $13,500, even with every tactic of frugality that we can muster. By our calculations, calculating purchased memberships, sponsors and a few patrons that we have now, we need about $4,000 to break even. If by any unlikely chance, we do make any more than we need, that money will go straight back into seeding next year's symposium.
Therefore we are humbly reaching out to you again. Through this Indiegogo campaign, you can both help sustain The Outer Dark Symposium and receive cool rewards. 
ALL supporters receive a The Outer Dark sticker and ALL $20 and up perks include a bonus ebook of For Mortal Things Unsung, Pseudopod's 10th anniversary anthology featuring stories by Orrin Grey, Damien Angelica Walters, Livia Llewellyn, Joe R. Lansdale & many more (a big thanks to Alex and Melissa Hofelich!). And every donation comes with the peace of mind that you helped make something Weird happen!
Here’s a taste of what’s available:


Support The Weird ($25). Can't attend but really want to make this happen? As a supporting member, you'll get our exclusive program chapbook, available otherwise only to attendees. This year’s book will be our biggest yet with approx. 140 pages of articles, fiction, and art by some of our guests and featuring a stunning original cover by Jeanne D’Angelo with lettering by Michael Bukowski. ALSO Supporting members’ copies will be signed by all attending contriburors. And we’ll throw in some stickers and other surprise symposium giveaways, so buy one for yourself and one for a Weird friend!

Stylish Weird ($20). This year we have 2 T-shirt designs! The Outer Dark podcast official T-shirt ($20) featuring our killer logo designed by “Nick the Hat” Gucker (men’s sizes S, M, L, XL; for 2XL, contact for availability). Plus 

Horror Movie Memorabilia! Three one-of-a-kind photos signed to The Outer Dark by Last-Universal-Monster-Swimming Ricou Browning (The Creature from the Black Lagoon), Lisa Loring (Wednesday Addams, The Addams Family TV series) and Scream Queen Linnea Quigley (“Trash,” Return of the Living Dead & more). Signatures happened at Days of the Dead Atlanta 2020, and we’d like to express our heartfelt thanks to Lisa, Ricou, and Linnea!   

Professional Editing Services! Robert S. Wilson of award-winning Nightscape Press is offering editorial services on your fiction up to 10,000 words.

BOOKS, BOOKS & MORE BOOKS! (various prices). All generously donated by our guests and by our publisher sponsors with the bonus that most will be SIGNED & PERSONALIZED. ALSO RARE COLLECTIBLE BOOKS, such as the ONLY existing publisher's uncorrected proof of Joel Lane's The Lost District generously donated by Undertow Publications! 

Keep checking back because we expect to add MANY MORE AMAZING BOOKS, ART and other WEIRD THINGS!
Finally, if you're a publisher or have a Weird-related product or service, sponsorship opportunities are another way to help. The Outer Dark thanks our 2020 sponsors: Argawarga Press, Broken Eye Books, Dark and Glow Press, Dim Shores, Eraserhead Press, Innsmouth Free Press, Kino Lorber, Mythic Delirium Press, Nightscape Press, Perpetual Motion Machine Publications, The Revelator, Signal Horizon, Skeleton Hat Podcast, Trepidatio Publishing, Undertow Publications, The Willows, Word Horde,  Grimscribe Press/Vastarien: A Literary Journal, and Tor Nightfire. Sponsorship opportunities are still available. Please drop a line to theouterdarkpodcast@gmail.com and we’ll be glad to provide you with cash and in-kind (we still welcome additional books and other items for this Indiegogo campaign!) options or to customize a plan that works for your promotional needs.
Don't you want to get Weird with us?
Whatever you can afford to help or even if you just share this campaign on social media, you have our deepest gratitude!
Warm, Weird regards,
 
Scott Nicolay & Anya Martin, Hosts/Producers
& The Outer Dark Collective
 
The Outer Dark Podcast & Symposium
www.theouterdark.org

story:
D-Day: The date on which nearly 160,000 Allied troops stormed the fields and beaches of Normandy to start the liberation of Western Europe. The seaborne assault was preceded by 13,000 airborne troops who parachuted in or came by glider in the dead of night. The formidable Douglas C-47 Skytrain (Dakota) led the airborne assault, made up of more than 800 aircraft. As many as 4,413 Allied troops died on the day of the invasion. By the end of D-Day, the Allies had established a foothold in France. Within 11 months, Nazi Germany was defeated.  

On June 5, 2019, 21 C-47 Dakota aircraft departed Duxford, England setting course for Normandy to commemorate the D-Day invasion. WWII fighters and 'photo ship' aircraft brought the cross-channel armada numbers up to 30. In France, thousands gathered to watch a spectacular recreation of the airdrop that took place over Normandy on D-Day. Together, 10 C-47 Dakotas carried close to 200 men and women who made the jump near Sannerville, France into Drop Zone K. Those who jumped were equipped with uniforms and parachutes styled after 1944 Allied paratroopers, lending authenticity to the event.  

 

 

History in the Making – Join Us

Now you can experience one of the largest commemorations of this historic day, and one of the last opportunities for surviving D-Day veterans who paid so much to liberate Europe to be recognized on the world stage. The campaign is based on a 104-page book commemorating the 75th anniversary of D-Day, focusing on the airborne operations. The world came together this year to create a fitting tribute to the Great Crusade, which changed the course of WWII and history itself.

 

 

Limited Edition Photo Book

We’re sourcing some of the best historical photos to set the stage, and also bringing in some of the top aviation photographers in the world to provide photos of the June 2 to 9 events. The options for your copy of the photo book include:

  • 9 x 12 inches (23 x 30 cm) soft cover
  • 9 x 12 inches (23 x 30 cm) hard cover
  • 9 x 12 inches (23 x 30 cm) hard cover with two custom pages
  • 9 x 12 inches (23 x 30 cm) hard cover with four custom pages
  • 9 x 12 inches (23 x 30 cm) leather cover with four custom pages

 

Click here to check out a preview of the book:

 

The book will ship anywhere in the world. One of the options we are most excited about is the opportunity to honor a veteran in the book. You can choose perk levels that include a custom copy of the book for you, your company, or a veteran in your family, with two to four custom pages added to the book. 

The photo book features events at Oxford-Waterbury airport in the U.S., Duxford Airfield in the United Kingdom, and the paratrooper mass jump over Sannerville in Normandy, France. The IndieGogo project is initiated by Five Oaks Creative - a results-driven marketing firm with a focus on fundraising, communications and marketing with 35 years of experience in the non-profit world. 

The Five Oaks Creative team worked on three successful crowdfunding campaigns benefiting historical preservation of WWII aircraft, totaling more than $450,000:

  • Save the Airplane that Led the D-Day Invasion 
  • Trailblazing Women Pilots – Honoring the WASP 
  • Operation 107 | B-25 Bomber Yellow Rose

 

The team has completed projects benefiting non-profit organizations in more than 50 countries on every continent, except Antarctica… and they haven’t ruled that out yet.

story:
About Us + Our Project

We (Kate Bebo and Micky Cohrs) are sisters embarking on our first journey into children's book self-publishing.  Every weekend, we get together with our family for dinner and spin fantastical stories about our dogs and the hijinks they would get into if they had more thumbs and fewer human-imposed restrictions.

Micky is an artist and will be illustrating the book.  Kate is a Registered Nurse with an affinity for writing and storytelling.  Our first book, "Tilly the Weregirl" is all about Tilly, a beagle based on Kate's dog, and her best human friend, Elle.  They do everything together, but there are some challenges due to Tilly's dogness.  After a visit from a unique and furry fairy, their lives are changed forever under the full moon when all of Tilly and Elle's wildest dreams come true.

Though we probably won't be meeting a mystical creature any time soon, we do believe our dreams will come true too by publishing this story that is so important to us.  We have been telling ourselves this story for years, and now it's time to share Tilly with the world.

With self-publishing, we are in full creative and financial control of our project.  This gives us a lot of peace of mind knowing that a publisher won't attempt to override our vision for our book.

What We Need + What You Get

Self-publishing is very expensive!  Our goal of $2,000 will allow us to afford:

- Professional editing
- Copyrights
- International Standard Book Numbers (ISBNs)
- Children's book template software
- Registration with our self-publishing company
- Marketing services

By contributing to our campaign, you can pre-order our book, either in paperback or hardcover, get a set of cute "Weregirl" character stickers or a bundle of both.  Stickers will be available right away but the book will be ready and going to print in early 2022.

Let's say we don't meet our funding goal.  That's ok!  The beauty of Indigogo is that we get to keep any funding we get, even if we don't meet the full goal so we can use any support we get to make it happen and you still get the product you paid for!  Being fully funded would simply mean that the production process would be quicker and you would get your pre-orders sooner.

Risks + Challenges

The only risk would be not completely funding our campaign and in that case, the only challenge being self-funding the rest of the project.

We would be able to do it over time, but it would certainly be a challenge.  With time, we would be able to find the funds necessary.

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from contributing to our campaign, there are some other ways that you can support us:

- Share our Indiegogo campaign on social media
- Visit our Instagram (@tillytheweregirl), engage, and share our content!
- Visit our website (tillytheweregirl.com)

story:
'Iris' Book Series Spring & Summer Tour for 2015

The release of "Iris: Destiny" and "Iris 2: Fate" approach with the new year, and with it comes an attractive slate of conventions, bookstores and much more across the Southeast United States.

  • I am the author, Joey Daniel Carr, and I am pleased to announce the release of a revised "Iris: Destiny" along with "Iris 2: Fate" with the new year! Thank you for taking the time to find this page. I've been working on this series for a lot of years and it's a universe that I am eager to share with readers!
  • To share this story I have to actively get out and show people. To do that it takes an incredibly committed and talented team that deserves to eat and sleep now and again. From social networking to public appearances, it's a coordinated effort to get to the events, have materials prepared, among countless other things. There's no way we can do it without you...

From this page you can get updates and info about the book series and the author, or find ways to be a part of it. Please feel free to read more about "Iris: Destiny" or "Iris 2: Fate".

What We Need & What You Get

Below you'll find a list of Conventions, bookstores, libraries, etc. that are on schedule to visit during the tour (All dates 2015):

  • Omni Expo (Orlando, FL) - May 22-24
  • Momo Con (Atlanta, GA) - May 28-31
  • Akai Con (Franklin, TN) - Aug. 7-9
  • Dragon Con (Atlanta, GA) - Sept 4-7
  • That's a lot of traveling and A LOT of books! 600 books, in fact- 300 of each volume, 1 & 2. This is just one of a list of materials that are reviewed in the video. These things don't get taken care of without the support of you, readers willing to embark on this adventure that I've spent the majority of my life crafting. It's so much more than just a book series...
  • We are excited about your support, so there are some ways we want to say thank you. That includes but is not limited to signed copies of the books, VIP luncheons, logo or business sponsors, access to updates, and much more.
  • All of your support goes directly to getting the books where they need to go- into the hands of the readers. This means traveling/lodging expenses, booking a booth, ordering books, materials like signs/cards/refreshments/etc. After all expenses, proceeds will go into a fund for "Season of Love Charity Event" that will sponsor a benefactor in 2016.

The Impact

Have you ever been to Universal Orlando and seen the attractions for Harry Potter? Walk a little further along and you'll see Jurassic Park. When I walk through that, I see my characters from 'Iris'.

Have you ever heard two people arguing about what planet an alien language came from in the Star Wars universe? I want people to discuss the story arcs and the different forms of media that the universe is presented to you in. I want people to fall in love with my characters as much as I have fallen in love with creating them. The potential for 'Iris' is much more than a book series and this is such a small step in an adventure that I invite you to be a part of.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can help us share this story by sharing the links on the page and coming out to see us if we come close to you. Also, let us know if your city is not listed above and you would like us to try to head that way!
  • You can share this page or other 'Iris' links with the widgets above. We appreciate your support and I am excited to share the story of Colin Craft, the Newspaper Myth with everyone.

story:
Cloudman, the Superhero, is the product of the book," Adventures In Vangoland: The Rise Against Evil"





David Draves Talking About Vangoland Theme Park


This book is available under one of the perks when you support "Adventures In Vangoland: The Rise Against Evil." 

About Me

My name is Sonny Walebowa.  I am a storyteller from Botswana who currently resides in California, USA with my wife and  daughter. I have been writing stories & poetry since my high school years. The frailty of humanity inspires me the most. My passion led me to film school so I could turn my stories into motion pictures. Since graduation, I have written three books - one narrated with original music - along with creating other multi-media projects.  Adventures in Vangoland: The Rise against Evil is the project nearest to my heart. 


Inspiring Young Readers to Become Leaders

This project has its roots in the shock and anger I felt after the 911 attack. Like many,  I was left  asking God questions about evil in the world.  Years later, as I studied Executive Leadership and Human Services for my Masters Degree, I learned methods of developing resilience and emotional intelligence along with community building and effective leadership. What better way to empower our youth than to incorporate these principles in storytelling?

Adventures in Vangoland: The Rise against Evil was born. It addresses how we can be leaders and overcome evil. Through the story in all its manifestations, we can inspire readers to become leaders who walk in love.  

The Story

Manhattan, a loner and an aspiring young writer from Brooklyn, travels to the historic Tsodilo Hills in Botswana. When a cave adorned with prehistoric paintings mysteriously transports him into a land in peril– Vangoland - he finds himself facing doom in an animal kingdom.

In Vangoland, the purity of the King’s heart is critical to survival. His blood must anoint the next king. The animals in his kingdom rely on his relationship with the Creator to prosper their surroundings. Until now.

Manhattan encounters a selfish and stubborn King. The land is dry and water is retreating into the underground abyss. Manhattan is their greatest hope to persuade the king.

Meanwhile, Beelz, the power hungry evil serpent, will stop at nothing to take over Vangoland. He lures a vulnerable young hare, from the animal kingdom away his community and into his snares. He plots his crushing strategy from Mount Fear with his deadly dragon sidekick.


Angelix, the spirit-led dove can help Manhattan get home – but she won’t until evil is defeated. Self-sacrificing, Manhattan climbs Mount Fear for his greatest challenge ever. The fierce battle will decide his fate and the future of Vangoland.

First Goal: The Book 
The book is written, the proof is in - 455 pages, 38 chapters of adventure. The story is set in a fictional kingdom inspired by the real Okavango Delta. This is a breathtaking and pristine region in the Southern African country of Botswana. 
The book is ready to print and has been adapted into a screenplay for movie production. Not only that, I'm working with David Graves, President and Partner of Mirage Entertainment along with architects, engineers, and the tourism board of my native country, Botswana, to build a theme park based on the story. It's exciting how technology is opening new frontiers for creating and sharing. 

What Do We Need?

Our initial goal of $15,000 will help fund the following:

  • A professionally printed and handsome hardback edition of the book
  • A solid, beautiful soft cover edition
  •  T shirts with graphics from the book
  • Recording songs and poems with drum ensemble
  • Marketing
These will be distribute at local bookstores, book fairs, and community events.

What do you get?

Depending on your pledge you will receive a copy of the book in multiple formats. Your name can even appear in the next book. Depending on the type of a perk, you will receive a publication credit on our website on the book's page. You will become the family of the trilogy.

The Impact You Will Make

Without you, this project will not be printed and distributed, but this process is an important first step in the transmedia development. The book is pure entertainment, yet is loaded with moral values. In fact, this project is designed to inspire leadership and emotional intelligence in young readers.  That is why your contribution is valuable and much appreciated. Lastly, by crowd funding, you are empowering authorship outside of traditional publishing houses and media outlets so that storytellers like myself can focus on our craft.



STRETCH GOALS: The Movie and Theme Park 

Beyond our initial goal, we will begin  preparing the feasibility studies for the theme park and break down the screenplay to begin developing the movie. 

Other Ways to Help:

Please spread the word! Tweet this page, leave comments,  like and  mention it on Facebook. Sign our guestbook at www.vangoland.com and Mention the handle, @Vangoland, and I'll happily retweet your comments!  You can also follow and re-pin our posts and boards on Pinterest. Want to ask anything? Email, me at walebowa@gmail.com.



Fun Facts About Botswana: 

  1. Botswana is a country in the continent of Africa

  2. Botswana is landlocked and is located just north of South Africa. It is known for Luxury safari camps are common, and wildlife, including hippos lions, leopards, elephants, giraffes, meerkats, hyenas, zebras, and black and white rhinos.

  3. Capital: Gaborone

  4. Population: 2.021 million (2013) World Bank

  5. President: The Honorable Ian Khama

  6. Official languages: Tswana, English
  7. On person from Botswana is called a Motswana. More than one person from Botswana are referred to as Batswana. 

  8. Miss Universe 1999, Mpule Kwelagobe, is from Botswana
  9. The No. 1 Ladies Detective Agency is a series of novels written by Alexander McCall Smith and set in Botswana. The novels were adapted into an HBO TV Series of the same name, starring Jill Scott.
story_txt:
Cloudman, the Superhero, is the product of the book," Adventures In Vangoland: The Rise Against Evil"David Draves Talking About Vangoland Theme ParkThis book is available under one of the perks when you support "Adventures In Vangoland: The Rise Against Evil." About MeMy name is Sonny Walebowa.  I am a storyteller from Botswana who currently resides in California, USA with my wife and  daughter. I have been writing stories & poetry since my high school years. The frailty of humanity inspires me the most. My passion led me to film school so I could turn my stories into motion pictures. Since graduation, I have written three books - one narrated with original music - along with creating other multi-media projects.  Adventures in Vangoland: The Rise against Evil is the project nearest to my heart. Inspiring Young Readers to Become LeadersThis project has its roots in the shock and anger I felt after the 911 attack. Like many,  I was left  asking God questions about evil in the world.  Years later, as I studied Executive Leadership and Human Services for my Masters Degree, I learned methods of developing resilience and emotional intelligence along with community building and effective leadership. What better way to empower our youth than to incorporate these principles in storytelling?Adventures in Vangoland: The Rise against Evil was born. It addresses how we can be leaders and overcome evil. Through the story in all its manifestations, we can inspire readers to become leaders who walk in love.  The StoryManhattan, a loner and an aspiring young writer from Brooklyn, travels to the historic Tsodilo Hills in Botswana. When a cave adorned with prehistoric paintings mysteriously transports him into a land in peril– Vangoland - he finds himself facing doom in an animal kingdom.In Vangoland, the purity of the King’s heart is critical to survival. His blood must anoint the next king. The animals in his kingdom rely on his relationship with the Creator to prosper their surroundings. Until now.Manhattan encounters a selfish and stubborn King. The land is dry and water is retreating into the underground abyss. Manhattan is their greatest hope to persuade the king.Meanwhile, Beelz, the power hungry evil serpent, will stop at nothing to take over Vangoland. He lures a vulnerable young hare, from the animal kingdom away his community and into his snares. He plots his crushing strategy from Mount Fear with his deadly dragon sidekick.Angelix, the spirit-led dove can help Manhattan get home – but she won’t until evil is defeated. Self-sacrificing, Manhattan climbs Mount Fear for his greatest challenge ever. The fierce battle will decide his fate and the future of Vangoland.
First Goal: The Book 

The book is written, the proof is in - 455 pages, 38 chapters of adventure. The story is set in a fictional kingdom inspired by the real Okavango Delta. This is a breathtaking and pristine region in the Southern African country of Botswana. 


The book is ready to print and has been adapted into a screenplay for movie production. Not only that, I'm working with David Graves, President and Partner of Mirage Entertainment along with architects, engineers, and the tourism board of my native country, Botswana, to build a theme park based on the story. It's exciting how technology is opening new frontiers for creating and sharing. 




What Do We Need?
Our initial goal of $15,000 will help fund the following:

A professionally printed and handsome hardback edition of the book
A solid, beautiful soft cover edition
 T shirts with graphics from the book
Recording songs and poems with drum ensemble
Marketing

These will be distribute at local bookstores, book fairs, and community events.

What do you get?
 Depending on your pledge you will receive a copy of the book in multiple formats. Your name can even appear in the next book. Depending on the type of a perk, you will receive a publication credit on our website on the book's page. You will become the family of the trilogy.
The Impact You Will Make
Without you, this project will not be printed and distributed, but this process is an important first step in the transmedia development. The book is pure entertainment, yet is loaded with moral values. In fact, this project is designed to inspire leadership and emotional intelligence in young readers.  That is why your contribution is valuable and much appreciated. Lastly, by crowd funding, you are empowering authorship outside of traditional publishing houses and media outlets so that storytellers like myself can focus on our craft.



STRETCH GOALS: The Movie and Theme Park 
Beyond our initial goal, we will begin  preparing the feasibility studies for the theme park and break down the screenplay to begin developing the movie. 
Other Ways to Help:
Please spread the word! Tweet this page, leave comments,  like and  mention it on Facebook. Sign our guestbook at www.vangoland.com and Mention the handle, @Vangoland, and I'll happily retweet your comments!  You can also follow and re-pin our posts and boards on Pinterest. Want to ask anything? Email, me at walebowa@gmail.com.


Fun Facts About Botswana: 




Botswana is a country in the continent of Africa




Botswana is landlocked and is located just north of South Africa. It is known for Luxury safari camps are common, and wildlife, including hippos lions, leopards, elephants, giraffes, meerkats, hyenas, zebras, and black and white rhinos.





Capital: Gaborone





Population: 2.021 million (2013) World Bank





President: The Honorable Ian Khama





Official languages: Tswana, English


On person from Botswana is called a Motswana. More than one person from Botswana are referred to as Batswana. 

Miss Universe 1999, Mpule Kwelagobe, is from Botswana

The No. 1 Ladies Detective Agency is a series of novels written by Alexander McCall Smith and set in Botswana. The novels were adapted into an HBO TV Series of the same name, starring Jill Scott.

story:
ABOUT THE BOOK: 

IMPRESARIO: Earl Carroll, Beryl Wallace, and the Most Beautiful Girls in the World is the story of libertine stage impresario Earl Carroll and his love affair with star showgirl and faithful, longtime companion Beryl Wallace. This new authoritative work traces the couple’s life stories and that of the theatre itself as the place to see and be seen in 1940s Hollywood. For the first time, the real story of ravishing Beryl’s steadfast adoration of the theatrical genius nearly twenty years her senior is revealed. Through stories, anecdotes, and dozens of rare and never-before-seen photographs, the history of this “entertainment palace” and its cavalcade of stars comes to vivid life in IMPRESARIO.

He’s been called “the troubadour of the nude,” “the impresario of feminine epidermis,” “the elongated purveyor of feminine pulchritude,” and “the most notorious connoisseur of female flesh in the history of show business.” Earl Carroll was Florenz Ziegfeld’s only real competition on the Great White Way in the late 1920s and early 1930s. The Earl Carroll Vanities were known for their over-the-top, Follies-like grandeur, and even more so for the amount of exposed flesh. In 1926, Carroll was sentenced to a year and a day in prison following a much-publicized stunt involving a naked beauty bathing in a bathtub full of illegal champagne on the stage of his New York theatre. He eventually went bankrupt and left Broadway under a cloud of scandal.

Looking for a fresh start and determined to reinvent himself in Hollywood, Earl Carroll opened his colossal eponymous theatre at 6230 Sunset Boulevard on December 26, 1938. The 1,000-seat showplace quickly became known for the glory and gaiety of its grandiose productions featuring casts of sixty girls performing atop a double revolving stage. Guests were dazzled by more than 6,000 feet of blue and gold neon, and massive, illuminated columns reaching thirty feet in the air. Hollywood powerhouses including Darryl Zanuck, Walt Disney, Harold Lloyd, Bing Crosby, Cecil B. DeMille, and Louis B. Mayer were among those who paid upwards of $1,000 each for VIP memberships to Carroll’s “Inner Circle” guaranteeing reserved seating for the opening night gala and a lifetime cover charge.

While it was Carroll’s behind-the-scenes puppeteering that powered the operation, it was striking beauty Beryl Wallace whose face characterized the Earl Carroll Theatre to the world. Not only was she the star showgirl in all of Carroll’s lavish musical comedy revues, Beryl was his devoted, longtime companion. “Through these portals pass the most beautiful girls in the world,” the theatre’s celebrated slogan, was emblazoned atop a twenty-four-foot neon silhouette portrait of the stunning showgirl. Illuminating Sunset Boulevard and Carroll’s “Wall of Fame” (featuring the signatures of Hollywood royalty etched in concrete), the dazzling sign soon became one of Hollywood’s most famous landmarks and a beacon for servicemen on leave during World War II.


Following the war’s end and after nearly a decade in Hollywood, Earl Carroll unveiled his plans to build the “World’s Largest Motion Picture Theatre and Broadcasting Studios.” The $15,000,000 structure would be erected a half-block east of the existing theatre on Sunset. Larger than Radio City Music Hall, the blueprints for the 7,000 seat theatre touted a 130-foot proscenium, three revolving stages, and an ice rink adjacent to a water tank, purportedly so that both Sonja Henie and Esther Williams could perform simultaneously while surrounded by more than 100 dancing girls. But tragedy struck and brought the expansion to a halt. When United Airlines Flight 624 crashed in Pennsylvania on June 17, 1948, Earl Carroll and Beryl Wallace were among the 43 killed instantly. In true Carroll “show must go on” fashion, the grieving showgirls took to the stage that night and presented the Earl Carroll Vanities. Without mastermind Carroll and leading lady Beryl at the helm, the theatre operated in the red for more than a year. The Vanities came to a close on October 15, 1949, and the Earl Carroll Theatre went dark.

The facility reopened in 1953 as the Moulin Rouge nightclub and went through a number of incarnations (Hullabaloo, Kaleidoscope, Aquarius and Longhorn Theatres) before becoming the west coast production hub for the Nickelodeon cable network in 1997. Thanks to the tireless work of Hollywood preservationists, the Earl Carroll Theatre received landmark designation as a Historic-Cultural Monument in December 2016, meaning the property will be protected from demolition and eventually restored to its art deco glory. The legendary “Through these portals. . .” sign will most likely return to the building’s façade, but until then a replica of Beryl Wallace’s neon portrait created by the Museum of Neon Art remains on display and is seen by thousands who pass through the portals of Universal CityWalk every day.

IMPRESARIO: Earl Carroll, Beryl Wallace, and the Most Beautiful Girls in the World Hollywood is the definitive recalling of this untapped goldmine of Hollywood history for longtime movieland enthusiasts and generations of curious new fans to come. For this book, Randy L. Schmidt has spent more than five years meticulously researching the lives Earl Carroll and Beryl Wallace with the full cooperation of their families and the generous support of their extensive archives. Literally thousands of papers and photographs have been made available to this project, in addition to hundreds of articles of memorabilia and supporting mementos.

IMPRESARIO is the first book to:

  • independently and collectively profile Earl Carroll and Beryl Wallace, and explore the complex and fascinating love affair of the life companions who never married. “Wife is a four-letter word,” Beryl was known to say.
  • interview members of the Earl Carroll and Beryl Wallace families (including Beryl’s only surviving sibling who shared a home with the showgirl during the theatre’s heyday).
  • detail the Earl Carroll Theatre’s revues, music, choreography, costumes, and every extraordinary aspect of the grand showplace.
  • tell the stories of dozens of comedians, dancers, singers, and vaudevillians who played a part in this fascinating history (including Busby Berkeley, W.C. Fields, Vincente Minnelli, Spike Jones, Yvonne de Carlo, Lucille Ball, Ken Murray, Jack Oakie, and many others).
  • discuss the theatre’s role in catering to World War II servicemen, particularly Beryl Wallace’s part in engaging and entertaining the troops, both at the theatre and the popular Hollywood Canteen.
  • collect and present the stunning portraiture of Beryl Wallace and the other “most beautiful girls in the world” by famed Hollywood glamour photographer John E. Reed and others.
  • explore the details of the tragic crash of United Airlines Flight 624 in 1948, which instantly killed both Carroll and Wallace.
  • tell of the 1949 suicide of Beryl Wallace’s mother Fannie, who battled severe depression following her daughter’s untimely death.
  • sort through the legal issues and court battles surrounding the estates of Earl Carroll and Beryl Wallace.
  • trace the chronology and history of the theatre’s incarnations since it went dark in 1949.
 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR:

Randy L. Schmidt is the author of the critically-acclaimed Little Girl Blue: The Life of Karen Carpenter, a New York Times Editor's Choice and Wall Street Journal Best Seller. He also compiled and edited Yesterday Once More: The Carpenters Reader, Judy Garland on Judy Garland: Interviews and Encounters, and Dolly on Dolly: Interviews and Encounters with Dolly Parton. He has served as creative consultant for several television documentaries on the Carpenters, including the E! "True Hollywood Story," A&E's "Biography," and VH1's "Behind the Music." Schmidt teaches music in Denton, Texas.

ABOUT THE FUNDS:

IMPRESARIO will be published in the "Hollywood Legends" series from the University Press of Mississippi. It will be my first book published through a scholarly press, which is certainly exciting, but most university presses are non-profits, which means the budgets is very slim. I have been working on this book off and on for over five years and using my own funds, but your help is needed to take this project to the next level. I hope you will consider donating to the fundraising campaign.  

The money raised in this fundraiser will go towards the expenses related to:

  • Photo licensing fees
  • Extensive document/image scanning and misc. expenses
  • Travel expenses for additional research and interviews
  • Publicity and marketing campaign

Any funds raised in excess of the goal will go toward additional publicity and marketing.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Travel vouchers (hotel and/or airline) can go a long way to help in the research process. Please contact me directly if you're able to assist in this way. Your generosity is greatly appreciated and will be rewarded with one of the incentive packages equal in value to your contribution.

Whether you can make a donation or not, please help SPREAD THE WORD! Share the campaign on Facebook and Twitter, and Email family and friends the link to this page: https://igg.me/at/impresariobook

story:
Who are the authors?

Noteworthy Tribute is a book that has been "under construction" since 1998. Here's a little bit about the father & son team of authors who you would be supporting.

  • Hi, I'm a husband and father with four sons. As a father, my first goal is to nurture the potential that resides in my sons. I also enjoy developing others and I have used my talents and gifts in the work world of private industry and the federal government where I currently perform training, organizational development, executive coaching, team building, and various assessments. I've found that telling stories is a way to help move people forward, as another form of "show vs. tell".

 

  • Hey, I'm Josiah, the oldest son. I'm a "budding" screenwriter, currently a senior at Towson University majoring in media/film. I am a member of the media and film society Lambda Kappa Tau, Alpha Chapter. I have served as an Assistant Director, for Independent film projects Waging War; Z Is For Zebra, The 48 Hour Film Competition and Bait & Switch.  My Co-Writing credits include the Independent film Waging War, and Bait & Switch, as well, the Lambda Kappa Tau 48 hour film, Levels. I think an ability to understand and connect with fictional characters can teach us to emphasize and grow with people in the real world.

See more on our website...https://www.facebook.com/JoMarkCreative?ref=aymt_homepage_panel

This campaign to bring the book Noteworthy Tribute to print, is important because we have this enormous opportunity to share about people coming-of-age. Finally, we are nearing the finish line and about to see our "baby" born. You'll be helping us respond to the numerous requests we've already received for this book.

Early Praise!

"I thought it was an easy read and easy to follow. You guys did well with the details and it was easy to visualize each scene that took place in the book. Keep up the good work." Taylor M., Rome, Georgia (Twentysomething)
"Interested, I want to read more." Adam M., Illinois. (Prologue and first three chapters rated 4 out of 5 stars...)

Support

Here are the costs we anticipate:

    • Editorial fees
    • Copyright registration
    • Marketing Posters
    • Set-up costs for printing
    • eBook conversion
    • Paperback printing
    • Shipping
    • Campaign fees
    .

If we do not reach our entire funding goal we intend to adjust where we can i.e. perks, and with reduced expectations i.e. high costs of editing, marketing, shipping. 

The Impact

We believe strongly in the importance of generational relationships. This project is an opportunity for us to further demonstrate that belief. We are the message! We have already found that others have noticed the "footprint" that we are making and they are encouraging us to "walk" this path further.

  • The story is initiated by the relationship between family members and grows to include others. We use story to show how relationships can progress beyond boundaries.
  • This project itself is a father and son(s) project; think about it, we actually wrote a novel together.
  • The musical group, The Mustangz, (in the story and our actual "family" band) includes various generations.
  • This is not only a coming-of-age story for young adults but also for their parents.
  • More than 10-15 mothers (pre-release versions & focus groups) have already been encouraged by this story.
  • The co-author son, is a media/film major in college with multiple Dean's List accolades. He has successfully written, directed, acted, in multiple movies. He can tell a good story.
  • This is an entertaining story without baggage (a good family read).
  • We found that by telling this story, we have created a platform for others to further pursue their passions and exercise their gifts i.e. videography, editing services, recording studio, audio production, camera ready artwork, featured vocalist.
  • The story demonstrates how generations can work through issues together. 

Perks

FYI, all perks should be interpreted as our thank you gifts for your donations, and not the purchase of goods and/or services from us.

Potential Obstacles to Overcome

Here are some of the challenges that we face and how we intend to address them.

  • We are concerned about appropriate "perks".
  • We have chosen to lean towards "developmental" perks which is consistent with our general website JoMarkCreative where the focus is on helping develop others.
  • Meeting our funding goal concerns us.
  • We'll adjust by: Obtaining "free" ISBN and relinquishing some publishing rights; Distributing PDF versions for a significantly longer period of time.

Thanks for YOUR Support

Some of you have been very creative and innovative regarding your support, there are so many ways to contribute:

  • Share Noteworthy Tribute FB page on your FB page and other social media outlets.
  • Call us for Podcast interviews.
  • Write a review of the pre-release version, see our FB page.
  • Have us speak at your book club.
  • Contribute financially.
  • Share the news about this book at your school, with those which you fellowship with.
  • Recommend us for radio interviews.

Thank YOU!!

If we do not reach our entire funding goal we intend to adjust where we can i.e. perks, and with reduced expectations i.e. high costs of editing, marketing, shipping. The ImpactWe believe strongly in the importance of generational relationships. This project is an opportunity for us to further demonstrate that belief. We are the message! We have already found that others have noticed the "footprint" that we are making and they are encouraging us to "walk" this path further.
The story is initiated by the relationship between family members and grows to include others. We use story to show how relationships can progress beyond boundaries.
This project itself is a father and son(s) project; think about it, we actually wrote a novel together.
The musical group, The Mustangz, (in the story and our actual "family" band) includes various generations.
This is not only a coming-of-age story for young adults but also for their parents.
More than 10-15 mothers (pre-release versions & focus groups) have already been encouraged by this story.
The co-author son, is a media/film major in college with multiple Dean's List accolades. He has successfully written, directed, acted, in multiple movies. He can tell a good story.
This is an entertaining story without baggage (a good family read).
We found that by telling this story, we have created a platform for others to further pursue their passions and exercise their gifts i.e. videography, editing services, recording studio, audio production, camera ready artwork, featured vocalist.
The story demonstrates how generations can work through issues together. 
PerksFYI, all perks should be interpreted as our thank you gifts for your donations, and not the purchase of goods and/or services from us.
Potential Obstacles to OvercomeHere are some of the challenges that we face and how we intend to address them.
We are concerned about appropriate "perks".
We have chosen to lean towards "developmental" perks which is consistent with our general website JoMarkCreative where the focus is on helping develop others.
Meeting our funding goal concerns us.
We'll adjust by: Obtaining "free" ISBN and relinquishing some publishing rights; Distributing PDF versions for a significantly longer period of time.
